Again, this TV is setup in my bedroom so  a screen larger than 46" is somewhat impractical for me. Overall though, I like this TV. I especially liked the price. The UN46F7500 I am sure is a nicer TV, but I could not justify paying another $400 minimum for a TV the same size that has a few more options available. Anyway, that is my review and I hoped it is somewhat helpful.

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: janet towbin
Reviews.Content: This Samsung Smart TV has incredibly crisp picture quality and overall is a great television. We are very pleased with it. The price was competitive and the delivery/set-up awesome.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46F7100
Reviews.Author: Jon R Noland
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture.  Up scaling 2D to 3D quite good. The only thing I don't like is the remote. Touchpad doesn't work that well, nor does voice recognition. There should be a separate button to return to the previous channel

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: David Warhaftig
Reviews.Content: I have had the set about a 2 weeks and am very happy with it.  I calibrated it using the first helpful reviewer's settings and it really pops.  I am running sound through my Denon AVR E300 receiver and it is great.  Have not used the TV's own speakers yet.The one main disappointment has been with the 2d to 3d conversion, which is subpar at best.  Also, the batteries in the glasses go really fast.  I have not yet tried a 3d blu ray.  If I do I think it will be much better.The smart menu is very intuitive.  Netflix and Amazon.com instant video reception has been spotty, but I think that is more a function of my wifi network than the TV.  Can't really use the guide and some other functions because my cable box is hooked into my A/V receiver, not the TV.Sometimes a completely black screen looks more dark purple, but the blacks come through when the picture is on.  There is also some "flashlighting" in all 4 corners, but again only when the TV has a completely blank screen.For a beautiful picture you cannot go wrong.Update March 26 - I finally got around to watching content from our cable provider's 3D channel and the 3D quality was impressive.  I am still unimpressed with the 2D to 3D conversion.

Reviews.Title: All is well
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was worried about viewing angles and various other sundry details in the realm of negativity. Let me instead say that the pros from other reviews are accurate but I'll list a couple of cons I did not see elsewhere at purchase time.- The remote definitely does not replace your comcast or uverse remote unless you're willing to take the time to really learn it (and then get used to the delay for the instructions to make it through to the set top box)- Integrated TV Guide does not offer you the ability to jump to a different channel and it always starts at channel 1 (if there's a way around this I haven't learned it)- Soundshare with a soundbar is out of synch with tv sound when viewing things like netflix and SOME live sports. (Not a huge issue since you're probably well served to just use the soundbar sound via optical anyway)Given how great everything else is, these negatives are hardly an issue.

Reviews.Title: Beauty mounting bolts are M8- 1.25 x 20
Reviews.Author: Rene S. Hoepelman Jr.
Reviews.Content: I went to best buy with the intention of buying a five hundred dollar tv and ended up buying this at eleven.  I really enjoy watching 3D movies.  Its just so beautiful to look at.  I took two days off and slept on the couch.  I love the thinness and the small brazel.  Love everything about it.  I didn't really care for the smart tv internet functions as mine is connected to Xbox live.I will add that switching from our older Samsung LCD the mounting bolts didn't fit.  So I had to run back out to Lowes (was so annoyed)  Luckily I got it right the first time but I did buy three or four sets of M8 bolt sizes.  The new bolts you'll need to bolt the bracket to the back of this flat-panel are M8- 1.25 x 20  I can only guarantee these will work on the 46 inch.

Reviews.Title: Gamer's delight
Reviews.Author: Bathless
Reviews.Content: Went to Best Buy first...same tv/price...they don't deliver to my area. Tried AMAZON ..4 days later, tv in house lookin' great. Pleasure doing business with these folks...all expectations exceeded. I wish I had bought two of these tv's, as I was considering at the time. May yet, after seeing my laptop screen on it. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Why give an Excellent TV 4 stars??? (some-what in depth)
Reviews.Author: Jaime Maldonado
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this TV a month ago and I can say I am very happy with it. I purchased it with much consideration and scrutiny (like any other man who wants to buy a big TV for the money they put in it.) The background I came from in the TV world are Plasma TVs. As you may, or may not know, they offer the best natural colors and have a true, deep black tone. I have had 2 plasma TVs, one that I was very happy with and another that I was very disappointed with. To speak of the first one I owned, it was a Samsung Plasma TV from 2009. I had that for 3 years and then was able to finally upgrade to another TV. My brother has it now and its still going strong aside from it tilting slightly, yet noticeable, on its original stand. The second purchase was a Panasonic P50GT50 smart TV earlier this year (2013). I had that TV for about 7 months. Needless to say, its the Panasonic that I purchased that was a terrible buy and I am glad they bought it off my hands back.Now, stating that background, I am happy with the screen this TV produces. As you read around about LEDs, they don't produce the best color depths that are natural. I would have to say that with this TV, the change is seamless to me and I have yet to do any real adjustments with the screens. Though some would have their adjustments, it all depends on where you live. My TV is in a dark area and I feel it produces great image for where it is located with its auto lighting adjustment.Speaking of the audio system. First off, you bought a TV, not a sound system. If anyone ever tries to 'review' an audio system (whether by CNET or a 'professional') you should stop reading that section and move on to the next, its always a waste of time. I bought a Samsung 550 soundbar. Soundbars in general are the way to go, in my opinion, unless you have the money to fork out for a REAL 5.1 or 7.1 system. I am very happy with it, especially the fact that it connects to my TV's remote via Samsung's 'Anynet' connection. Learn it, like it, love it!The physical appearance of the TV is very attractive for any setting. Considering the bezel was made thin, it is hardily noticeable, whether watching the TV or not. Now, because the TV is so tall, I suggest bracing it to the wall or wall mounting it or mounting it to an actual entertainment center. You don't want to swivel it and then.... well its 60" and that's a bit tall to swivel at a small low point if you ask me.. So get some sense, brace it or mount it. I mounted it to the entertainment center. Its very easy to manage in terms of weight. I would say though that if you get something this big, a 60", I would suggest to have 2 people to carry it due to its size. You might be able to manage a 50" or under on your own... but I would never suggest that..The smart interface on this model is excellent! Though I have yet to do some of the 'more advance' functions such as screen sharing, the applications on the smarthub and the more 'simple' apps such as youtube and amazon prime are simple to use. I love personally how there is a selection square around what app or function you hover over and it indicates as well via sound. Panasonic's smart interface was less then desirable in lacking a selection square in the model previously mentioned, thats why I am pointing this out.Now, speaking so highly of a TV, why 4-stars for this TV. Well, the TV is a great TV, but I feel there is some lacking to it in the WiFi/streaming connection side. I wish I could post the pictures, but the TV, while obtaining a ping of 71 and 55 for a 2.4G and a 5G connection, only has a download speed of 2.49 and 3.32, again respectively. I have a connection of 30MB with cable connections, a very good, strong connection from an ASUS N66u Dual band router. Now, before you say "make a bridge stupid' I already tried. Not only that, it actually got worse, a ping between 1000-1200 and a download of 1MB. So yeah, there. And it was another Asus Dual Band router I used for it. So it actually got worse so now I reverted back to the built-in WiFi connection and put it on the 5G band. A little rough with some movies, but for the most part, it still manages to stream HD. I think Samsung should still look into this. I have no idea whats going on that's wrong.To wrap up, that TV is excellent if you are looking for great image and an overall system that literally allows you to control everything with a small remote (so awesome). However, due to the fact that it has some kind of streaming cap to the TV, it almost kills the 'smart function' making you seek other options. If it frustrates me enough, I turn on my PS3 and go from there. I just shouldn't have to go there to get smooth smart applications. I did pay for a smart TV!Well that's my two cents! Samsung, please update and fix this hiccup. I like you guys too much and I know you are all smart people over there!

Reviews.Title: LED Calibration
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: Here is what i found on the lcdtvbuyingguide setting. It is pretty good, just want to share with everyone that have this tv. I got the 65", and Yes, it does have some leakage light on the 4 conners. I can live with that since it is a 65", If anyone have any solution on how to fix the leakage light, please post and response so everyone can learn. I already adjust the backlight to lower the leakage light, but still, this is not a fix.Post Calibration Picture SettingsPicture Mode MovieBacklight 16Contrast 93Brightness 46Sharpness 5Color 50Tint G50/R50PIP OffAdvanced SettingsDynamic Contrast OffBlack Tone OffFlesh Tone 0Color Space CustomWhite Balance (See Table)10pt White Balance (See Table)Gamma 0Expert Pattern OffxvYCC OffPicture OptionsColor Tone Warm2MPEG Noise Filter OffHDMI Black Level LowFilm Mode OffAutoMotion Plus OffSmart LED OffCinema Black Off White BalanceR-Offset 24G-Offset 26B-Offset 25R-Gain 23G-Gain 26B-Gain 2410pt White BalanceInterval Red Green Blue1 -2 0 -32 0 1 -12 0 0 -14 0 -3 -55 -3 -4 -76 -4 -7 -107 -5 -7 -116 -2 -6 -109 0 -3 -510 6 1 -9Screen AdjustmentPicture Size Screen Fit

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture; 3D is Awesome; Great Apps
Reviews.Author: R. Miller "rwmiller5"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased this TV about a month ago, as an early Christmas gift to both of us. We don't regret the purchase one bit, as this TV is excellent.We were originally going to purchase the 120 Hz version of this TV. But after viewing this TV against the 120 Hz side by side at Best Buy, we decided on the 240 Hz, because the picture was noticeably clearer and sharper.We are using all the features of the TV, and everything is working fine. Setup was fairly easy.Pros:- The picture is excellent. Our previous TV was a 10 yr old Sony 50 inch LCD, and the picture quality of this TV far exceeds that of the old Sony. The picture is easily viewable at side angles, unlike the Sony LCD TV. We use the preset "Movie" setting for the picture, and I have not had to adjust any of the other controls to fine tune the picture. The preset settings for "Movie" are just fine.- 3D: We are watching quite a bit of 3D content, both from DirecTV and from a Samsung BD-F7500 BluRay player. The 3D picture is excellent. We are viewing the picture from about 10-12 ft away, and the effects are awesome, especially when the picture "jumps out" at you! We have had guests tell us that the 3D picture is much better than that of other friend's TVs.- Apps: We are using mainly the Netflix and Amazon Instant Video apps. The response time is very good, even with the dual core processor. The TV easily connected to our WiFi. We have a 25 Mbps Internet connection, and only a Wireless G router (54 Mbps) on the LAN side, and we have not had any problems streaming video. In fact, the TV seems to buffer the video streams much better than the old Roku player that we were using. The Roku tended to have to rebuffer the video quite often, and also dropped the picture quality from HD to SD due to bandwidth limitations at the provider. We haven't noticed any of those problems with this TV.- Anynet: We LOVE this feature. We are able to stream video from our PCs (which are running Serviio), and from my wife's Kindle. I am even streaming some old Divx movies which I have stored on my PC, some of which are less than 380 resolution, and they still look very good on the TV! I should also mention that my wife has a Samsung camera, and it easily connected via Anynet to the TV, so we can view pictures. This should work with any WiFi enabled camera that is running compatible file sharing software.- The unit is seamlessly compatible with my Samsung BD-F7500 BluRay player. I can control the major functions of both the BluRay or the TV from either of the remotes. Also, the TV remote will control my DirecTV satellite HD DVR, but only for power on/off. That is fine, as I don't expect the TV remote to be universal.- Another nice feature is that during setup, the TV queries you on the type of receiver you have (Satellite, Cable, etc), and your service provider name. This allows the TV to customize its viewing Guide in the Apps section, and also allows the remote to turn on/off your set-top box.Cons:- The 3D glasses that are supplied with the TV use un-rechargeable store bought batteries, and which don't have a long life. Also, the lenses are quite small. We bought a set of "3 Active" premium 3D glasses from Dimensional Optics. They have a larger lens, and also have built-in rechargeable batteries (USB). These are much better than the glasses Samsung provided. It is worth the $50 each. Since the 3D glasses are add-ons, this doesn't bother me too much.- The remote touch pad takes some getting used to. My major complaint is that in order to pause or stop a movie that you are streaming through the TV Apps, you have to click the "More" button on the remote, which brings up a "virtual remote" icon on the screen, which you then have to navigate through to find the Pause and Stop buttons. This is a bit cumbersome at first, especially if someone is at the door and you want to pause the movie quickly! After I got used to it, though, I found that I can go through the procedure quickly. It would be nice, though, to have these buttons on the remote.- The printed user manual is a bit skimpy. It refers you to the "E-Manual", which is accessible on the TV, or which you can download as a PDF through Samsung's website. I appreciate the intent of saving paper, but a complete printed user manual would have been nice. Again, a very minor thing.- The TV sound is not the best, but I have heard worse from similar sized TVs. We have found the sound to be adequate for general viewing. When we are streaming a movie or watching a BluRay, we always switch over to 5.1 Surround Sound through an external A.V amp, and it sounds excellent!I've read some of the reviews regarding screen failure after 1 year. I really hope that our TV doesn't suffer the same fate. We didn't buy the extended warranty. So far, the quality control of the unit seems very good. I also have not noticed any problems with the screen during early life that other users have complained about, and that they claim required a "burn-in" period.

Reviews.Title: Nice Television
Reviews.Author: P. E. Young "feel36"
Reviews.Content: I ordered the 60" LED 240hz 3D @ 10 days ago. Received it in two days. The "enhanced" delivery was less then enhanced but the TV arrived in perfect condition. I thought the picture was great out of the box. A few adjustments were needed but nothing major. Beware if you are placing this TV in a room with several windows and sunlight because the screen is almost mirror-like and tends to show reflections. Not a deal breaker though.The 3D works great. The sound from the built-in speakers is fair but I use external speakers so that doesn't really matter too much to me. I'm 100% happy with my purchase. The 2% rewards points Amazon offered along with the free shipping was nice too.Get the 5yr warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Very Thin Frame Bezel, Additional Samsung Remote With Buttons Eases Use
Reviews.Author: Wyn-Woods
Reviews.Content: I love the picture quality, and the very thin frame bezel on this set.It arrived very well packed, and was relatively easy to set-up.Because the TV is s-o-o thin, the speakers are also thin, and the resulting sound quality is not that great.That is why I rated it 4 stars instead of 5. A sound bar or additional speakers may be in order for some.The touch pad remote control works pretty well - although the lack of many buttons makes some changes more difficult to do.So I also bought the Samsung Smart TV Remote  (model BN59-01054A) - which is particularly well made, has back lighting, and easy to use large, flat buttons that all readily work with this set. It required no programming - just add batteries! I use it in conjunction with the touch pad one and am now quite satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Dex
Reviews.Author: Edward A Piroska
Reviews.Content: TV arrived inside another box in which I was pleasantly surprised. No damage to the outside box and no damage to the actual TV box. However, when I plugged the TV in for the first time, it was if there were two parts to the display. The bottom half was perfect as you would expect. The top half was a mess and clearly defective. I contacted the Amazon seller and was told if it wasn't damaged during shipping, I needed to contact Samsung for a resolution. As you can guess, this has been a nightmare to resolve. Samsung will not replace the unit but wants to send a repairman out to fix it. I strongly recommend never buying electronics from a third party Amazon seller to avoid situations like this. I have had the TV for a week now and am still waiting on repair. Last Samsung I will ever buy.

Reviews.Title: Simply the Best and the Easiest
Reviews.Author: T. Russo "Capt Tom"
Reviews.Content: I saw this set at a friends house and thought it was the best. Did some additional research and Samsung always stood out.Ordered the set from Amazon. That in itself was a very rewarding experience; I spoke with an order agent and he answered every question I could come up with  It made me realize how much experience Amazon has with this type of product and service.The delivery company contacted me within a week. We agreed on a delivery date and they agreed to deliver it in the morning. At 9:05 they arrived. By 9:20 the TV was set up and on the first of its set-up screens. The delivery guys could not have been more professional and helpful. My obligation is to keep the packing box for 30 days in case a problem arises. If it does they come back, repack it and send it back to Amazon. Nifty.My part of the TV set-up took 15 minutes - including times for a 6 minute software update and establishing my wifi connection. The HDMI to cable box connection assures a great out of the box picture. You can spend time fiddling with all the picture adjustments that are available but we decided to leave the picture alone. It is simply outstanding. Outdoor sporting events probably look best on the Dynamic option and standard TV probably looks best on Standard mode. It takes seconds to jump from one to the other.  Watching reclaimed old black and white movies is a remarkable experience. Like not having seen them before.Once the wifi connection is made you have access to the entire internet and a wealth of already established connections appear - including Netflix, You tube, HULU etc. I quickly realized that the smart TV does away with the needed for a Roku device, so I have moved that to our bedroom TV. The small TV controller is a touch pad which takes a bit of practice (at least for me). Once I got the hang of it, exploring all the viewing options will almost overwhelms you. The process is intuitive and with just a bit of playing around you will learn to maneuver from option to option.I am an amateur photographer an inserted a thumb drive with a bunch of pictures. I was pleasantly surprised at how well the photos appeared. The hi-def photos show well on a large hi-def TV. This is where some playing with the picture mode and color/tint options may come into play.A glance at the TV's specs will show you that there are plenty of connections available. With 4 HDMI inputs and all sorts of USB drive options you can watch an endless stream of video.The sound quality is very good. Admittedly not as good as my Onkyo surround sound system. I plan to undertake setting that up once my Samsung BluRay player arrives later this week.Frankly, I never thought I would spend close to $3,000 on a TV but I am not at all regretting it. And certainly do not regret ordering it through Amazon

Reviews.Title: So far so good....
Reviews.Author: tammyt1976
Reviews.Content: I love it. Excellent picture, color, 3D is amazing (and I'm not even a fan). I've only had it for a week so I'm still learning. Smart TV...is great. I love the fact that I can link my amazon prime membership to the TV to download movies/TV.Again...so far, so good.

Reviews.Title: Really not 5 stars, only 4 and three quarters.
Reviews.Author: Arthur H. Ude "Giving it a try"
Reviews.Content: Had this TV now for about 3 weeks. Picture is great. I've seen none better in store displays. This review will focus on a few incidental items that you may interesting.The base is rugged and swivels about 30 degrees to each side. Nice!The remote, as reviewed by others, take some getting used to but it pretty good. They say it is a universal remotes as it will control other devices but, in my case, not completely. For example it adjusts the volume on my LG sound bar bit will not control other options on the bar. There is a pop-up remote from a button-push that then acts like a normal remote with the ability to enter numbers and select frequently used items. I suppose it saves clutter on the hand-held.The smart function, apps or channels, works pretty well but not as well or as with as many channels as my ROKU 2XS device which I have connected and  which I use must of the time. The Samsung does have a YouTube channel which works very well.The 3D is super! Better in a darkened room.Batteries seem to last a reasonable time but you can buy rechargeable glasses for about $50 from other Internet sources.The USB ports provide both .5 and 1 amp and will drive a USB 2 or 3 external hard drive. I have my movies converted to MP4 files and they are displayed nicely and show great on the TV. Each title is displayed in a box with moving pictures taken from the movie.Free shipping from Amazon arrived 1 day late and Amazon compensated me for the delay. Thank you, Amazon. Very nice. The driver helped me unpack the TV, install the stand, connect my devices and turned it on to make sure everything worked to my satisfaction. The driver offered to remove that packing material but I declined - just in case.Easy setup and connection to WiFi. The set immediately went on line and got a software update. There is online help from Samsung where they can actually control your TV. Don't know how that works as I haven't had need to try it.Other items like voice recognition for control of the TV do work and may be more than just a gimmick as you may think. For example, when watching an MP4 movie from the USB port, pushing the talk button and saying "Pause" will do just that. Other voice commands are available. You can also control the USB movie from the pop-up on-screen remote.Motion control, face recognition, with a camera (not supplied with the F7100) were not tested. i probably will never use them.Giving the 7100 4 and 3/4 stars may be a bit harsh. Probably 4 and 7/8 would be more accurate.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Picture
Reviews.Author: DMS NYC
Reviews.Content: I bought a 46 inch Samsung Slim LED TV a few years ago and have loved it.  Everyone would commend on how great the picture is.  I decided to get a larger screen, so I purchased this TV.  I love it.  The picture is even better.  It is crisp and clear.  It is bright and brilliant.  The pictures appear to pop out at out.  Even when you are not in 3D mode, you feel like you are in the picture.  I really can not say enough great things about Samsung TVs.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: A. F. Albanese
Reviews.Content: I have had this television for a month and LOVE the picture.  I still do not know all of the ins and outs but it is a joy to watch some of my favorite programs and sporting events.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: HAN JI MYOUNG
Reviews.Content: Very clear display and fast shipping. Graphics throughout are gorgeous.I like the smart remote control with its helpful point and click system.

Reviews.Title: A Very Awesome TV!
Reviews.Author: Art J. Wills
Reviews.Content: I watched this 65" TV at the showroom of a major appliance store (one of the last chains, blue and yellow logo) and was very impressed with the picture. The offsetting factor was the price, however. The price came down to two grand and I thought that I should take the plunge - it's a want not a need, right?The TV arrives with a (somewhat flimsy) stand, 4 sets of 3d glasses, a remote and batteries. Setup is quite easy; you assemble the stand parts (2) with 4 *very tiny* screws, and then attach the stand to the TV with yet another 4 of the same screws. The stand allows the TV to rotate about 30 degrees or so, but there is a significant amount of flex and the TV appears to be top heavy. If you are going to use the stand (I don't recommend this) then be sure to anchor your TV to the wall or cabinet so that it doesn't come crashing down and ruin your $2k investment.Other reviewers have had issue with the remote. It's a bit unusual - it has a touch interface similar to a laptop mouse pad. You swipe your finger across it to navigate the various menus and features. There is also a button titled "more" which allows you to access an on-screen numeric keypad if you want to select your channels directly. I ended up getting used to the remote - it's different but not hard to adapt to. Others have stated that you can get a standard Samsung remote, but I chose not to bother.When you first start the TV it walks you through a roughly 1 hour setup process - downloading updates, getting wireless info, and other relevant information. The updates go very slowly. I don't know, but I can imagine there must be quite a few updates to process. Overall, once it starts updating you can go out and get dinner - it will be done by the time you get back.The TV itself: The picture looks awesome! The thin bezel design makes it look like the picture is floating in midair. Very sharp picture out of the box, and minimal tweaking of the picture is required. Be sure to run your TV for 15 hours or so before really messing with the settings - that gives your panel time to "set in". The user menus are pretty intuitive, and I see very little need to mess with many of the settings since the defaults appear to be sufficient for most people.Did I mention I *love* the picture?3D: I consider 3D TV a gimmick and a waste of time. Truthfully, I bought this TV fully intending never to use it. However, I wanted the thin bezel, the better LED/LCD panel, and dual core processor - that means 3D had to come along for the ride! I did, however, decide I would try out the 3D "just once" with the movie "Gravity". All I can say is... WOW. The 3D is positively AMAZING. The starfield images jump out at you, objects float out of the TV, and best of all, my eyes weren't fatigued by the end of the movie. The experience made me rethink my former disdain for 3D TV. A few annoyances: The 3D glasses don't pair up with the TV unless you are standing directly in front of the TV.  Also, the glasses tend to eat coin cells. Be sure to get a bunch of them at Costco or something if you are going to watch a lot of 3D TV.Streaming video: I have Amazon Prime (surprise surprise!) on an AT&T; U Verse connection, and movies stream wirelessly to this TV with no buffering or stuttering. I am very pleased with the performance of this TV over a wireless connection. There is a LAN port on the back if you don't wish to use the wireless connection. I haven't tested it, but I am reasonably certain that it would work just fine. :)I have gushed about how good the picture is, now here are my nit picking things about the TV:- Sleep function is buried 2 menus deep. The "tools" menu doesn't work when you are in the Smart Hub or streaming movies.- Samsung apps (like NFL for instance) can't be deleted. I think that if I don't want an app, I should be able to de-install it. Why do they get to hog my TV's resources for garbage like Shopping Apps and other useless junk? You'll spend some time throwing away a bunch of worthless apps once you find out that they want you to pay through the nose to watch 1970s sitcoms on them.- Apps can't be reorganized. I use Amazon Prime. I do not use Hulu Plus/Netflix/Blockbuster (?). I don't want Hulu Plus on my apps screen since I don't use it and I don't want it front and center. Too bad the TV will not allow me to do this.- The "Updates" function takes a while to initialize.- When connecting wirelessly, there is a 40 second or so "lag" before a connection is established. No big deal but it is a bit annoying.-Slight white clouding on the lower left hand if the screen, visible only when the image is perfectly black. It doesn't intrude any other time.- The built in speakers S. U. C. K.!  But... what do you expect from a TV this thin?!? I am reasonably certain you'll be getting a soundbar.Overall, this is a gorgeous TV and I am very happy with my purchase. I think now that the price has dropped to 2K, I think you will be too!

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: M. Meinhardt
Reviews.Content: We have had the TV in operation for about 3 weeks and I've not come across anything negative up to this point.  The picture is good, the interface is very responsive, the remote works well.  Beyond that, the unit is ascetically pleasing and looks great mounted on the wall.  The bezel is very thin and a huge improvement over the unit it replaced.

Reviews.Title: Use it for a while, so far so good!
Reviews.Author: WAI Y CHAN
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a few weeks.  So far I love it.  By the way, it was very well packed when I received this.  I am quite impressed.The shipping company will not drop this off in my front door (they require a signature), and they are not willing to call me before the delivery.  It took me a while before I can arrange a pick up on this.For the shipping, I will give a 3 to 4 stars.  For the product a 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Amazing, Glad we Chose This One
Reviews.Author: Kris C
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the purchase of this tv.  I was dreading having to learn the new remotes and capabilities since our previous tv was basic, but it only took a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: Awesome...
Reviews.Author: Rakesh
Reviews.Content: Except sound everything is great. Picture quality is excellent. 3D does work, watched few 3D movies from Netflix. Paring is easy from Samsung smart phones no password required.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love
Reviews.Author: Loren V. Burrell
Reviews.Content: We are nearly an all Samsung house at this point, save for one Sony bluray theater system in the master bedroom and the PS3 in my office. However, all our TVs are Samsung and this latest addition is my favorite by far. The 3D images are gorgeous and the 2D hi def images are breathtaking. I really have no gripes with this TV at all. I just love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal
Reviews.Author: Chad Freitag
Reviews.Content: Order this tv thru Amazon warehouse for $400 off the price because the original box was damaged. Product works great, delivery was on time (I got to specify a 3 hour window), and they even came in and installed the base to the tv and waited for me to make sure everything worked.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: love this TV perfect picture, watched our first 3d movie it was great!!! everything we have is samsung and they all work together!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Nakwon Jung
Reviews.Content: Wide and clean screen. Easy to set up and control. 3D works well.Think I made a great choice, Very much satisfied with it!

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV
Reviews.Author: Brad Dobbins
Reviews.Content: This is an all around amazing TV! The picture quality is incredible and looks great when mounted on the wall due to it's extremely thin bezel. You will not be disappointed with this TV.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: CLM
Reviews.Content: Incredible picture...INCREDIBLE. Looks wonderful and loads of "extras". Brings TV viewing into a whole new dimension for a reasonable price. Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: P. Gendreau
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about a month. So happy with it. Every day I am amazed by the picture quality. The feature are equally amazing. the smart TV function really enhances the TV viewing experience. I previously had a 47 inch Vizio that was about 5 years old and I can say that this is a major upgrade. Set up is easy but takes a while. there's an upgrade that you have to do plus you have to link to internet and Samsung. After that, it is pure viewing bliss. Highly recommend. great for watching sports, movies and gaming

Reviews.Title: Good picture.
Reviews.Author: Bernard Y
Reviews.Content: The tv is very sleek and looks really good with the screen going nearly to the edge.  The picture is very good and clear as well and the colors are very prominent and clean.

Reviews.Title: Samsung-Best
Reviews.Author: Richard L Goodwin
Reviews.Content: Samsung is great on all products we have owned. Amazon provides the best service and the best pricing and has for all the years we have been customers whether it is books, e-books, movies on Prime, all sorts of products we've gotten, etc. By the way, your deal with AE to obtain product with points is the best service you offer. For example, we could not have obtained the TV from AE but could from Amazon. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing..  just bought it, so I haven't tried all the everything yet..  but the picture quality is amazing

Reviews.Title: AMAZING ONE OF THE BEST TV I EVER BOUGHT !!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Arik azulay
Reviews.Content: AMAZING ONE OF THE BEST TV I EVER BOUGHT !!!!!!!!!!! i truly recommend  it , i bought the Visio then i return it for this one. supper happy

Reviews.Title: Not plasma but very good for LCD LED
Reviews.Author: dbdavis
Reviews.Content: Stunning picture quality after some minor calibration. First I am not a big fan of LCD LED televisions - plasma is absolutely better due to higher contrast, wider viewing angles, better screen uniformity (less variation)  and truer un-exaggerated colors. I don't know enough about the television industry to fully understand why manufacturers are pulling away from plasma and producing these LED LCD televisions almost exclusively, maybe they're just much cheaper to produce, ship and more cost-effective on the homeowner to operate over time. I did a lot of research prior to purchasing this TV - it seems to be the best of the current offerings unless one is willing to spend several thousand dollars on LCD for minor improvements which ironically look more like plasma TVs. If you purchase this TV expecting it to look like a plasma TV you will be disappointed, if you purchase this TV expecting to own one of the best LCD televisions on the market right now then you will be extremely happy.

Reviews.Title: Amazing tv its big and beautiful and full of features
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: After getting this tv it was extremely easy to setup and configure.Pros:Very large screen very nice picture and settingsLove the smart features with the appsLove the remote, very easy to use and simple (new touchpad interface is great)voice search is cool but too slow and too complicated.Love the built in wirelessUSB storage is extremely nice and easy to use (put files on a usb key, plug it in and the smart tv interface finds the files and is displays them in the interface.Thinness of the tv is amazingLove the channel auto scan with an over the air antenna, has a built in program guide for shows on tv (just like a cable box might have)TV show recommendations with a progress bar is really neat and I actually watch over the air tv more often now (tv shows the tv thinks you might like show up and it shows you whats coming up in the future as well)ARC support and anynet+ is amazing.  (it allows you to control an audio receiver with volume buttons and power on/off)4 pairs of Active 3D glasses are included and the built in netflix application has a selection of 3d movies.tv is very light and is easy to mount on the wall if desiredyoutube integration is very cool and the app works wellCons:The stand is ugly ( shiny silver chrome in an X shape)  I liked the simple bland flat square stand in the past generations.facebook app is pretty worthless and doesn't work very well (its slow and buggy)netflix app is slow, and very similiar to the ps3 interface ( I am a big fan of the Apple tv Netflix app its much faster and easier to navigate)Summary:I came from a 46 inch bottom of the line Samsung tv from about 2 years ago,  it had no smart features etc.  I bought the 65 inch F7 series mentioned here and I am amazed by the difference and how useful and rich the smart features make the tv.  I am going to stick with using netflix and apple tv though with this tv.

Reviews.Title: Awesome clarity, sharpness and color
Reviews.Author: Kiran Hk
Reviews.Content: Really like the quality of picture, sound, clarity and sports action.  The apps are great and works well, only draw back is with remote.  Battery runs out very fast.  So I control the TV with my iPhone and iPad.Overall great value for money. I have a Blu Ray 3D player and movies are awesome.  Comes with four battery powered 3D glasses.

Reviews.Title: Stop thinking. Just buy it.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Rizzo
Reviews.Content: I pulled the trigger on this for a number of reasons:A: looked FAR better than any other TV <$2000 at local stores. LG, Sony, and all the other didn't compare.B: Plenty of inputs: I have a PS3, TV, PC, all plugged in and never have any issues.C: Plays a ton of file formats: MKVs!D: I have Samsung phones, tablets, etc - so they all integrate easily - don't use this feature much, but it is pretty cool.E: Image quality for hockey - motion blur just about non-existent,All in all, very impressed with the quality of the TV. Stand looks classy, image is great (including viewing from a sharp angle), sound quality is great for TV-speakers (obviously, remember if you have a large room, the will not be adequate. For my apartment, they are, although I will most likely buy a nice set of 2.1s).At first, voice commands seemed like a feature I wouldn't use, but I have yet to find a way to quickly find channels in the guide feature on the TV - so I just voice command the name of the channel or show. And it has yet to get a word wrong!Overall, couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Love the tv
Reviews.Author: Scuba
Reviews.Content: This was replacing a 55 inch Sony Bravia LCD I purchased about 6 year ago... Looked and reviewed all the tv's 55" to 60" in the price range of $1500 to 2000 and by far this tv was the best... I'm so happy with the picture quality ... I used a review I read earlier to do all the setting of picture quality and it is amazing ...I do not like the remote that came with the tv... But already knew when I purchased the tv I wasn't going to use the remote being I have a all in one remote that I love...hope the reviewed help

Reviews.Title: Spectacular TV
Reviews.Author: PeterCW "Peter w"
Reviews.Content: This unit has a spectacular picture.  The voice and hand command features are great. To get the best of this TV I suggest you read all the directions and learn to use all the great features.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding - if calibrated right.
Reviews.Author: Brian O. Hogbin
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this television out of the box is good - but the default settings are atrocious! Movie is the only real acceptable one, and that has a muted affect on the color saturation. Bottom line - follow the calibration settings posted in the reviews here in June 2013 - these settings made all the difference and the picture is fantastic!I only really have to minor criticisms:1) I wish the blacks could be a little darker, but I made the decision to go with the 7100 vs the 8000 series to save money which would have improved this phenomenon.2) The left side of the screen seems slightly brighter than the right when viewing a black screen.....it does not appear to affect the picture when watching content - but just worth mentioning.3) The remote sucks - but many have commented on that.Overall - I HIGHLY recommend this television given the price point. BUT BE SURE TO CALIBRATE IT USING THE SETTINGS IN THIS COMMENT THREAD! IT MADE ALL THE DIFFERENCE!

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV
Reviews.Author: Michael McGrath
Reviews.Content: This TV is everything I hoped for and more.  It hooked up easily, and the picture (both standard and 3D) is amazing.  The streaming is better than we hoped for because it's very fluid, even with a wireless connection - much better than previous streaming we've done with our TIVO wireless.  We'd highly recommend this TV to anyone in the market for a high end TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TVs make everything you watch look better
Reviews.Author: Anthony Huff
Reviews.Content: While I've only had this TV a few days, I am so impressed I had to write a review.I researched all other TV choices I had and viewed as many in person as I could. After deciding the brightness of my room eliminated plasma from the equation my decision came down to four choices: Vizio M-series, Sharp LE750, Sony KDL70R550, and this Samsung. The others were all 70" models, bot the Samsung F7100 doesn't go that big. It's actually 64.5" measured vertically, but the lack of a few inches won't make a bit of difference when you view this screen!When I got it, I calibrated with Disney's World of Wonder Blu-Ray calibration disk. I only did a quick novice calibration. I will do it more thoroughly when I have more time, but I didn't have to change much in the way of settings anyway.Then I watched "Arthur Christmas" Blu-Ray with my kids. Awesome! It was like going to the theater but with razor crisp images!The next night we watched National Lampoon's "Christmas Vacation" on cable HD. It was like a whole new movie! The video upconversion from this TV made me feel like I was watching a movie made for HDTV instead of a film from 1989. Truly amazing.Sports look smooth and the contrast and black levels rival plasma.I am going from a 46" Hitachi projection HDTV ( Very good TV 10 years ago) to this and I am just truly impressed with everything I see. All I want to do now is watch something on this TV!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 7100-65 inch
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of the reviews this TV has been an excellent addition to our home.  Thank you to all who wrote their very in-depth reviews, as it was instrumental in my choice.

Reviews.Title: Seeing is believing
Reviews.Author: snoshow "snoshow"
Reviews.Content: This ultra slim Smart TV displays fantastic image detail.  Great price.  Delivered as promised; removed from box, plugged in, connected to cable and absolutely amazing images from the beginning.  It's hard to watch sports on other TVs because they don't come close to the resolution of this TV.  Picture occupies the entire TV with very thin bevel around edges, I would recommend this TV to friends, family and all.

Reviews.Title: Much research paid off --- good tv
Reviews.Author: L. Englander
Reviews.Content: One-month-old UN46F7100 performs as advertised and as praised on Amazon forum. Tuner is excellent for OTA. Remote is tedious; I went immediately to Logitech universal, thanks to son's programming it (he set up tv, also).  Unfortunate that closed-captioning is very tough (many steps) to turn on/off, using either remote.  Nor can I enable it automatically with 'mute', handy when the phone rings.Movies look great, tv programs as well (but quality of shows has not improved).  Sound is fine (was a concern to me). Speakers are on bottom edge; perhaps those who didn't like the sound have mounted their set too close to a surface at the bottom edge. Web-link (using ethernet cable) works OK but limited usefulness. Laptop's miniDP-to-HDMI works well.  Regular delivery went faster than expected, and protective packaging was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture but so many settings it takes forever to set the colors and picture quality.
Reviews.Author: JOHN P. DOLLY
Reviews.Content: I want to thank the reviewer who provided all the setting info. Without his recommendations I would never even have found most of the picture and color settings. The manual is good for turning on the TV after that you need to use the remote which I found difficult to use. I'll probably get a universal remote with keys. I have a big hand and fingers and using the small touch pad was a joke. The TV itself looks terrific and the picture once you get it set is amazing. My wife and I watched the 3D version of AVATAR  using a Samsung 6500 3D blue ray player. We enjoyed the clarity and visuals even more than when we saw it in the theater. Conversion of 2D to3 D was not great but playing 3D movies is a great experience. Overall I would have given the set 5 stars except for the small remote and lack of a helpful manual. We ordered the TV through Amazon and they delivered on time and it was very easy to deal with them. This TV is large and comes in a box 6 ft long so we needed to have it delivered in rural Alabama.

Reviews.Title: This TV is a must have...
Reviews.Author: frizazeld "frizazeld"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on black Friday 2013 and got a really great deal. The picture is amazingly clear and perfect on the HD channels. The other channels not so much. I don't think it's the TV but the network. The TV is very easy to navigate with the simple remote that came with the TV. I bought the keyboard remote as well which I rarely use, but it's nice to have in the event I need to do more in depth surfing on the TV. On a side note, when I got the TV  it was not for the 3D. After having the TV for about a month. I said you know what this TV has 3D and I've never used it. Let me check it out. I have Stars which has 3D movies for subscribers to their movies. I started the new Wizard of Oz with James Franco. The movie in 3D blew my mind. It's like having your own movie theater right in your house. Without a doubt the best TV I've bought in the last couple of years.For me their are only two downsides to this particular model.1. The sound is not great at all. But I knew that going into this. I mean really, how great do you think the sound would be on a TV this slim. Not great at all. That's why I bought the Bose Cinemate sound bar at the same time I bought the TV. Now I have the ultimate in sound and picture. I have completely transformed my living room into my own private theater. My friends are really jealous. :0)2. I wish the TV had the capability to erase all the history cookies that are sent to you when you look up something. I contacted Samsung and they said they are working on upgrading the TV to have that function. Not really that big of a deal. I just like to be able to erase any history that I might have.To sum it up...The Samsung UN65F7100 65-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Ultra Slim Smart LED HDTV is without a doubt a great TV and I would highly recommend to anyone looking to improving their viewing experience.I'm watching the winter Olympics now and you can literally see the sweat on the athletes faces. You feel like you have a front row seat to every event.

Reviews.Title: Ok but moving on to Sony
Reviews.Author: CHRIS
Reviews.Content: Had this tv since end of November..Liked the smart functions a lot  but to many motion or ghosting issues during certain programs/ movies especially  football games ....Was told  the cable signal was the cause but had that checked and tested fine...so the TV goes back >Have seen others mention this ..I know the 8000 series has higher refresh rate but after doing more research on the internet this seems to be a on going problem with samsung...So if your not a big sports guy this should be fine but i do not want to settle for fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV - Smart Features Are a Gimmick
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Dolan
Reviews.Content: This review is for the 55" version of the 7100 series tv.The biggest point I want to make in this review is that the picture quality on this TV is superior to all competition.  If you are looking for a mid/high end television but don't want to spend $2,000 or more then seriously consider this TV. This is my second TV purchase in the past 10 years, my previous set being a 32" Samsung LCD which was mid/high end back in 2004. I'll provide three quick high points of the TV and what I look for in making a long term investment in a television.First, the microdimming makes the blacks black and the whites white without washing out colors.  Second, glare reduction coating is amazing and is even better than a simple matte finish on some lower end sets (one of the main reasons I've been so diligent in reasearching televisions is because I have a bay window opposite of my tv that lets in huge amounts of sunlight). Third, game mode, I have been called a cheater and a hacker several times now in the first week of using this TV.  And I can safely say that the 30m/s processing time is to blame, people just can't compete in first person shooters.I would highly recommend properly setting up the Television before trying to judge or review the tv.  Most importantly, turn Auto-Motion Plus to Standard mode if you're not watching High Definition sports, as it just creates a jittery picture/"soap opera" effect.  Several reviews have posted calibrations that they have used on their sets.  I would use them as a guide and adjust slightly to your liking, because not every screen, room or person is exactly the same.Now for the reasons why I took away 1 star; Smart Features, Remote and 3-D.  These are all gimmicks shoved in consumers faces by the major companies, don't purchase a TV based soley on these features.  In regards to the smart features, a good Blueray player or Playstation 3/4 will render all of the apps sluggish, bland and overall worthless.  Next,the Remote is built on a great idea which isn't executed properly (or technology just isn't ready for intelligent televisions and remotes).  I would recommend using your cable box remote or a universal remote.  Finally, 3D, it's just a fad.  Look at the trend of 3D movies in theaters and you'll see that current 3D technologies aren't going to be the future of movies, gaming or television.Closing Summary, If you want a TV with the best picture to price ratio on the market right now, this is the TV for you.  Forget about the gimmicky features and get this TV, it will impress for years to come and with Samsung's track record; it will last for many years.

Reviews.Title: Go head and buy it.
Reviews.Author: R.B
Reviews.Content: OK, I am not writing about the specifics of this TV, I am just trying to help people who are thinking or planning to buy it.I like to add, that prior to my purchase, I did my research and read reviews for months too, until I get it and here my review :This TV is very beautiful and easy to set up.  So when the TV is "ON" the picture is stunning ( WOW ) , of course I modified the picture setting, changed it to my preferences and the way it suit my eyes. The 3D is real and incredible. Sound is fine ( not bad as some reviews complained about it, come on!! they must be deaf...lol ), Smartv apps are nice and work good. And when it's "OFF" , it look like a very artsy black picture in a nice frame. Believe me you will enjoy looking at it even when it's off .Seriously, go head and buy it. I did and I am very happy with it.By the way, I like to mention that I get it from Amazon.com, who really prove to me that is really a good company who I trust. Plus, it has a reliable delivery system ( I purchase my TV on May 22nd and get it two days later May 24th ). I will post some pictures or a video of the TV soon.I hope this will help you make your decision.

Reviews.Title: Tv contenders...I'm trying to help you here!!!
Reviews.Author: Janine
Reviews.Content: I will post this in different places I.e Samsung, Sony, and Vizio sections.OMG, choosing a car is much easier than a TV. As most people here, I have spent about 4 weeks solid; reviewing tv's, and stalking them as well. I have been to BB, HHREGG, as well as a few other specialty stores, and spent 2 to 4 hours in each store. (i'm retired so i can afford to do so).I have asked the sales people to insert proprietary 3d disks. The only thing that has not been possible is to attach my Xfinity/Comcast cable box to these tv's to compare the difference in picture quality.The first thing that needs to be said is that none of these stores selling said tv's have calibrated them. So some tv's that are highly rated on the internet, look terrible in the store.One example is  the Panasonic 65" ZT Series Plasma HDTV, which was placed directly in bright lights in the hhregg store. The poor tv looked lousy and dark...Sniff.Another thing that you should know about the reviewer (me) is that I have been actively creating 3d objects and graphics for years. Resolution and color representation are so important to me.Couple this with the fact that I have light to moderate Aspergers. I can focus on microscopic details and differences for hours. Idiotic perfection of sorts. It's a blessing and a curse.The contenders we have selected for purchase (within our budget) as of today are :Sony 65" XBR Series LED Ultra HDTVSamsung 75" Series 7 LED HDTV - UN75F7100Sony KDL-70R550A 70-Inch 120Hz 1080pVIZIO M801d-A3 80-Inch 1080pPanasonic 65" ZT Series Plasma HDTV.As of this writing, we have eliminated the Sony KDL-70R550A. Although it is by far the most affordable ($2100), the colors and picture quality are simply inferior to the others above.We are also probably going to eliminate the Panasonic plasma for whatever reason, the 3d was not amazing, and it's only a 65" screen.If you mention the name VIZIO to me, I will start getting cold sweats. Although the Vizio M series affords plenty of great reviews, I still have a psychological barrier towards stereotypical cheaper brands. Quite frankly, I also have a barriers towards Kia and Hyundai, although they are great cars.I have had plenty of time to observe the vizio M801d-A3 and the Vizio M701d-A3 in action. Despite my mistrust in the brand, the picture both in 2d and 3d is excellent. Many reviewers  have said that the screen is too reflective and that there are problems operating the remote control on these models though. The screen on the Samsung 75" Series 7 LED HDTV - UN75F7100, is also just as reflective. The color representation and picture quality of the Samsung is superior to the Vizio though.Anyone who is considering the purchase of a Sharp Aquos should definitely compare/study Vizio M models as well. Personally, I would buy the Vizio over the Sharps, I prefer the Vizios image over the Sharps, and the Sharp 80" is very expensive too compared to Vizio. If anyone here is considering a Samsung 7100 or 8000 LED, do not even bother checking out the Vizios or the Sharp models.I hesitated a long time Over the Samsung models, and when my research was over, I invited my wife to review the results.The 3 models we studied were the Samsung 4k ultra @ 65" and both the UN75F7100 and UNF8000 both at 75".I saw very little picture quality difference between the UN75F7100 and UNF8000, however the 8000 series is much more expensive. For this reason we eliminated it.My wife and I have Apple Tv at home, so we are less interested in Apps and gaming. We like watching movies both in 2d and 3d.Next we compared the 4K ultra Tv's, the sony Xbr and the Samsung 4k. Both have a 65" screen.For some odd reason we did not find the Samsung 4k impressive. We played a few Sony Demos on it as well as watched a few 3d movies on it, and It was marginally better than the Samsung UN75F7100. Also the 4k is more expensive by $2000.The 3d movies we watched were nearly just as good on the UN75F7100. We also found that the UN75F7100 had better COLOR REPRESENTATION...wait let me explain !!!The sony XBR 4K.If money were no object, I would buy the 85" model of the Sony XBR 4 K ULTRA, right now.The sony XBR is by far the best picture quality and especially COLOR representation we have seen. By far!!!If you do not believe me, get a few 2d~3d movies you guys like, and go and force the sales people to play them on the Sony.Sony is reluctant to allow third party content to play on their demo Tv's because they want to show you their demo stuff (that looks exceptional BTW. But if you are going to spend 5k on a TV it's your right to be anally retentive.The picture quality, the perfection of color, and the passive 3d blew us away. This tv does an amazing job at up scaling content to a higher a definition of clarity and color.For me, the difference between the Sony and most of the other Tv's was like creating a picture in Photoshop at 72 pixels per inch and then creating the same picture at 300ppi, then comparing the two. Forget the fact that there is little to no real 4k content yet. This tv has by far the best picture.The huge dilemma we now have is. Which of these two tv's are we going to buy? The samsung UN75F7100 or the Sony 4K. The samsung is much larger +10", but the Sony is better quality in picture and color.We found that the samsung UN75F7100 was not far behind in color, but there was still a visible difference. The sony image is much crisper/clearer. A higher definition, no doubt.The samsung screen is much like the vizio, extremely reflective to any object that may be in front of it.We preferred the sony's screen.Another dilemma we have is that we view tv from 12 feet away, so logically the 75" samsung would be a better choice. Price wise they are more or less the same given a few hundred dollars.We did find the Samsungs stand quite unpractical. Due to the relatively long TV one needs two small tables at either end of the tv. We cannot wall mount it.The speakers are no doubt better on the sony which has speakers on either side of the screen. Anyhow, all these tv's warrant an added sound bar, so who cares about the original factory sound?Sony is coming out with the same tv in a few weeks without the speakers, So i may wait until I finally decide which of these two to purchase.Hope this review helps you guys choose a tv.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV with one major deal breaker
Reviews.Author: J. MITCHELL
Reviews.Content: This review is based on the 65" version, so the deal breaker for me might not exist on other panel sizes.I really do love this TV.  I wanted to keep it.  However, I cannot accept the vertical banding that is visible when watching sports or panning views of skies/grass.  Amazon exchanged this TV twice for me, but each TV had the same problem.  Vertical banding was visible on the right half of the screen.  Another drawback of this TV, which I could live with was the limited viewing angles.  A word of warning to anyone who will be watching this TV at angles greater than 15 or 20 degrees.  Color and contrast begin to drop off at angles greater than 15 or 20 degrees.  The vertical banding was more pronounced at these viewing angles.For reference my panel version for all 3 TV's I tested was AH01.  There have been reportings of a TH02 panel on avsforum.com that is free of vertical banding.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied

Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these and am completely happy. Exactly what I wanted and I have both of them mounted on the wall. I like the thin boarders which is originally what attracted me to the tv. Came as promised and even knew the date and morning they would arrive. Exactly what I wanted. Thank you

Reviews.Title: great!

Reviews.Content: I came along at least a very good thing. Good things come in without a problem like this. I'll continue to use a lot.

Reviews.Title: Samsung tops all others

Reviews.Content: Samsung makes the best HD TV at a good price better than Sony and Sharp and all others. Outstanding technology, yields the best picture. Looks 3D in 2D. Am going to replace all sets I have with  Samsung 240 MHz 3D sets .

Reviews.Content: Clear Display...3D movie is good...wireless is good.Smart Hub is good.samsung allshare is good.!!but remotecontoroller is simple, but no button is not easy.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: M. Gilmore "Tough2U"
Reviews.Content: Picture is extremely bright and colors are vivid.  The Smart TV programing on the unit is updated and very easy to use.  Unit can be hung using the Samsung cable system mount without any issues.  I would highly recommend this Unit for large rooms and even units with lighting as reflections from this unit are extremely low

Reviews.Title: Samsung 60 inch tv
Reviews.Author: HerbHen
Reviews.Content: This smart TV is great.  It has excellent clarity and colors.  We are able to stream videos and music from the internet.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Lee H. Fleming
Reviews.Content: I stepped up from an older 46" Samsung and got what I expected.  Great picture, great for sports.  Do not use the speaker so cannot comment on that.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Stuart Stringham
Reviews.Content: Love my new tv.  I picture quality is the main reason I love my new tv.  It was also light and easy to get up and running.

Reviews.Title: Consistent with Consumer Reports' excellent rating
Reviews.Author: Sahajanand "NN"
Reviews.Content: Micro-dimming feature and smart hub are great features. Sound is wonderful. No need to spend extra dollars to get sound bar etc.Picture quality is great -- although my condo associations still has old fashioned analog cable service. However with the smart hub features and Amazon prime one can easily get to see nice TV programs and movies at often no cost with true F7100 quality. Love it.Only con I would list is that the e-manual is very sketchy and Samsung's customer service cannot answer questions because they may be referring to outdated product manuals. One has to struggle to find the answer oneself. I did so to logout of one of my Amazon accounts and to reregister in another account!

Reviews.Title: 65" Samsung replaces 55" Panasonic VT30
Reviews.Author: Reels
Reviews.Content: My two your old friend, my Panasonic Plasma started getting the 7 blinking lights of death. I was able to narrow down the board that failed, but no one has stock, so a new TV it was.After looking at sets until my eyes started to bleed and read reviews until I was dizzy, this is the set I settled on. It has only been a few weeks, but it has far exceeded my expectations for picture. I thought the 3D was hoeky, but it is actually pretty cool with the free channels directv offers.I haven't played with the smart features and apps to much. Many of them I have on my Directv genie or DVR, and I hardly use those other than You tube and Pandora. They work ok, not great, but ok. But that is now why I bought this set.I have not done any fine tuning with colors yet, and so far see no reason too. I live in the middle of BFE so I haven't found anyone close who offers this service anyway.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: hyeongjaelee
Reviews.Content: The product is really good I like the Samsung design is nice and good picture qualityAnd then like a good choice in this product

Reviews.Title: Every thing is great...except
Reviews.Author: Elk Chaser
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best TV that I have ever bought. It is a Smart TV and is actually a bit too smart. I am still trying to figure everything out but so far it is smarter than I am. So many features to explore. If there is one thing that I dislike, it is the remote control. I have reset the sensitivity to the least sensitive setting and still it is changing the channel or feed or something when I pick it up wrong. I try not to touch any buttons or the slide screen until I know what I want to do. This problem(in my opinion) is not big enough for me to give it 4 stars. Everything else is "As good as it gets." I really hate that expression but for me it is true.

Reviews.Title: nice3d
Reviews.Author: park chul min
Reviews.Content: Samsung un65f7100 3d smart tv .very good nice price nice 3d system.Please buy now there is no regret..thanks too

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Peggy Wunn
Reviews.Content: We love this tv! Everything from delivery to picture quality is perfect. We would recommend this tv to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: Stunning Picture and Features
Reviews.Author: Rick K.
Reviews.Content: I only had the TV since 2.28.14 but have been very impressed with the picture quality and customization level compared to my 5yo 42" Syntax-Brillian. The most notable difference has been the refresh rate where all the video looks more "live". I've already found the TV for $300 USD less than the BEST price I could find less than a week ago!! *<B^@  >>Still love the TV<<

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: Tv came perfect condition never used like they had said.  Was so happy upon opening this product.  You can trust tradeport for great prices and quality!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel F Warner
Reviews.Content: I was concerned because of the many negative comments, but this TV is excellent. It's smart and if looks really, really good both outside and inside.

Reviews.Title: Love this tv
Reviews.Author: Erick S. Winchester
Reviews.Content: One year ago I was in the market for a tv for my family room. I had a 70 DLP Samsung that I had for the last 5 years and it was working perfectly just wanted LED. I bought a 60 inch loved it but was a little to small so I put that in my bedroom and bought this 65 inch and love it. Great tv

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Orellana
Reviews.Content: This TV set is great, cristal clear and light weighted, is pretty awesome, even the controller is fun jut to use, has enough connections to set up my devices, and gets along with other brands (My sound Bar is Sharp)The only downside, is that the setup doesn't have this sound bar registered, however is not a deal breaker, since they can work without being "smarted".With a good setup, you can use it to play videogames, have you cable box and some internet tv. And it will even allow you to set up different settings for each input.This was intended to be my wife's birthday gift, and boy it was a great one!

Reviews.Title: Nice quality...
Reviews.Author: Chong chaehon
Reviews.Content: Delivery is quick and kind.TV quality is excellent. I really enjoy watching high resolution and large screen.Nothing is insufficient in every way.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Devin Gilson
Reviews.Content: As with all Samsung Smart TV,s they are the best. I also have the 65 inch & they were flawlessly. Anything over 55 you pay quit a bit more for just make sure you get a well rated HMM I cable because they do make a difference.

Reviews.Title: Easy Setup... awesome quality
Reviews.Author: Franc Woods
Reviews.Content: So did not buy this through Amazon... but did quite a bit of research here and on the Samsung site.  This model and the CostCo version (UN65F7050) are the best buy going.  Great picture quality, easy setup, "interesting" voice command interface, but still getting use to the new menu layout.  Only installed since Monday and Dish coming out today to hook up new Hooper / Joey system so we can see how the HD quality works out.  Did pretty good with Netflix over WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Looks and works great!!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Borgnine
Reviews.Content: Had a bunch of Amazon Gift Cards and had been looking at a replacement LCD TV for the bedroom.  The price was great and according to a lot of other reviews between this and the newer 7500 series from Samsung, the benefits to the newer set did not justify the price difference. The picture quality is great, just be sure to shut off all the different motion settings. If you leave them on, you will see jittery video that is quite annoying. The remote is ok but we have a universal remote for all the components, so no big deal. Hope this LCD lasts as long as the old, flat screen Panasonic CRT tv it has replaced.

Reviews.Title: Some issues and a lot of adjusting but a very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: What I like about this TV…Thin profile and thin bezel.  Nice picture, once it is adjusted.What I do not like….The side-viewing angle is somewhat limited, but no so narrow that it’s impossible to view from the side.In 3 of the 4 picture modes, the tv uses micro-dimming (MD) and it can’t be turned off.  Only the “Movie” mode turns the MD off.  I find that the MD is very distracting and if it weren't for the “movie” mode, I would have sent the tv back.It took me nearly a week of tweaking and fine-tuning before the picture color and contrast were acceptable. Getting the contrast right was the most difficult issue.The tv has a digital optical audio output for audio receivers that do not have HDMI inputs.  The problem is that the tv only outputs 2 channel sound from this output, not 5.1 from the sources that are input into the tv (Cable box, DVD, etc.)  Although, it will output 5.1 from the smart apps, like Youtube, netfix, etc.) This problem might not be solely unique to this tv, I believe it may be the case with all tvs. Also, the sound/picture sync adjustment is not effective when you use the audio optical output, just the sound that is output through the HDMI connection.The inputs for older equipment are limited.  Beside the HDMI inputs, you can connect only 1 component video source OR 1 composite video source, not both at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but praise for this Television... Hooked up to my DISH and surround system it works impeccably. With allot of features that I dont if use. Yet it is nice knowing they are there and can be used anytime I want.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "C Starks"
Reviews.Content: Great television with a beautiful picture. The remote control takes a little practice to get use to. After playing around with the remote I got the hang of it. Plenty of aps (HBO Go, Netflix, YouTube, ESPN, etc....) it syncs well with my DIRECTV 3D channels. Can't wait to watch a 3D movie.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: rodel
Reviews.Content: Crystal clear,,, and 3d view is great,,, should have bought 60" , but don't want the hustle of returning it back, good price as well

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: kellysong16
Reviews.Content: I really like it, good quality and nice shape. I have done a lot of search and believe this is the best.When I got it, I know I made a perfect choice! Well done me!

Reviews.Title: Love this tv.
Reviews.Author: P.S.
Reviews.Content: We upgraded from a 52" samsung lcd tv from around 2008 and its amazing how much better this tv looks.  That 52" looked great so you can imagine.  Its light like a picture frame, kinda crazy how light it is.  The ability for this tv to talk wirelessly to the samsung 3d BD player is cool too.  Makes input switching much easier, you dont have to.  even with a reciever hooked up it still puts the tv on the that input, it learned.  its a learning computer, constantly intaking everything you say, and don't say.  Like once I walked into my living room and scratched my head and my tv came on and told me "You look like you need a back massage".  How'd it know??  How'd it know, because its a genius.  Buy two of these and keep one above your bed attached to the ceiling.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Diana Reis Daniels
Reviews.Content: The picture of this TV is just amazing. We have watched a few in #D and i can't believe how real it all looks, Set up was easy also

Reviews.Title: My smart TV is wonderful!
Reviews.Author: Lucky
Reviews.Content: The picture is so clear and immediate. We feel we are in the room with the actors! The 3D is very good, at times the objects seem as if they are feet in front of the TV. Watching internet services such as Netflix is easy, I am very happy I bought this TV! I hope it lasts a long time.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: James A. Frissina "jfriss"
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing. The picture quality is not as good as a comparable sony set, but this is just a slight difference that is made up by the sleekness of the unit and use ability of the smart hub. The picture is amazing. The 3 d will blow your mind

Reviews.Title: Nice tv, good brightness and colors.
Reviews.Author: Siarhei Kuzmin
Reviews.Content: TV has vivid colors and brightness.Pros:As other LCDs no burning compared to plasma and no bad vertical angles as in PN60F8500 (important for xbox one kinect games and for kids watching from the floor).Cons:Non uniform backlit in low light environment.UI could be faster. I would certainly remove the animation if this could speed up the UI / improve response.My remote from C-series is better in many situations, small size is rather not a benefit. The remote is constantly got lost. I wonder when someone at last made a button on the tv to make remote beep (not talking about attaching kind of RFID to make it trackable by different means :)Overall very nice tv. Going to live with it until big OLED or quantum dots displays become affordable / available.

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture
Reviews.Author: Jeff Balkan
Reviews.Content: After extensive research including reading, viewing in stores, and talking to users I chose this 60 inch 3D model.  The picture is amazing, especially sports.  There is depth even when not using 3D. The colors are pure and vibrant.  The 3D is startling, bringing the picture into the room.  The "smart" aspect is amazing as well allowing you to surf the web, select movies, view photos, etc. with ease.  The remote is "high tech" and sophisticated but  requires practice and help from users guide. Keeping in mind that I am not an audiophile, I find the sound to be outstanding without purchasing a sound bar and additional speakers.  It was easy to hookup and relatively simple by following on screen instructions to program. The set came with 4 pairs of lightweight active 3D glasses also simple to use and amazing for viewing.

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: R. Muenks
Reviews.Content: Amazing looking television. The best feature is how small the bezel is! However, I've had issues with my apps being deleted or reset or updated Randomly apps like vudu or hbogo will be deleted. At the same times apps like netflix and amazon will be reset. This causes me to have to re-enter passwords and re-download apps. Otherwise a great television.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality is Amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Mark L Johnson
Reviews.Content: This TV gets 5 stars because it's simply amazing.  The picture quality is great.  It's so crips and vivid.  On some programs, it looks as though you could reach in and touch the characters.  It's hard to explain, but its really life-like.  I haven't played much with the SMART features just yet, but I can already tell they'll come in handy.  Many reviews complain about the swype pad on the remote, but I haven't had any problems with it.  The remote is 'smart' also, so I was able to pair it with my U-Verse set-top box and my Samsung Blu-Ray player.  I can access all the 'Guide,' 'DVR,' and rewind/forwarding features on the smart remote, just as I could with my set-top remote.  Could Samsung simplify the remote by not using the swype pad?  Sure, but it's really not a big deal once you get used to it.  Overall, I love my TV and if you purchase it, you will too.

Reviews.Title: UNBELIEVABLE PICTURE.
Reviews.Author: LOWGUY
Reviews.Content: HAD A 47 INCH LCD AND THOUGHT THE PICTURE WAS GREAT BUT THIS LED TV HAS A PICTURE OUT OF THIS WORLD. I'VE HAD IT ABOUT A MONTH AND LOVE IT. HAD FREE SHIPPING AND THEY HAD IT UP AND RUNNING IN 15 MINUTES. THEY JUST TURNED IT ON TO MAKE SURE IT FIRED UP AND LEFT ALL THE CONNECTIONS AND SETUP TO ME BUT THAT WAS FINE.. I HAD READ SOME REVIEWS WHERE PEOPLE COMPLAINED ABOUT THE REMOTE NOT BEING STANDARD AND BEING MORE LIKE A SMART PHONE WITH THE SCREEN. I TOOK A WHILE TO GET USE TO IT BUT YOU GET THE HANG OF IT REAL FAST. THE BROWSER WORKS FINE BUT I DON'T USE IT... I HAVE A COMPUTER FOR THAT.  THE PICTURE IS WHY I BOUGHT THE TV AND IT'S OUTSTANDING. OTHER REVIEWS COMPLAINED ABOUT THE SOUND NOT BEING LOUD ENOUGH BUT I DIDN'T SEEM TO THINK THAT WAS A PROBLEM. THE TV ONLY HAD DIGITAL OUTPUT TO AN EXTERNAL SOURCE BUT YOU CAN PICK UP A DIGITAL TO ANALOG CONVERTER FOR $15 BUCKS AND HOOK THE TV UP TO YOUR OLD AMP IF NEED BE.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: T. K.
Reviews.Content: I have an aversion to spending wads of money, so I always look for the best value. I found it in this TV. It is absolutely awesome -- the resolution, crispness, and vibrant colors are magnificent -- beyond expecations. The sound is good, but I'm going to get some speakers for a better audio experience. We tried the 3D last night and felt like we were at the movies -- but the resolution was so much higher than the big screen. This family never wants to go to a theatre to see a movie again after watching this TV, so it is going to pay for itself pretty quickly!

Reviews.Title: Perfect tv, better price.
Reviews.Author: Naomi Heideman
Reviews.Content: Perfect tv for me. Stunning picture. Has the 240 hz, dimming, and 3d without all the extras I wouldn't use. Came out of the box without requiring immediate calibration.  Not a single negative thing to say about it.  Got the 65 inch model for less than 2 thousand with free shipping. No buyers remorse at all. Get one!

Reviews.Title: Just Okay.
Reviews.Author: razvan popa
Reviews.Content: Pros:Big, thin, bright, excelent for bright rooms, good apps, I like the remote, sync with Samsung soundbar very nice.Cons:Light bleed and clouding(for this price??), poor black levels, very very poor agle viewing.Totaly dissapointed with this tv. Got caught into the reviews hype. I guess most of the reviews are from people coming from +10 years old TV's. Moved the new tv in the bedroom and brought back the 2 years old plasma. I wished to love this tv so bad, tried every single calibration setting that i could find....but the mediocre image quality other then Blu-ray doesnt make this an atractive TV for this price range.Im waiting for my new plasma and ready to Craiglist this "so call amazing set"......

Reviews.Title: Quality Picture
Reviews.Author: D. Stevenson
Reviews.Content: You cant get a better picture at this price. Vivid colors, pretty strong blacks.
