Highly responsive, good for movies and sports.Love the SmartTV, wasnt expecting much but I watch Netflix, Youtube and Amazon Prime TV quite often.The remote is kinda quirky with apps, not a deal breaker. That could be my biggest complaint.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ronni Klein
Reviews.Content: Great picture and easy to use but voice command does not recognize my New York accent Glad I bought it

Reviews.Title: gorgeous tv! OMG!
Reviews.Author: Beatle
Reviews.Content: I have had my eye on this tv for a year or so now and o finally purchased one last week. And I had to write a review!The picture quality on this tv is unsurpassed! I've done my research and read all the reviews and I'm here to say if you buy this tv you will not regret it!Out of the box its super easy to set up! Only 4 screws to attach the base. It's super light! It weighs less than my 50 inch lcd!The picture quality is awesome! Sure you have to tweet the settings some but you can look up picture configuration settings online.The 3d on this tv is jaw dropping! The glasses are super light and the battery life lasts a very long time!It comes with 4 pairs or glasses so you and friends are all set to enjoy some great 3d action!The remote has a voice command feature which is fun to use.  I use it to impress my friends and tell them my tv listens to my every command! :)The smart features are amazing! From netflix to hulu to surfing the web. Everything is so easy and assessable.I love the 3d on button on the remote! It will turn anything your watching be it a movie or live tv into 3d! It looks awesome! I couldn't be happier with my purchase and would highly recommend anyone that's thinking about buying this tv to do so!It's my dream tv and my dream has just come true!

Reviews.Title: Great so far.
Reviews.Author: Jo D
Reviews.Content: Just an initial review. I will update once I use it more, the apps, in different lighting situations.Delivery was great, in my opinion. I didn't expect them to do anything but to drop it off and let me sign for it. Instead, the guy also educated me on what I should do if there is a problem with the TV and how Amazon would deal with it.I plugged in the TV, powered it on. Went through a set-up program, much like a phone/computer/gaming console. I connected the TV to my wireless network, which has a password and MAC filtering. The TV gives you the MAC address right up front as it is performing the connection, so you don't have to search for it. Connected without a problem. Can't say anything for the Smart HUB function with a provider, since I don't have cable or satellite.I then attached my tablet with a HDMI cable, just to do a fast check with Netflix (TV has Netflix app itself, but I didn't go that route initially) to see if there were any dead pixels. I didn't see any.I will say that the remote takes some getting used to. It is small, and doesn't have many buttons. Relies on a menu on the TV that pops up. You then use the trackpad (or whatever it is) to navigate. You slide your finger across it to move the on-screen cursor, and push it in as a button. You don't tap it like a phone, you actually push it in. I prefer the classic TV remotes. Course, this remote has the basics, volume and channel up/down. To punch in numbers individually, you actually write them in on the trackpad.Sound is actually much better than I expected, being only 1"+ in thickness. Course, I'm connecting it to a 7.1 system, so that isn't really a factor for me anyways.

Reviews.Title: Holy WOW tv!
Reviews.Author: chris16
Reviews.Content: This tv is AMAZING!!! It is so clear that it looks like your standing in the middle of the action. Being abel to use multi screen on my phone and tables is a really bad ass! The remote has a touch pad and takes a minute to get use to but its really nice. I would highly recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: Best purchase till date...
Reviews.Author: Rupesh
Reviews.Content: No doubt; Best electronic purchase till date. I received my TV in 2 days with free shipping. I had to spend some time to get familiar with remote and different settings; but, once I got familiar and used to with touch pad remote, it got much more smooth and easier. It started flickering every few seconds after the firmware update next day and that gave me some hard time. It was flickering only on my cable but had no issue on dish/dvd/usb. I tried to get support from Samsung support center but no help/resolution; then, I called my cable company and they asked me to reset cable box and ALL is well again. I love picture quality in both 2d and 3d. No issue or complaints so far..

Reviews.Title: I should have bought this sooner...I love it!!
Reviews.Author: Bill Augustyn
Reviews.Content: This is day one, but WOW!  UN65F7100  Set-up was easy, picture is spectacular, 3D was very cool (but not why I bought this model but I had to try it out with IMAX Under the Sea).  The sound is MUCH better than I expected for a flat screen.  Amazon delivery was on time and TV arrived in PERFECT condition.  It's cold up here, so they wouldn't turn it on....but no problems found.  I'm a very happy camper.  Will follow up when I figure out how to use all the features.OK..4 days later.  We absolutely love it and it was a bit hit for Thanksgiving football games.  I haven't experienced any of the seemingly endless trivial complaints from some of the reviews I've read. OK, one thing...the batteries for the included 3D glasses don't last very long.  If you're buying for 3D, that's the weak link.  The TV 3D picture was outstanding (using Samsung BD-F7500 I just purchased) It was even fun using the 2D -> 3D function on a football game (regular HD broadcast).It's hard for me to imagine that there is a better quality picture out there! The stand looks nice and this thing is REALLY slim.19-Dec-2013UN65F7100 65" is still perfect!  Football games are an entirely new viewing experience (from my prior Samsung DLP 55").  In addition, Amazon quickly and efficiently stuck by their 2 week "Low-Price" guarantee.  6 stars...no kidding! and I'm a very tough grader.

Reviews.Title: Great features - very light weight.
Reviews.Author: Stephen H Bates
Reviews.Content: Great flat screen TV.  Was plug and play right out of the box. Was so light and easy to handle my wife and I were able to hang it on the wall mount effortlessly.  A real bonus were the four pairs of 3D glasses.  Linked up to my Wi-Fi system first try.  The smart TV features included are really fun.  It takes some tweaking to get the color/contrast right but very easy to do.  We use it in conjunction with our home entertainment center that includes a Blu-Ray player, a Roku player, and a Denon receiver.  All interfaced nicely.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this TV. Going on six months now... The picture is unbelievably clear and the 3D is pretty neat. I don't like having to wear the glasses so we don't watch a lot of 3D but it's cool. One thing... You have to sync the glasses with the TV or they will not work. The glasses are battery operated. I highly recommend this TV to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: mstngman
Reviews.Content: Great TV  picture is outstanding 3-D is  fantastic. Looks good sounds good all around great set . You get a lot for your money

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Timberlan
Reviews.Content: Set up was easy although the user manual is very light in content.  I love to watch my sports, specifically hockey and Football. Great picture. This is what a smart TV should be.  I spent a lot of time looking for a quality TV and this is what I chose.  I haven't spent a lot of time exploring the 3D options just yet.  I have it set up on a entertainment stand and the swivel is just great.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at a great price
Reviews.Author: Donna
Reviews.Content: Love this tv. It took my husband awhile to get the settings correct so that the picture did not look raw. But once he did get the settings right...the picture is amazing.

Reviews.Title: I love my Samsung TV!!
Reviews.Author: Reader from MN "Glenn"
Reviews.Content: This TV has an unbelievably beautiful picture with terrific clarity, and beautiful color!  There are so many features, that two months after getting it we still haven't tried everything out.  My previous 40" TV was a Samsung, about four years old, and this TV continues to reinforce my belief that Samsung is the only TV to buy!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Thomas H
Reviews.Content: Samsung does not disappoint with this television. I ordered it through Amazon, and had a delivery scheduled. The delivery guy showed up two hours early, not know the delivery time... luckily I was home. He unboxed the television and plugged it in to the wall so I could verify the blue screen. I began my setup... put it on my stand an used the settings offered by other Amazon users... tweeking here and there. I love the remote! The picture is great, screen mirroring, Samsung Apps.. It takes sometime to set up Hulu, nextflix, pandora.. getting all the codes from the televison and entering them on the respective website, but once they are set up you are ready to go. Ill update as I put the televison through the motions. Get a sound bar... huge difference!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with Purchase
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV (UN55F7100) over the weekend from a local store and I am very pleased. I already had my previous TV mounted so it was easy to take the brackets off the old one and put it on the new TV and hang it up. After I powered it up, the initial setup screen was very easy such as connecting to my WiFi, updating the TV, and setting up the guide. I watched all the NFL games over the weekend, also played a few games of NHL 14 on the PS3, and the picture quality is stunning. I also have a Samsung Galaxy S3 and the AllShare is great for sending my videos and pictures to the TV for viewing. I also played a full length film from my phone through AllShare and had no buffering issues.I have read some reviews on the Smart Remote for this TV being horrible, well I personally really like it. I have not experienced any issues yet and it syncs right with my Comcast box. I also programmed my sound system for the power, mute, volume up and down functions to be used with the Smart Remote.So far the only issue that I have had was the YouTube app that is on the TV. The onscreen keyboard is a joke and makes searching for videos a complete pain. Then when I tried to send a YouTube video from my Samsung Galaxy S3 to the TV, I couldn't not get it to connect. I even paired the two devices, and signed in with my YouTube account. So my work around so far was to view the video on the phone for a second so that it would show up in my history and then select that video on the TV. It beats trying to search for the video.As for the other apps I have nothing to report on, and most likely won't be using the apps since I don't do Netflix or Hulu and such.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: beverly anne oconnor
Reviews.Content: 8 months ago I purchased a 55" Samsung for my bedroom. As I was and still am thoroughly happy with that purchase, I decided to get the newer 65" version for my living room. Just as the previous TV, this has a beautiful picture and I am very happy with both Samsung TV's that I have purchased. After reading some bad reviews, I decided to purchase the extended warranty just in case. Amazon offered the best warranty for the longest period at the best price. The 3D is wonderful on both TV's. my only issue is that on the 65"(when watching normal TV-not fast paced sports), there seems to be a slight jitter when the subject on the screen moves very quickly. I think that has something to do with the 240 Hz.setting. I will look into it and I am sure that I can re-adjust a setting to fix this issue. The only thing that I have not tried is the voice control on the remote. This new generation remote works very well moving between normal TV and the smart TV settings. I would highly recommend both the older 55" and this newer 65" version. Picture is phenomenal!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Wall Set
Reviews.Author: Habeas Opus
Reviews.Content: This television set has been fabulous.  The picture was great right out of the box, the streaming to all SmartTV apps is flawless and the touch sensitive remote is way cool.  Some reviewers thought it was gimicky, but I really like the sleek look and relatively light weight.  This TV has all the specs I was shopping for, and some I wasn't (like 3D, really who needs it),  The greatest thing though, has been something I didn't even know I was missing before.  The dual core processor give a practically instant startup, and since all connectivity is through the built-in wi-fi, there is no need to wait for multiple component to start up.  Also, did I mention the ONE convenient small remote.  The sound on this set is good enough in a medium sized living room that I don't feel the need for a home theater or additional speakers.So to recap.  I love this TV because I could mount it on my wall, hide one power cord and I was finished.  The ultra-thin stainless bezel just adds to the sleek minimalist look.If you have to know, yes the feature set is also great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous TV - BUT...
Reviews.Author: Wilkie "Paul"
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks living with this monster 75" tv on our wall, we really love the picture, but...There are light patches in the corners that drive me nuts in dark scenes. Tech support say turn down the backlight, which I have done, but they are still there.It is not as smart as they claim, in fact I am starting to suspect that the channel recommendations have no relation to those that I actually watch, and are some kind of plot to get me to watch Ted Turner's channels! Then, when I select a channel, the TV chooses the analog channel and I have to reach for the cable remote to punch in the digital one.However...I bought a Samsung 3D dvd player to go with it, and Avatar is amazing in 3D.Overall, it is close to a 5, my bride says she is never going to the movies again, much prefers the TV.And, no matter what they say, size DOES matter!

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome
Reviews.Author: MajorDMP
Reviews.Content: This TV is just plain awesome. My last TV(about 4 years old) was also a Samsung before they went LED and super thin. The picture clarity is the best I've seen and beyond just messing with some of the picture controls, it looks great out of the box. I watched Avatar in 3D and was blown away on the clarity of the picture and the depth the 3D can produce. Buy it and you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Darrell Jennings
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy with this TV.  It's extremely thin, very sharp and the 3D works well.  My only complaint is the remote control has a track pad that is way too sensitive and you end up in places on the TV that you never intended.  I would definitely buy it again and recommend it, but they need a redesign on their remote.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding quality
Reviews.Author: da walker
Reviews.Content: I can't add anything I've already read in other reviews. This is a great TV. Bought the 65". I'm using 3 remotes though and although a bit of a hassle w/ ARC technology, I'll work through it as I get more in tune w/ the ARC technology. I can't plug my Direct TV HDMI cable to the Samsung ARC input and maybe someone on here will be able to steer me to the right direction. Other than that, wouldn't trade this TV for any other brand. Samsung ROCKS!!!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: E. Perez "Judith Pg"
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing, the delivery was great!! The man brought it upstairs and even installed it which made my job way easier. It's amazing and comes with 4 glasses which is good for my whole family!! I would recommend

Reviews.Title: oustanding
Reviews.Author: antione r oglesby
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best led TV that I have ever owned, the HD picture quality on this TV, is just incredible, SAMSUNG makes the best TV 's on the market.

Reviews.Title: Great smart tv
Reviews.Author: Neco
Reviews.Content: This is a great smart tv. It is really light and thin, it has a beautiful stand, the netflix app it is pretty good and the 2d to 3d function it works extremely good. It converts any 2d channel, video or movie into 3d. The only thing that I do not like its the mute button on the remote. Every time that I grab the remote it mutes the tv (because the mute button it is one of its sides). Overall a great product.

Reviews.Title: Requires significant customization
Reviews.Author: Arlington
Reviews.Content: This was a major upgrade for me over an old Sony LCD that I had for about 5 years. The picture quality is amazing during bright scenes. However, the picture during dark scenes or if you are watching at night in a dark room is not the best. There's quite a bit of clouding around the bezel of the TV. Also, the side viewing angle is not great as screen colors become significantly washed out. The TV also requires a significant amount of customization out of the box as the picture is almost unwatchable (I had major buyers remorse when I first powered it up). I would also recommend turning auto motion completely off as the soap opera effect makes things difficult to sit through. I'm probably being a little generous with this rating but I knew about the issues with the TV, so that's my fault, and the picture in normal or bright scenes really is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality... leakage of blacks..
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: First of all. This is my first ever Samsung product. I have always owned LG products (mostly Televisions), but I decided to go with Samsung after seeing a friend of mines television set.Picture quality is great. Great colours and fast response rates make this TV extremely beautiful. The only issue I am having, however, are the blacks. Leakage from every corner. Large circular spots make dark scenes an eye sore. I'm more of a gamer, so I do see the spots more when playing certain types of games. Not sure how this will look during a dark movie.I'm giving it a 3 star rating because I like the features of the TV and the bright colours it produces. Also, the response rate is great. But I just can't get past the leakage of the blacks. Hope this helps potential buyers.

Reviews.Title: great picture, lousy gimmicks
Reviews.Author: FatherofYoda
Reviews.Content: picture is great, sound is OK (but that's why you have a home theater system).  Nonfunctional to the point of annoying is the voice thing, which never understands me (I have virtually no accent, I'm from Philadelphia); also this "universal remote" function ... a joke! The TV and the Home Theater are both Samsung, but the remotes will never control the other device. At all. Almost had it with the tv control and the "on off" function of the home theater, but nope, didn't. And to do that you've got to move their gizmo (an "IR Blaster" ... what a technical name!) in front of the home theater. Sorry, doesn't work.  The apps on the TV cannot give you 5.1 sound because the output must go from your cable (or satellite) box to the home theater system, not from the digital audio out from the TV. And as to the screen that should let you select another program when you turn the thing on? HA!!!!!!!! Samsung then tells me it's just supposed to tell you what's on, not to control it. Well, gee, that's what I thought a TV with a remote should do.  The "recommendations" the TV gives you for what to watch?  HAHAHAHA!!!!!  Some body from Samsung wasn't just smokin', they were hallucinating!The TV picture is good enough for five starts, these annoyances bring the review to 4 stars, which I think is a bit generous.Sloppy work, Samsung! You make a great TV then you have five-year olds try to put on the finishing touches!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Wesley Craft
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture quality, 3d picture is better than going to a movie theatre.Great TV for the price. Would highly recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great picture until it died.
Reviews.Author: David A. "ATLDC9"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv locally as we wanted to have the tv installed quickly, our old tv had died after 14 years. The install went great and the tv worked well for about 2 months. At the end of December no picture, no power, it's dead. Called Samsung and we had service scheduled. First service cancelled due to weather? The tv is not outside, it was cold and windy but we are in Atlanta, it's not like we had winter weather. We then had the service tech come a week later, he had the main circuit board but not the power supply board. Oops gotta order another part, sorry. We were scheduled another appointment early the next week, no call, no fix, after a call we were told the wrong part was sent. Another appointment scheduled for the next week and no fix, no call, another call to the service center, Part came in broken, we will schedule you for early next week. A pattern is emerging, so a call to Samsung, not the service center. Oops sorry, how about we exchange it for you? Now they are saying wait a week for them to approve the exchange they suggested before we can even schedule the exchange. So now we are waiting for another week and I don't hold much hope that this will end in satisfaction.Pros:1. Great bright picture, this tv is in our family room and the tv has no problem in a room with light.2. Includes 4 pairs of 3d glasses. Not a feature we were looking for but it works well.3. Great Smart Features, they most likely have any app or service you could want.Cons:1. TV dependability and Samsung service.2. Does need some tweaking of settings to get the best picture. The good news is you can find settings online that work great so you don't have to do a full calibration yourself.Great looking TV with great features and picture, now if only we can get one that works.

Reviews.Title: Having Problems
Reviews.Author: Shannon Balch
Reviews.Content: Received the television and was amazed until I found two LEDs not working.  And now the television displays a white box that moves across the screen whenever watching a letterbox movie or the resolution does not match full screen size.  I am still in the middle of getting the TV repaired.  Only because the replacement panel had more problems than the original panel.

Reviews.Title: 3d has too much crosstalk
Reviews.Author: Imran Razvi
Reviews.Content: I have owned the TV for 6 months now and I like the tv apart from the fact that 3d is completely unwatchable. It was the primary reason I bought it for. Otherwise I could have bought a lower end TV without 3d and save like 600$. There is just too much crosstalk/ghosting. Apart from that the TV is fabulous. That's not the reason for the 1 star though. The main reason for the 1 star is because of their customer service. It is just horrendous, not Samsung directly but the companies they hire to fulfill the requests. One of their companies Service Quick simply lies about the problem and its resolution. They came down 3 times to my place and then completely lied to Samsung that they have fixed the problem when they didn't. Samsung customer service wasn't very helpful in acknowledging the problem. They kept on harping that there is nothing they could do until their so called agencies confirmed that there is a problem. After more than 2 hours on the call I got them to assign the ticket to a new customer service center. I will update the review after it gets completed.

Reviews.Title: Fast moving sports are absolutely awful
Reviews.Author: S.C.P. "SP"
Reviews.Content: I just got this Samsung UN65F7100 LED.  I will make this quick- i did a ton of research on TV's - i decided that Plasma was not the way to go because of many bad things i have read about them- mostly being the bright room glare and reflection aspect.  For me i care most about refresh rate and fast moving sports - Ice Hockey, Tennis, Football.  Thus far the picture quality on this TV is great.. no doubt about that. However - watching Ice Hockey was absolutely awful.  I tried tweaking the settings and am still unable to get anywhere close to desired performance.  there seem to be many options for tweaking the setting for actual picture quality but only few for refresh rates and the like.  Well I have tried all of the few settings there are and it is an absolute disappointment.  Samsung was zero help as well.  If someone knows something to help me with this - that would be most appreciated.  But other wise this TV is going back and i definitely would not recommend this tv if you are watching a lot of sports......10/4/13 - updating my rating to 3 stars- as having tweaked and calibrated some of the settings the picture quality has improved. still not where i would like it and now seeing the color changing/ fading in and out constantly. Its a work in progress i guess.....

Reviews.Title: Just OK not great.
Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: First let me be clear about a few things in this review, we purchased the tv on Black Friday in 2013.I did all my research for about a month before deciding on this tv. I'm going to try and be as honest and straight forward as possible.First, while researching LED tvs there are some things you HAVE to know. LED tvs have lighting issues, and it's not set to one brand or specific company, it's the technology, in my opinion LED tvs still just aren't there quality wise, which doesn't make sense as they've been on the market for years and the quality control between brands is wildly different. You're basically playing the panel lottery any time you purchase a LARGE LED tv set, period. Smaller LED tvs usually don't have the below issues as much.LED tvs can have issues such as:- Flash lighting (where lights from the LEDS will shine back into the panel in each corner or from the edges)- Clouding (This a defect in the panel in which lights can look cloudy in dark or black spaces - Try a youtube or google search on this one)- Banding (This effects the image in a way that looks like a ripple in water is appearing in dark spaces - again try a google image or youtube search)- Different brands use different companies to supply the actual panel/displays. Samsung uses 3 different factories for their displays, which means some factories will have better quality control than others, this is why you play the panel lottery when you purchase a LED tv of this size, and unfortunately tvs in the same class from other companies fall into the same or similar issues.PROS:- The picture quality of this tv is pretty amazing. We purchased the 60" model and was amazed at how HD anything looks on this tv right out of the box.- We love the remote, we've seen tons of people complain about it, but we haven't had any issues, but we own two apple tv boxes in our home and are used to touch remotes using our phones. This isn't much different at all, and most people just don't know how to use the remote intuitively. It works completely fine, and if you just thought of the touch area as a mouse you'll tend to learn it a bit faster. You can scroll vertically in menus so that you don't have to go back each time to change a setting, which most people tend to not know.- The panel itself is superbly thin, another qualifier when we were researching tvs, we also love the stand, an Apple tv box and the IR for the remote fit perfectly underneath in the middle.- Setup was a breeze, as was the wifi connecting, which so many people seem to have issues with. For some bg info we have a Apple Airport Extreme Router, with a 30mb down 3 up connection. That maybe why we get such good results.- The OS (operating system) was quick, and the design was nice and simple to use, compared to some other tvs we tried and like this one most.CONS:- Unfortunately my unit has both fashlighting and clouding. The flashlighting isn't bad on our unit, only at the top and bottom just above the logo. The clouding however, is pretty bad, but we weren't going to send the unit back to amazon again just to play the panel lottery. There's a huge chance to get one worse or equal to the problems you may already have. Yes this is an expensive purchase, be we feel it's not worth the hassle.- This set has a terrible side viewing angle. Anything passed 90 degrees and the contrast, color and darks fade away instantly. Terrible for a tv of this cost, size, and quality. Our couch sits about 6ft away from this beast, so if your tv is in a bigger space this may not be as big of a deal to some of you. We do plan on moving to someplace bigger and will hopefully be able to deal with this issue better down the road.- Picture settings. It's not the settings themselves that has the issue. It's getting this tv setup for your liking. We're STILL trying to get each input set to what each device needs to be nearly 3 weeks later. It takes a long time to get this tv setup right, it looks awesome in HD but looks absolutely terrible for normal SD 480i tv. It's basically forcing us to upgrade to HD (we're fine with that, but be aware that normal tv viewing looks like crap right out of the box) you will have to spend a great deal of time setting the picture up for a great viewing experience. We also tried many of the settings posted in the reviews, and while all of them made HD look even more gorgeous it just made watching regular tv even worse. We're still continuously setting ours to get it just right.To be clear the picture settings we continuously run into are usually the skin tones and colors. On standard definition tv if you don't have it set JUST right, skin tones are either way over or under saturated with oranges or reds. We also have to compensate for the flash and cloud lighting. Changing the settings can improve both of those issues depending on how bad your tv is, ours does become acceptable after playing around with settings and even helps the side angles some, but we haven't found a perfect medium for all four of those issues yet, which is why we have continuously had to play with it.- This Tv pretty much requires a software upgrade to fix some color issues and bugs. Ours failed in the setup but went through when we ran the update after the tv was setup. Here's a tip though, as painful as this is to do. People have had better results after doing an update, completely resetting the tv and all it's settings and starting over again like the tv is new. This assures that the software installs correctly and your tv is fully up to date without any issues.MISC:- We haven't tried the 3D yet, but we didn't purchase this tv for the 3D, we bought it for the 240hz which is only available on most 3d tvs.- We haven't tried any of the included apps or services (like hulu or amazon instant) we have all that already, just about every home device includes smart features, our xbox, playstation, apple tv, and bluray players all have the same thing as this tv. It wasn't important to us.OVERALL:We're not in Love with this set, but nor do we hate it. It's just an "OK" tv. We had a 6 year old JVC LCD 42" with an ipod dock before this one, and while it also had flashlighting issues, it looked great right out of the box, we didn't have to spend weeks setting it up, had perfect side viewing angles, the ipod dock worked great, and hadn't had any issues with it since we bought it. It will now sit in our bedroom for the next 5 years or until it goes out. The Samsung tv has been a hassle to setup, and we hate the side viewing angles, even if we were in a bigger space, we don't believe a tv of this size and cost from a reputable company should have any issues like this in 2013. Samsung also needs to get it's quality control better. Flashlighting and Clouding has been in LCD and LED tvs for the last 10 or so years, and they've been doing this too long for these issues still be a problem. Technology has moved passed these issues and shouldn't be an issue at all at this point.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.
Reviews.Author: Allen s
Reviews.Content: So far, this has been a great purchase.I was worried it wouldn't survive the shipping, and indeed, the box arrived with somescrapes and bashes, but there is so much styrofoam inside that everything was fine.Easy set up, although I admit I haven't tried a lot of the features yet, such as the active 3-D.I got the 46" version.Let me say what my first impressions were.The frame is silver. I thought it would be black. No, but it's so thin it's not a problem.The stand is very attractive, but is large, so if you think you can shove this against the wall, think again.Four legs project in each direction. I have it on a Ikea Hemnes unit, and it's in the center.I remember when I thought a 19" TV was adequate, after setting up the 46",my first reaction was, "I should have gotten the 55".At the time, I didn't want to trade features for inches. The 55" was another $300-$400, eh.Lots of adjustments, very user friendly. Intuitive.The remote with a touch pad works okay. I hate remotes with 500 buttons.I'd like to find a universal remote for all devices with a touch screen....and a reasonable price.Developers: How about an I-pad with a screen that says "TV", "DVD", "Cable", etc.Then, when you touch that icon, you only see the buttons necessary for that device.I don't need "Play" when I'm watching off air.(I know there's an app, but it gets terrible reviews.)Must haves for me were 1080P, an analog audio out, LED, at least 120 refresh rate, built in wi-fi, optional 3-D.That narrowed it down to two brands Sony and Samsung (of the "name" brands.)Why would anyone need 4 HDMI inputs? Give me choices!Samsung won.During the initial set up, it found my router easily, so I expect things like Netflix will be trouble free.Sometimes the devices are too smart. If you are playing a DVD, and for some reason change inputs,the TV says, "Oh he'd done with the DVD", and shuts it off. Thereby, going to the beginning again. Hey, let me decide!(My Sharp Aquos does the same thing).I can watch a movie with only the DVD remote, since the TV turns itself on when it sees the DVD fire up.So it's not always frustrating, just don't do anything to confuse it.This thing has more options than the space shuttle, I haven't scratched the surface.If I find a problem, I'll update this review.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Hojin Kim
Reviews.Content: screen was bigger than expected. I found it flawless and was satisfied by using it for  couple of days. Good.

Reviews.Title: Good picture but not as good as my old Pioneer plazma
Reviews.Author: G. Reed
Reviews.Content: at first I was so disappointed compared to my plasma but as time goes by and I get the picture more dialed in I am happy. nice and light to hang and very small edge so more picture.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Tim "Tim"
Reviews.Content: Not sure that spending more gets you a better TV - this one is awesome - the real test is how long will it last.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but be alerted...
Reviews.Author: J. King
Reviews.Content: I had one of these for a month, and while the picture was clear, it had a home video look to all movies. Be sure to google "soap opera effect" for how to reduce the 240 Hz overkill (good for sports, but fake for film).  The computer in these "smart" TVs fill in the difference between film frames per second and live sports FPS. Kind of like "colorizing" old B&W; classic movies on TNT.

Reviews.Title: Great TV in the day, blotchy blacks at night
Reviews.Author: eric
Reviews.Content: I bought and returned two Samsung UN65F7100 tvs recently from a store.  The picture quality is excellent in bright or medium light and the features are superb.  At night, however, the edge-lit LEDs bleed into the screen from the corners and some other cloudy areas show up too.  I took the first one back to the store and the manager did not believe me so we set the tv up in their dark theater room.  When he saw the screen he said they should not be this bad and I got a bad panel.  I took another one home and same thing but different cloud pattern.  I don't see how anyone could watch a darkish movie like batman or harry potter at night and not be annoyed the whole time.  I will only look for plasmas or full array LEDs from now on.

Reviews.Title: excellent product with perfect condition.
Reviews.Author: xiaodongliu
Reviews.Content: very nice,  and there is almost no problem with this product ...  at first, seems software going wrong, so there is a problem in speaker. but, it was fixed through  reboot...

Reviews.Title: Remote Software Glitches
Reviews.Author: Michael Green
Reviews.Content: The picture is stunning and this tv has all of the bells and whistles. But there is a problem that Samsung customer service just confirmed exists in the software that controls the remote control. It cannot be used to select a channel from the guide--I have to use my cable box remote to select channels. Apparently, Samsung is "working" on a fix, but not date has been promised, although this is not a brand new tv. I am astounded that Samsung has a product out with a known glitch that it has still not resolved. Beware before buying.

Reviews.Title: You will enjoy this TV
Reviews.Author: R. Moya
Reviews.Content: This HD LED TV look really good in my living room. I bought the 55" to replace my 3 year old 46" 9000 series Samsung HD LED TV. I have read a handful of reviews. Some have mentioned average picture quality, or shallow blacks, etc. Personally, as an average consumer like me, picture quality is amazing! It blows away my older Samsung TV. The best out of the box mode you should set it to is definitely the Movie Mode. All other modes like Dynamic Mode, is just too saturated and bright; not close to natural colors and tones.I used my Xbox One to calibrate the basic adjustments in Movie Mode, such as black levels and brightness, etc. It required very little adjustment. Great picture quality out the box! There is some degradation of picture quality as you stir away from the center of the TV. The viewing angles is fairly narrow. But you would have to be sitting an angle where you probably shouldn't be sitting while you're watching TV, movies or playing video games, to notice huge picture quality reduction.I cared less of the offering of the Smart Hub. Simply because my Xbox One offers most of the built-in apps. My stand alone cable box is linked to it too. Nonetheless, I did give it a whirl to see what it offers. The idea is cool, but the execution isn't great. Launching apps is slow and it lags quite a lot. So if you have Xbox One or PS4, your buying decision should be based, majority on picture quality, more so than the 'bells and whistles'.If this is going to be your main entertainment hub, Smart Hub user experience may not be the best.Overall, this TV is awesome! It is handsome; sporting sleek, thin design. Great picture quality (Out the box in Movie Mode). I love this TV!

Reviews.Title: Best tv ever
Reviews.Author: Justin D
Reviews.Content: 3d is not the best for these type of tvs but this is by far the best tv I have ever owned. I got a used one from the amazon warehouse and it is as good as new with phenomenal picture quality. I saved $800 and got one of the best tvs in the market.

Reviews.Title: We love it
Reviews.Author: Ken in Florida "bluechip"
Reviews.Content: The TV provides an excellent picture with very smooth motion. We have other 240hz Tv's and this one is the best.

Reviews.Title: Almost Perfect
Reviews.Author: Robert Bushby
Reviews.Content: I used to have a Toshiba 62DLP, so this was a huge upgrade in terms of picture and features.Yes, I did a ton of research before buying it! I suspect you have too at this point.Mine is a 7150 not a 7100. and I got it at a specialized dealer that deals in customer returns that he job-lots from the big box stores, so I got mine for 999.00 in perfect condition with a keyboard, remote, and 4 glasses, just no box. What a deal!I subscribe to a lot of home theatre sites and I also work in the integration/medical community so I wont bore you with stats, but, I think I am safe in saying this is a decent TV.There are a lot of folks that have went to a great deal of trouble to point out all the +/_'s to this TV and my thanks to all of them!My opinion is, if you can get it at a reasonable price, don't hesitate. It's almost perfect.You will appreciate the features and quality period. I just hope you don't sell the farm to get one. I wouldn't pay more than 1500.cdnOne feature I was disappointed in was that the stand cannot be made to swivel 360degs. I know I tried. Mine sits in between the kitchen and the living room on a separation wall, and I customized my old one to swivel to view it in both rooms. Too bad, that would have made it perfect!Here is my big point to add.. If you are looking for a smart TV don't be swayed by 3D - you will probably only use it 5% of the time if that. Be more willing to pony up the bucks for power in the processing dept. The faster the computer in the TV the better! Nothing worse than waiting for ever for things to load.  This TV is ok in that department but not great, but the price appeases me in that regard.All in all you can't go wrong with this TV it is solidly in the middle of performance and cost and pushing the edge of mid/high end with quality, and features.Hope you enjoy your's!

Reviews.Title: Compare and contrast!
Reviews.Author: Philip
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend just gone one of these last night, after we spent quite some time studying the pictures and features of the various TVs in the store.  One of the features that really impressed us about this TV was the contrast range (or dynamic range as you'll call it if you're a photo guy like me).  It's excellent.  What does that mean?  Well, do you like visually dark movies, like many Batman movies, or Tim Burton's Sleepy Hollow?  This TV will show you things you've never seen before in those movies.  Visually dark movies can be very moving, but at times I've felt they were hiding too much.  I want to re-watch all those movies now with this TV, because Sleepy Hollow was a whole new (and better) movie.  We're in a digital age, and one way that digital still can't compare to film is dynamic range.  Real film can show you more ranges of black or dark gray than most digital formats.  But this TV goes a long way toward changing that; the picture you see is a lot closer to what was recorded on the film.Others have commented on the size, clarity, software features, etc., so I'll just say that overall this seems like a really great TV so far.  But boy, is that contrast range impressive!Further comments; some people don't like the way the remote works.  I can kind of see why, but my GF says you just need to get used to it.  So there's that, for whatever it's worth.One quirk; a couple of times now, the picture has dimmed a bit.  We did some digging, and apparently this is because of a feature called microdimming.  It only happens under certain picture conditions, like a brightly dressed performer on a dark stage.  Now, I can't find that term in the manual.  The word "dimming" takes you to a discussion of the energy saving modes, and we've turned those off so we'll see if that does anything.  The other reviewer also says microdimming happens in standard mode, so we've changed it to natural mode.  We'll see what happens.  Honestly, if this microdimming is just part of the package, we'll live with it.  The TV is still fantastic.Update about 6 months in; we're still marveling at the picture quality.  The remote is a bit quirky, but it's not the end of the world.  This is an awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: Best TV until 4k prices are sane
Reviews.Author: Sam Hedge
Reviews.Content: I love the TV. I had to return the first copy I received because it had dead pixels. Wifi is very good and able to play many video formats over the network.

Reviews.Title: The picture is Awesome!
Reviews.Author: mellovette
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV to replace a Sony LCD projection that was about 7-8 years old. Still had a decent picture, but got tired of replacing the lamps, and we wanted to upgrade to a better picture. None of the Sonys we liked were available (2012 models); then, we saw this Samsung for a very good price and decided to buy. We are SO happy we did! The picture is amazing - it's like looking through a window to the characters on the other side (and yes, the window glass is perfectly clear!). We haven't tried the Smart TV applications yet, so I can't comment on how those work. But, if you want a great picture, consider htis one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV but trying too hard
Reviews.Author: Mac
Reviews.Content: Great TV, super sleek design and beautiful picture would warrant five stars. However the  annoying SMART system is too complex of an interface that makes regular stuff like changing channels a pain in the neck

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: sungwonseo
Reviews.Content: I can just say good job and love it so much. It is the best TV ever in my life.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: baw53
Reviews.Content: we love it.  it has been fun to watch sports from basketball to golf at the masters. we don't use the 3d but it still seems to show depth in the pictures

Reviews.Title: Perfect for our needs
Reviews.Author: Lee Sanders
Reviews.Content: This set fits exactly—and I mean, to the millimeter exactly—in our viewing space. Our room is big and bright, so during the day we adjust the setting to its brightest mode, and everything looks terrific (at night we tend to watch it in its "normal," darker setting). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: NYCfashionista
Reviews.Content: a lot of good things about this tv.  It's super easy to set up. WIFI connected easier than other samsung blu-ray products.  The thin bevel is amazing.  The tv wasn't much bigger than my old 58 inch, but the image size was because of the thin bevel.  Once you adjust the picture settings it looks amazing.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because it doesn't come out of box looking amazing.  You have to adjust the picture.  Everything has tendency to appear very bright and soap opera-esque even though it's a movie or tv show.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I Ever Owned
Reviews.Author: Michael Ulis "michaelg56"
Reviews.Content: This TV replaced a Toshiba DLP I had for many years.  The delivery crew unpacked it and made sure it turned on but left it on the floor because the Toshiba was still sitting on our big screen stand.  I was able to pick it up and place it on the stand myself no problem.  The WIFI setup worked perfectly and was pretty easy to navigate so I have complete access to Netflx and Amazon Prime programming.  The picture is great and the 3D worked fine with my one 3D Bluray movie Gravity.  My only complaint is that were no instructrions with the 3D glasses so it took 15 minutes to figure out how to trun them on.  Once on they worked perfectly.  After 2 months of daily use I can tell you that this is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Very nice picture
Reviews.Author: Steve Kempfer
Reviews.Content: Everything looks great after 1 month of ownership.  Set-up was easy too.I went from a 12 year rear projection unit to this new flat panel, the picture is definately better, but I guess my expectation where a little to high.  I am not disappointed, it is just not the dramatic improvement I was expecting.  I am happy with the unit, but not amazed.  Very good product.

Reviews.Title: Awsome picture quality
Reviews.Author: Richard Robinson "turtle"
Reviews.Content: I recently had a sony in which I had reacurring problems with.Come to find out there was a recall and sony would not fix it.They tried to sell me a new tv at a discount but in reality it was the same price I could of picked it up at best buy.Did some research on it and then that one was recalled because they were catching on fire.Done with sony tvs.But any way my parents had picked up a Samsung 7500 series which made it a no brainer to pick up a Samsung.Glad I did the 7100 series has done nothing but impress me the more I watch it.It is the next model down from the 7500 but difference is really not noticeable.A few features maybe.I have watched a few 3d movies and it seems as expected and in hd feels like you could pop your head inside the tv.Resident evil afterlife was a dumb movie till I watched it in 3d where things were actually coming out of the tv.Hd this tv is so clear its amazing.Any non hd channels its not going to shine.I cant really comment on the online or internet surfing.I have a built up pc for entertainment and gamming running threw my entertainment system for years.Sad thing now with smart tvs is there catching on and now there is a market for online entertainment so its not free any more.But any way as far as pc gamming for the pc geeks out there.All I can say is wow.Max settings 3d Tombe raider crysis ect.Turn on the 3d calibrate pc nVidia and you will see these games in a whole new light.I did give it a 4 star because its not perfect but nothing major.Sound is mediocre but then I have a pretty good surround set up but still would like to use tv for dialog and center channel.Sometimes hard to hear the dialog over the action.Another thing is 1700 dallar tv and it comes with cheezy 3d glasses.Need some that block out any glare from the sides.I want 3d goggles that wrap around your eyes blocking out every thing but the tv.Best thing about the purchase I think is I picked this tv up for 1175 at best buy but I do recommend getting the warranty.So that's another 250 for a 5 year Geek squad warranty.

Reviews.Title: Best Tv I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Rascov
Reviews.Content: Pros: Samsung makes great TV's that surpass every other manufacturer in their class. I have two Samsung's in my house and I can tell you the image is beautiful. This TV is an LED TV, but don't let that confuse you. LED is similar to LCD, LED basically means that the TV is back-lit better and in turn makes sure their are no dark spots on the screen. Now add in that this TV can directly connect to the internet and I'm sold. TV's of this class have never been cheaper.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a store to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to you.The next step you need to look at is what features come with the TV. Here are a few that come with this TV:This Samsung comes with Auto Volume which automatically adjusts the volume of the desired channel, lowering the sound output when the modulation signal is high or raising the sound output when the modulation signal is low. This reduces the difference in volume when changing channels. The Auto Volume feature can be set to Normal, Night or Off.This Samsung also has Smart Hub organizes your entertainment and content into 5 convenient panels: On TV, Movies and TV Shows, Social, Apps, and a panel for your Photos, Videos and Music.To add this Samsung has a Dual Core Processor that allow you to perform multiple tasks at the same time. It also enables fast web browsing while playing apps or TV programs that you've recently opened through the Recent History feature.The next thing is in box technology:With this Smart HDTV there is a full web browser with WiFi built-in apps made for TV. Some of the apps this TV features is Hulu Plus, YouTube, Netflix, Facebook, and Twitter. Browse the web while you watch movies and TV shows, and enjoy TV while you chat with friends and family online, all on one screen with this Samsung.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.Cons: Nothing

Reviews.Title: Actually Easy To Adjust If You Realize....
Reviews.Author: Neil Shapiro "Thoth"
Reviews.Content: I almost did not buy this TV after reading some of the 5-star reviews! I actually did not buy it from Amazon but from a local store because some of the 5-star reviews had me thinking it would be 50/50 if I could get it adjusted right and I didn't want to have to rebox it if I returned it. If you have been reading the reviews here and thinking, "OMG I will never be able to adjust this picture" then read on.At issue here are the complex advanced settings as well as a lot of the reviewer-recommended settings have the contrast at or near 100. To me, if you have to blow-out a control to ultimate max then that indicates two things to me. First would be a design error as you should never have to max out a setting. Second would be what do you do with inevitable degradation after a few years of the screen and no way to turn up that control further?I had the TV delivered and setup by the usual group of know-nothings and when they left I brought out my favorite adjust-a-new-TV tool the "Spears and Munsil High-Definition benchmark Blu-Ray Edition" Blu-Ray disc. This disc is replete with test patterns and walkthrough guidance in using each one. Some are not too applicable to LED screens but others that allow you to use such things as PLUGE patterns to set contrast and brightness are just indispensable. I got my Spears and Munsil from Amazon and I recommend for more info on what it is you check it out here.So, I turned on the TV. As the reviewers said it was set to Dynamic Mode. I felt that it was not way way off in settings but considerably so and needed some tweaking. But the most complete reviews as to settings all seemed to recommend Movie mode and a contrast at or near 100. Huh? I switched to Movie Mode and sure enough what a washed out picture. But I was not surprised. Look, when you go into a movie theater which is showing a film what is the first thing you notice even before the movie? That it is dark! Really, really, really dark with the light coming from the movie and a few red LEDs on the floor so you don't kill yourself on a step.Movie Mode recreates how the cinematographers wanted the film to be viewed as to color level, white balance, contrast, etc. But they never thought the lights would be turned on in the theater enough to maybe read a book, carry on a conversation with the wife or all the other things we typically do when we watch TV socially as opposed to watching a film in a theater. It was nighttime so I turned off all the lights in the room and even closed the blackout curtains in the skylights so no moon glow.The picture was no longer washed out but still could use tweaking. Turned the lights back on in the room to the ;level they usually are at when we watch TV. Broke out my Spars and Munsil test patterns and set to work. Well, not much work. In about a half an hour I had the thing adjusted in Dynamic Mode to where you would swear it was the best picture you have ever seen. I did NOT go into the advanced settings at all and I really recommend you stay away from those. That way lies madness.My Spears and Munsil tested settings? Keep in mind that you will have different room light and ambience and etc. but for what it is worth they wound up as Dynamic Mode, Backlight 20, Contrast 79, Brightness 55, Sharpness 58, Color 50, G48/R52. You might also want to choose your HDMI black level and some of the other settings that wind up basically personal preference. Oh, and when I turn off the lights to simulate a theater and go to Movie Mode, looks great too!So setting was as easy as pie with the right tool.But I also think that if you simply understand what contrast should look like you could do it by eye as well. Just remember -- in Movie Mode you want to have a dark, dark Movie room as opposed to real life.Overall the TV has been fantastic. I did buy the keyboard and have found that to be the most useful accessory. I have tyne camera but the movement recognition is mostly a gimmick IMHO and I don't use Skype so....Oh, one thing was driving me nuts. I have a Yamaha receiver (as Samsung does not make home theater receivers just sound bar/speaker combos) and like to switch all inputs through that. Well, the receiver would be on Cable TV through HDMI but then after about 20 seconds it would switch to ARC as the Samsung TV automatically sends the switch-to-ARC code which, I am guessing, the Samsung audio equipment needs, No way to turn off that without turning off all HDMI control and I wanted to have that for my Samsung Blu Ray. Anyway, if you have a receiver bothered by that, at the receiver end just turn off HDMI control. Then, after the TV sends the code you can turn it back on and all will be well. But you need to do that every session. Or, just leave it off and only turn it on when you want to do a Smart App or otherwise play internally-generated TV audio on your amp.I love this TV! And it need NOT be difficult to set up!

Reviews.Title: Problem with my set.
Reviews.Author: William Gross "BroadwayBill"
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have bought a Samsung TV for every room in the house and ordered all of them through Amazon.  I have had tremendous success with Samsung and Amazon's service has always been good to me.  I had done some research on this TV before I bought it and decided for the price point I would purchase one.  Sold by Paul's TV and fulfilled by Amazon $1649. Product came in the time described and the box was completely intact with no issues.  TV looked fine and set up nice.  After numerous adjustments to try to get the picture to not have bad shading and ghosting and overall haze I called Samsung customer service and my call was answered right away.  I explained the issue that I was having and the lady guided me through some processes that I had already tried.  She finally concluded that I need to have the set serviced.  If for some reason the service guy didn't find anything wrong with the TV then I would have to pay the service charge which according to the local dealer said would be a $100 bill. So instead of taking the chance of having to pay the service fee and then having a TV that I wasn't happy with I decided to send the set back and order a new set.  To be fair I had my father-in-laws older 8000 in it place in the 55 in size class and it was outstanding.  That set was a 2010 model but it was way better than the 7100 that I had ordered so I am sure my expectations were high in the first place.  I have seen this set hooked up at Best Buy and it was very good so I am thinking it was just this set.  Amazon took the set back without any questions and is refunding my account. I am now looking at the 8000 series and the Sharp Q+ UQ17U series.Bill

Reviews.Title: Sweet TV!!
Reviews.Author: Lina
Reviews.Content: We LOVE our TV!!!! The Smart TV is so awesome, we don't even need cable anymore, we just use Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc. We also like to link it to our iPad to watch YouTube videos (so much easier than using the app). You can browse the web, too! Took us a while to get used to the 240Hz motion, kind of had us dizzy as first, most people probably had 120Hz. We lvoe the slimness and the picture clarity. We tried the 3D, but never really got too into it, but it does come with 4 Samsung 3D glasses. We've always loved Samsung and love this TV. We got an awesome deal on it from Amazon and have yet to see it sold anywhere else even close to what we bought it for (during black Friday week).

Reviews.Title: Good TV, annoying Controller
Reviews.Author: HULLDUCK
Reviews.Content: As expected, the picture is great!  All in all, I'm satisfied with the TV.  I'm just going to list the 2 faults I have with it here.  First, the controller is annoying to use.  The touch feature is a gimmick and may sound cool on paper but it does not work and is a pain to use at times.  The only other issue I've had is with Diablo 3 for xbox 360; when I had the numbers show up on the game, I got a lot of pixelation between numbers.  I'm not even sure how this happened just by switching tvs, but it never happened on my old tv.  The pixelation actually caused some slow down on my game and even crashed it once or twice.  I had to play with the settings on my tv and xbox to get it working again.  It works fine now on gaming mode, but I still can't have the numbers come up in diablo 3.  Otherwise the tv works great.  It has great picture, the apps work great, and the sound is is decent (which is all you can ask for on tvs now-a-days).

Reviews.Title: Great TV but a quirk
Reviews.Author: J. Scott
Reviews.Content: I have now had this TV for about 2 months and it works great.  Picture is excellent.The only annoying feature is, when using the very advanced Samsung remote, whichI use to also control my AT&T; Uverse cable box, and you hit 'guide' it starts everytimeat channel 1 instead of starting at the channel you are watching.  Pretty annoyingconsidering the HD channels start at 1000 and you have to keep flipping through allthe channels from 1  to 999 to get there.  I contacted Samsung and they say this 'may'be in a future firmware update.  Other than that great TV.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Myke
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best TV I've bought ever. The resolution on this is amazing & I'm glad I went with this one

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV that delivers an amazing picture. Easy setup and a touch pad remote. No issues thus far! Built in wifi has range!

Reviews.Title: I love my Samsung!!!
Reviews.Author: Vladimir
Reviews.Content: I was my gift to my self for the holiday season! Amazing picture. Huge 55"screen. I mean if you want a good TV with a nice screen get it!!! I didn't have any problems with TV. Now I have friends over playing games and watching movies almost every day :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Big Dad
Reviews.Content: I saw Samsung Ultra in the store and it simply has outstanding image quality, but is more than I want to spend.  I purchased the series 7100 and found that it has great image quality,internet access, and at a good value. I am glad I purchased the sound bar with the wireless subwoofer and would recommend doing that. Purchasing off Amazon was a very good experience.  They have the right business model with customer service as a priority. I've not had a problem with Amazon so I haven't had to test their customer service. Everything is good.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: CelHenry "Cel"
Reviews.Content: Best TV ever!  Awesome picturekm andthe Samsung appsare easyto use.  It looks great In our conference room.  That is all.

Reviews.Title: Tv is great, remote is a nightmare!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "granth91"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV in September 2013.  The picture is nice and compares favorably to our other LED TVs.  The stand is made of plastic and is disappointingly unattractive.  The remote, however, is dysfunctional.  The remote utilizes a touch pad that is difficult to use.  Half of the time, we are unable to change the channel.  It is no wonder the salesman recommended we spend an additional $100 on a keyboard remote at the time we bought the tv!

Reviews.Title: Great picture/easy to setup
Reviews.Author: Vince Hartzell
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup, great features, intuitive remote, and great picture.  Would highly recommend this item to anyone for purchase.  Delivery went unhitched also - a first!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Poor Smarts
Reviews.Author: V. Barb
Reviews.Content: This for the UN65Ff7100.  This set has a wonderful picture and the sound is not bad for a thin TV.  I would rate the sound as good or better than our 55" Samsung it replaced.  For action/drama shows you may still prefer a attached sound system.  The 3d samples (in the apps) are nice but not a big "wow" factor and the picture is not as bright in 3D mode (just like in the theaters).I can't get the 3D to work when using my ATT Uverse box with Video On Demand which has several 3D movies.  I had high hopes for this.  Based upon what I've seen so far I'm not sure I would spend the money on a 3D DVD player.  The normal picture is so much better.  I hate the remote control.  I would rather have a full feature remote with buttons.  I am now using a Logitech Harmony remote which is a lot easer to use, particularly when also using the AT&T; Uverse and my Yamaha receiver.I finally got the set to recognize my NAS unit by changing the features in the Netgear NAS unit itself.  In Setup, Services, I now have NFS, CIFS,and HTTP marked.  I don't know which one was the magic fix but it now sees the NAS and overnight it indexed all the files and are now available for viewing.NOT IMPRESSEDI'm not impressed with all the smart features and apps.  The instructions are very poor regarding how to set them up, re-arrange and use them.  I'm spoiled after all these years using features on computers which are faster and more reliable.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is so crisp and clean it is ridiculous. I love this TV. It is sleek in design and has cool features like 3D and you can stream Netflix with it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Very Thin - Good Value
Reviews.Author: Bill Bertin
Reviews.Content: I bought this on the friday before TKGVG and the value was excellent. I was btw this and the panasonic but I have a bright room and decided against the ST60 (plasma). Do I think the picture quality is as good as the PANNY? NO. After a few months of use, I have a little buyers remorse b/c the light bleads from the corners at time and the plasma is probably just better - Thats the only reason I gave it 4 instead of 5. But i'm hard to please and I would still recommend either of them. The head of my household says she likes the thinner bezel and brighter led picture.. and that's important too! ALso - the tv is not that smart. The processor is super slow and the apps aren't impressive at all. I think they could have done allot better job with that. Cheers - wp.

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Alexander Casanova
Reviews.Content: I got this for the picture quality. Have not tried the 3D but I don't really care for it. This shows great color and the TV itself is incredibly thin!Having NetFlix and Amazon Prime apps as well as Pandora and other apps really make this a great TV especially for those who don't care for cable TV.The only negative is that the control is very heavy on gestures. It is small and elegant, however since there is a lack of buttons selecting options like "search" in an app requires you to hit an option button on the control and then selecting one of whatever Icon represent the action you want to take. Small negative.

Reviews.Title: Simply Stunning!
Reviews.Author: Arthur Theocles
Reviews.Content: I want to hit the highlights... The remote is functional and intuitive. The picture is crisp and unreal. The very small bezel creates a sense that the image is floating in space before your eyes, and the Smart features are easy to use. A++++++ is all I can say, I am so glad I spent a little more $$$ for this TV!

Reviews.Title: Its good
Reviews.Author: HRM
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good. The 3d active glasses are so good. I have given 4 stars because the response time is more while browsing the apps.

Reviews.Title: very good tv but a couple of kinks
Reviews.Author: Richard P. Collins
Reviews.Content: did not buy via Amazon but have had it a couple of months.  Picture is great -- 5 stars.  I found setup to be ok.  Very thin.am writing review primarily to list some areas that could be better--am not enamored with the remote.  can work with it but it often does undesired actions.--the most annoying aspect is that the screen has from time to time gone dark -- not completely dark but the brightness is only about a quarter of normal.  Very frustrating.  The do it yourself help takes you through a number of steps but none of them has ever worked.  Product support wasn't the best.  What seems to work is running software update but who designs a product that stops functioning properly over that?Have no basis to compare with similar tvs, but picture clarity is much, much better than previously owned ones -- even old tv shows are sharper than I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Luncsford
Reviews.Content: Picture is very clear, came with 3 D glasses, easy to hook up, love the apps, can even skype on it with the purchase of an additional camera.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Rebekah Hills "Beka"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful display, super thin, awesome functions / features, very user friendly. I am not a huge fan of the largely touch only remote however.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for Decently lit conditions
Reviews.Author: Alex cole
Reviews.Content: This Tv is a beautiful TV and has one of the most gorgeous physical designs I have ever seen on a flat-screen TV. The picture is equally stunning with a fluid picture comparable to the movement of water. The colors literally leap off the screen and after professional calibration they seem to be very accurate.Pros:ColorMotion rate, clarityphysical design..literally like 3/4 of an inch thick at it's thickest pointCons:Firstly let me explain why i gave this TV a 4 star rating... in a well lit room like with the blinds open or 1 to two laps on the picture is perfect..no issues what so ever. However if the TV is located in a pitch black room or very low lighted room then you will start to notice the typical crux of edge lit LED TVs... the flash lightening or clouding as it is sometimes refereed to. This means that you can see shadows, or flashlight patterns of light emanating from the corners of the TV pointing towards the center, this effect is usually only noticed in very dark movie scenes or pure black backgrounds. This flash lighting is literally un noticeable in a decently lit room for example your living room, however in a pitch black room this effect becomes more noticeable. This effect can be tamed using the setting of standard under the picture options/settings but is still noticeable in dark rooms.Other:The 3D on the TV is impressive, but not worth being the sole reason for purchasing the TV. The smart features of the TV are pretty impressive but not as fast/intuitive as say an Apple TV.Final Verdict:Picture Quality: 9/10 due to flash lightingPerformance: 9/10 due to somewhat sluggish smart features, (which are still the best smart features to be integrated in a TV)Design: 10/10 Beautiful minimalist design, razor slim, clean appearance, awesome remote controlI would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: all the apps are appear very clear, sharp, watching any app is like that movment happens in front of you.
Reviews.Author: Dinesh Chheda
Reviews.Content: Watching TV is very sharp, clear. Only in the remote did not find the mute button, that is more important to have it.

Reviews.Title: Everything you would expect from a Samsung.
Reviews.Author: Frank R. Stehlik
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV that looks as good off as it does when it's on. Very easy to set up. I shopped around for quite some time before deciding on this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of work
Reviews.Author: KHowe
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best tv I ever owned. The picture quality is incredible and the processing is fast. I have already recommended it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable picture!
Reviews.Author: Patty
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous picture.  Lots of bells and whistles including 3D. Loaded with apps just like your smartphone. Very happy with purchase.

Reviews.Title: TV is great
Reviews.Author: Deborah S.
Reviews.Content: Once TV was finally received, with the assistance of a friend, set-up was relatively easy. Just need to make sure there are at least 2 people and a screwdriver around to put together the stand.TV connects easily to internet and picture and sound quality are excellent.I have only had the TV a couple days, so can't tell about long-term; also this is my only experience with an LED or Smart TV so I have nothing for comparison.I still have to use 2 remotes for TV/cable use, but that is of minimal inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: This tv is everything we wanted. The picture is excellent. The speakers are good too. We love the thinness if this tv, it looks like a picture on the wall.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: kevin c
Reviews.Content: Love this TV and the smart TV. Now I can do all my internet stuff on my TV directly without needing to hook it up to my laptop. The visual display is stunning. Now I am the one hosting the superbowl party.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: steelerkk
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing and vibrant. If too vibrant, simply change the settings. I have not messed with the 3D portion yet, but I watch a lot of sports and there wasn't any ghosting at all. I went from a 63" plasma TV which I had for almost 7-Years, but I had to step up to the plate and get this guy. The 63" was really nice, but this TV is so much better! Well worth every penny! It was delivered via Amazon's preferred delivery company, Pilot and they were awesome. The TV came in a double wall box for extra protection and there were no signs that even the outside of the box was damaged or scuffed. If you are on the fence about this TV, I wouldn't hold back. You will be very happy.

Reviews.Title: Excelent TV.
Reviews.Author: carlos conversso
Reviews.Content: Excelent images. Easy to put it all together. One only but, remote control is not so intuitive as I expected. A little bit complicated.

Reviews.Title: The best Smart HD TV.
Reviews.Author: Seon Bae
Reviews.Content: I love this Samsung 55 LED smart TV. This is perfect what I was looking for. The resolution is really good and Samsung all share is really easy and comfortable to access my PC without cable. Only thing is when I'm using YouTube. Writing is uncomfortable to search something due to vertical letter style.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tv
Reviews.Author: Jacobo Zafrani
Reviews.Content: Very good product  The resolution is excellent.  The 3d is amazing and glorious at the same time.  You wil be happy

Reviews.Title: Samsung 55" LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: DawnC50
Reviews.Content: This  Samsung 55" Led Ultra Slim Smart 7100 series TV is a Christmas persent for my husband. It is replacing a Samsung 46" flatscreen TV which we have moved to the wall in our bedroom! We purchased it from Paul's TV thru Amazon after checking the 7100 Series at our local Best Buys. We got an excellent price at Paul'sTV, it was delivered in a week and delivery man helped us get it in the house and unpack it so we could check it before he left! We are very happy with this TV as we have bought several Samsung TV's and have always had great pics and with this Smart TV connected to our WIFI there is so much to see and do, we are still learning everything it can do, including 3D and 4 pairs of glasses. Beautiful picture and we have connected it to our surround sound system and Samsung Blu Ray player! Paul's TV have called us to make sure we were happy and have offered us a great deal on extended warrantyPaul's TV is a great place to do business with and we will keep them in mind in the future!

Reviews.Title: Carjud
Reviews.Author: Carjud
Reviews.Content: I love this TV in every way. This is the brightest and clearest viewing screen that you will ever view.  The smart features are so wonderful, down to the smart remote.If you wall mount this unit, you will be better served by ordering the VideoSecu Articulating Full Motion TV Wall Mount for 32"-65" LED LCD Plasma Mount.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier with it
Reviews.Author: Tanja Baum
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture, super thin, tons of options to choose from. Clear picture, and great sound even without sound system. Best choice ever!

Reviews.Title: awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Dave Morris
Reviews.Content: we have not had a new TV in 8 years and the improvement in quality has been amazing.the delivery guy who brought it by and set it up was very helpful as well

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Mark Gray
Reviews.Content: Love this TV the remote is one of the best that I have used that came with the product. Picture is great #D is Great my grandson was totally amazed

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN65F7100 review
Reviews.Author: Ciara
Reviews.Content: Outstanding picture! Once again Samsung has proved to be the top TV on the market and this model is no exception.

Reviews.Title: it works
Reviews.Author: MGA
Reviews.Content: It does everything I needed and more...sharp and crisp picture...setup and delivery was pain free...yes I recommended this product it works

Reviews.Title: Nelly
Reviews.Author: gary nelson
Reviews.Content: I'm old school and this TV is easy to set up and the picture is awesome. The remote makes it easy to get around all the options that this TV has.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture and Performance
Reviews.Author: dadpw
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace a five year old TV which had already began to fail. To be safe I also purchased a five year protection plan but of course I am hoping I will not have to use it.This television is incredible. The picture is clear and because of the 120Hz all of the fast moving screens (sports/racing) are smooth and without the jerky anomalies that you would otherwise experience. I connected this to my internet router and so am also able to stream any of the HUGE Amazon Prime movies that are available. I have already tried this feature and it works without any problems.I am still learning the functionality of the Samsung but I have to say that they have truly made the whole process pretty darned easy for the consumer.

Reviews.Title: This is a great TV!
Reviews.Author: Scott D
Reviews.Content: The picture is sharp and bright. It has enough bells and whistles (features) to keep me busy for awhile. The remote is simple to use and not too big (a few inches longer than a deck of cards). I tried the 3D, but did not much much luck. The glasses did pair up right away and function properly, but the 3D thing is not for me. I am becoming a huge fan of Samsung products, started with a phone this year, then 2 TV and now a chrome book. I must say I love this TV, we have never watched so much TV in our living room. The TV is hooked up to the internet at first I used the wireless connection to see what the performance was like and it was fine. Then I used a cat 5 cable and it was more responsive, but if you do not already have a jack close to the TV, no worries it worked fine with a good wireless signal. Also, this TV is not hooked up to a audio receiver, we are using the built in speakers and it sounds good. Obviously not as good as the TV in our theater room, but no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: Picture is Amazing, Smart Apps OK
Reviews.Author: Nate in NYC "Nate E."
Reviews.Content: It took me awhile to get my picture quality the way I liked it. I'm really not a fan of that Soap Opera look that many of the shows have on these newer LED TVs, but you after tinkering with the settings I was able to get a great picture. The sound is not as bad as some reviewers say, at least for me, but I will be purchasing speakers later simply because that's what they're for! It's super light, easy to mount or put together and the colors are ridiculous. You can see so clearly it's scary sometimes!The SMART Apps are okay.
