Some work slower than others, and I already had Apple TV with my previous TV so I may go back to using it as Apple TV seems to always work. The voice activated commands are cool, but I rarely use them. Other than that, this TV is amazing, and on Black Friday I got it for nearly 50% off so cannot complain about that!

Reviews.Title: perfect images
Reviews.Author: Gaylon Bass
Reviews.Content: This TV has a perfect picture image. Its great for outdoor scenery & sports. Hunting, snow skiing, fishing you feel you're right there.

Reviews.Title: so good
Reviews.Author: jong bum lee
Reviews.Content: Samsung TV, so good. Picture quality is clear and beautiful. Too good to purchase an affordable price. 3D mode is not too fantastic. Realism is the best.

Reviews.Title: One heck of a fantastic TV
Reviews.Author: Gatlinburg Jackson
Reviews.Content: I saw one of these TVs in action at my daughter's home and my wife and I fell in love with it right away. We have never seen such clarity and ease of use in a TV. We especially love the fact that even if a program/movie is not in 3D you can have the TV convert it to a great replication of 3D. I do recommend that when you purchase one that you go online or to Samsung tech support for help setting up the screen settings which are many but help to make this TV the best I have ever seen! Period!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 7100 great quality for the money
Reviews.Author: Keith H. Wooten
Reviews.Content: Great picture but back access panel to tv buzzes when low bass tones are coming from speakers had to wedge a piece of rubber under panel to stop buzzing

Reviews.Title: The Best TV I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Darrel
Reviews.Content: Of coarse this is only the 3rd TV I have ever owned and only the 2nd HDTV. I use this TV primarily for gaming/blueray and havent seen any problems so far, blurays look awesome, havent tested out the 3D features yet but seemed to work pretty well when I saw this TV at bestbuy. One of the reasons I chose this model vs the model higher is that it didnt seem to have that annoying white bled through that i saw in the higher model(7500, halo effect-and that may be only how they had it configured at BB as this TV seems to have a lot of different viewing modes). For gaming I have both a PS4 and a PS3, The PS4 looks amazing in Killzone shadowfalls I spend a lot of time just looking at the enviroments as some of them are very impressive, I havent seen any screen tearing or ghosting yet for either system (though i am no A/V guru) The Tv's speakers are suprisingly loud for such a thin TV(I would still recommend to buying a sound system as you are not getting any bass or... okay really buy a sound system) and yes I am shopping for a sound system, looks like I might get the klipsch SB3(its a sound bar with a subwoofer-great for small apartments?)The remote is a little strange as it does not have channel numbers you instead can draw out a number on the touch pad or (I havent tried it yet) you can use voice commands as well. The trackpad is used to navigate the smart features such as the web,apps,etc(I do wish they had a a thumbstick like a game controller as well as the trackpad as you are constantly having to repostion your finger back onto the trackpad as it is very small)Final thoughts- I did alot*2 of research before I bought this TV, and this TV had the best bang for the buck(the higher model TV's primary advantages seem to have equal disadvantages ie better blacks-more halos, and even when i didnt see the halos the diffrence was small enough that I dont mind when the TV is by itself with no better tv right next to it to compare( well except for the 4K tvs, and why didnt I go for a 4K you ask? smallest 4K tv so far 55" and I live in a small apartment+ there does not seem to be any content yet).Again I am not a A/V guru, but I do recommend this TV so far for its great picture,  its awesome thin bezel, its ability to display games with no issues(so far), just a great overall TV(-the sound buts thats common with all thin tvs).

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Alberto Gines
Reviews.Content: Expensive yes, worth it yes.The quality of the picture is really good. The apps are good and they run smoothly. Nothing to complain about. The screen size is perfect for someone that likes movies.

Reviews.Title: Quality you can expect from a Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Jose Puente
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv after a bad experience with a LG 3D tv. Picture quality on the F7100 is amazing, however, sometimes the quality of the signal (directv) is not as perfect so you will see defects on some programs. Bluray movies are the best. I'm also really happy with the sound. Definitely a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase for Christmas
Reviews.Author: Santiago Lebron
Reviews.Content: Have been enjoying watching TV. The only thing that I am having difficulty with is trying to find the right settings for setting up the picture options.  I read several different reviews on this product before purchasing so I was aware of difficulty of using before receiving.  Besides that I would recommend this product for anyone looking for a new TV

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv
Reviews.Author: phi676
Reviews.Content: The best tv for the price. I absolutely love it. The picture quality is great and the technology is superb.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, with a couple of exceptions...
Reviews.Author: Gomer
Reviews.Content: Other than a relatively shoddy base, the TV meets all my expectations and more. When I screwed in the first base, the plastic was stripped, so I called Samsung and another was shipped to me for free. The second one worked fine, though it seems the TV's just a tad tilted. (Maybe it's my floor?)Also, on two separate occasions, the TV did something that I had not asked it to do via the remote. Once it turned off by itself. And once the channel changed without my asking it to via the remote.Otherwise, the TV's delivered a beautiful picture, except in darker scenes, where there's a washed-out lack of detail. Watching "The Master" the other night, for example, there were dark scenes where I could barely tell that the actors had eyes. Maybe that had something to do with P.T. Anderson's cinematography, but I've noticed this tendency in other programs/movies.Overall, though, I and my visiting friends couldn't be happier. Oh well, another reason not to get up from the couch and attempt to get a life. I blame Samsung  and modern technology for my ennui.

Reviews.Title: Amazing...
Reviews.Author: jakas333
Reviews.Content: Amazing, 3D images are excellent.Integration with Samsung sound bar and blue ray player effortless. Overall picture quality is very good. Voice recognition  works as desired. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Love my new tv
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Martinez
Reviews.Content: Love my new tv, the resolution is great and the sound is also great, the only thing would be that i wish i could use google play

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV
Reviews.Author: Ellen Stein
Reviews.Content: We were looking for this exact size for a specific space and the only place we found it was on Amazon. We are very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Lynner
Reviews.Content: Beautiful TV and so easy to use the setup features, in fact it was easier than any TV we had ever purchased... so glad I chose this one! love it!

Reviews.Title: awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: jeff lopez
Reviews.Content: bought tv from best buy so far i like it just had to tweak some of the settings but its nice, i mean even out of the box its nice but once you mess with the settings and put it how you like it its awesome.

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous TV
Reviews.Author: Hemalatha Marada
Reviews.Content: Very slim and absolutely beautiful TV with great features.Light weight and was easy to mount on the wall.Shipping was prompt.No cons nor complains so far.

Reviews.Title: Good value for $1600.
Reviews.Author: Joshua Ready
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV only issue is some flashlighting from the edges which I read is a common Issue with edge lit tvs. Still worth it if you get it on sale like I did.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Ali Saifleh
Reviews.Content: I Love his TV. Its picture is very good and cant get enough of it. I loved the free delivery that included installation inspection before they left... Highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: BIG--CLEAR.  PICTURE
Reviews.Author: Judith C. Ameduri
Reviews.Content: Great tv!  I can't say enough about this tv.  Also,  the delivery and set up feature was such a blessing to me as I am older and it is difficult to unbox and set up a large tv by myself.  The SMART tv menu  was easy to set up and I use it with Netflix and Amazon Prime features.  There does seem to be a "flow" problem with the SMART tv at times.  I guess all the data flow gets bogged down at times.  I love this tv.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: ByG
Reviews.Content: I have only had for a few weeks but picture is great. I am so far not taking advantage of its capabilities and am really just using it as a monitor attached to an Onkyo receiver.The delivery person took it out of the box, plugged it in and left. I'm not sure what I should have expected. I attached it to a wall mount and hooked it to the receiver without difficulty but a smaller person would have needed help.

Reviews.Title: BEAUTIFUL TV !!
Reviews.Author: Melinda S.
Reviews.Content: I would fully recommend this 65" Samsung Ultra Slim Smart LED HDTV.  This tv not only looks fantastic but the picture is gorgeous. I am still learning how to use some of the features on this tv.  I also bought a Samsung sound bar to enhance the volume which by the way sounds just as good as Klipsch or Bose without spending all the extra money. I was very skeptical about ordering a tv through Amazon. Best thing I could have done, was delivered on time, in one piece and even set up in my home. If you are looking for a tv, this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent sharp picture
Reviews.Author: Michael Abbott "Michael Abbott"
Reviews.Content: This TV is truly a computer and requires a little bit of learning when it comes to the remote. Make sure to follow the instructions when adding the HDMI cable for your external devices before you hang this TV to a wall. Especially the connection to the cable box has to go in the right spot. Everything is explained on the "Fast set-up sheet". If you messed it up and the TV is not working properly, don't work hard and take it of the wall (like I did). Just disconnect the HDMI cables from the external devices and re-arrange them. This will be much easier.I like the picture and the sound.

Reviews.Title: Love my Jumbo TV.
Reviews.Author: No where else but TEXAS! "Grandbabies Love Mi...
Reviews.Content: This TV is GREAT!  Clear picture and I love the voice interaction and remote touch pad.  This is the 240 Hz so... i can certainly see the difference between the 120 and 240 Hz.  Would highly recommend this television.

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: Miguelangel Faria
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV. A little dumb on the voice commands, especially scheduling. I haven't played much with color, saturation and other settings but Blu-ray movies look awesome in the 'Natural' setting. Audio could probably better but there is no way it could be given how thin it is. Nice apps, a little slow on processing, but hey I never had a Smart TV!

Reviews.Title: Sing a song for Samsung--Great TV!
Reviews.Author: P. Young
Reviews.Content: My Samsung 60" LED has an amazingly clear, sharp picture. The internal wifi works great, so I can stream Amazon Prime movies and Netflix easily. Amazon's delivery and setup made the whole process very easy. Incredible value, since I was able to buy the TV when it cost just under $1,600. Price has gone back up to around $1,900 after Black Friday Week/Cyber Monday period.One caution: the sound from the TV alone is okay, but only just. Since a TV this large is likely to go in a decent size room, you'll definitely want to hook it up to an external sound system. I have mine hooked up to a Bose surround sound system. I feel like I'm in my own personal movie theater.

Reviews.Title: Great 3D TV
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Molnar "Dude"
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "WOW".  I bought this over the 6300 model mainly for the better 240hz refresh over the 120hz.  The 3d that comes with this model was just a bonus.  However it's a huge bonus.  I watched a few DVD's made for 3d and it was incredible.  Even the conversion from 2d to 3d isn't too bad on most programs.  The remote that comes with it is one of those remotes you can talk into for different functions.  I have used it some with limited success but it does work as expected when the user (me) gets it right, just takes some playing.Even though this is a product review, have to give Amazon 5 stars for free Prime shipping and getting it here on time.  Speaking of shipping, Samsung did a great job with their packaging.  Not a scratch on anything and the way it's packaged you could pretty much drop it and have it work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the money,  Everything is awseome
Reviews.Author: Maher Yassine
Reviews.Content: Love  this TV, was  had to setup the smarthub  initially,but great tv. I highly recommended.  60" is the right size.

Reviews.Title: 75" SAMSUNG ROCKS IN BRIGHT ROOM
Reviews.Author: WOW!
Reviews.Content: Great smart TV IN BRIGHT room . Easy setup internet ready with apps. Glad I made this choice instead of a larger TV (80") by another manufacture. A lot lighter also. Manual does not give all the answers it's loaded on the TV. Even the standard DVDs look great. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture on HD Channels
Reviews.Author: technicalman
Reviews.Content: very good TV great picture. Controls are very good and the TV is incredibly thin. Mounts very close to the wall so the wires do not show.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: D. Hoon
Reviews.Content: We are so happy with this TV.  The picture is fantastic.  Love how there is barely any border to it.  The stand is very contemporary.  Really pleased with all the functions available and with the quality of the product.

Reviews.Title: SO FAR SO GOOD
Reviews.Author: JHK
Reviews.Content: This thing is great so far, excellent picture in both 2D and 3D although I have only use the 3D to watch Dredd(2013) I do not own a lot of 3D films. Gaming is excellent I use this for PC games like Skyrim, Bioshock Infinite, Far Cry3  on ultra looks great & PS3 GTA5, Uncharted series all play great zero motion problems. Anyway great picture perfect for any type viewing habit whether basic cable, VOD,  blue ray or gaming.There are 4 HDMI connections inputs I do not think most people will be disappointed with this HDTV specs,or features. If I have any problems I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Best picture I have seen BUT poor customer service
Reviews.Author: Robert Miller
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 60" LED TV for about 3 months. I researched quite a bit and then went out and looked at the top models from my research. The Samsung 7100 was in a league of it's own. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a large TV. In my opinion it has a better picture than any plasma I looked at. Here is the thing though, while I love the TV and Amazon I REALLY hate Samsung's customer service. I would rate it very poor. It seems to me that they have very little product knowledge and have no ambition to go the extra mile to make their customers happy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: andy pavlichko
Reviews.Content: Has all the feature I wanted. Excellent picture quality. Easy setup. Cant go wrong with Samsung. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Good tv
Reviews.Author: Aurelien MANGANO
Reviews.Content: Very good Quality Tv. Only issue is the remote contrôl. You CAN navigate  Internet easily with USB keyboard and mouse.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Mcmaster "Me2Rowdy"
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience.  I ordered it and it was delivered to my house, unpacked for me.  Set up and everything turned to show it was in good order.  The picture is awesome and it is fairly easy to navigate.  With wifi built in, it was a breeze to set up what we needed.

Reviews.Title: Buy It!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Great TV!  No frame so I was able to maximize the viewing picture with putting the TV inside a cabinet.  Great picture, sound, etc....HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: TV lives up to the rave reviews!
Reviews.Author: J.Lindsey
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome – it’s thin, the picture is amazingly sharp and it looks great hanging on the wall when not in use. I found the remote easy to use and very intuitive. At first figuring out all the functions of the tv are a bit overwhelming but once you get use to the menus, it’s easy! The price dropped $100 after I bought it and Amazon issued me refund! Thanks Amazon! Great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Fabulous
Reviews.Author: Michael Morse "mystery fan"
Reviews.Content: Fabulous picture and technology.  Very happy with my purchase and Amazon Prime.  Definitely recommend this to anyone wanting a new TV

Reviews.Title: This TV lives up to the great ratings!
Reviews.Author: Michael Rohr
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is absolutely clear and enjoyable.  The functionality is easy to learn and easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased.
Reviews.Author: Duncan P. Dohmen
Reviews.Content: Unable to compare it with others in a side by side comparison.  Watching it is a pleasure.  Sound seems comparable to others but who doesn't expect to have a sound system of comparable value connected eventually?  The 3D is actually quite good under the right circumstances.  Some of the 3D specials have an overblown quality just for effect, like dinosaurs sticking their heads out of the TV to bite you.  Movies that have not been made for 3D effects specifically, are much better; the 3D adds to the sense of ''being there''.The packaging was quite effective, as it turns out.  Somewhere in shipping, one end of the box took a hit but no damage to the TV.  Packaging engineering is quite a field of study.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality but not so great sound quality
Reviews.Author: Ritika V. Dhamija "surfsavvy"
Reviews.Content: Picture is very sharp and I am pleasantly amazed by the picture quality however audio quality is poor.  Raising the volume doesn't help much.

Reviews.Title: A Slim, stylish, and stunning HDTV set
Reviews.Author: Daniel Paul D'Aniello
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my parents, had it shipped to their house, and set it up for them. Picture quality is great, refresh rate makes HD look movie-like, and the smart Internet linked features are awesome. They love it and I love watching TV when I visit. Another great Samsung product.

Reviews.Title: Super TV
Reviews.Author: H. Bash
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to spend this much on a television, but the device is works great and is nicely made.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: great but
Reviews.Author: Waldo
Reviews.Content: this tv comes with a nearly perfect picture quality, but as you will see on some bluray movies or full hd tv signals, sometimes picture looks just weird, like a fantasy movie with not so realistic special effects. people faces are sometimes just not real, but not all the time... maybe its just me maybe I'm not used to it....other than that it is simple to plug and watch, but some features go to far, like automatic change on receiver to tv/sat source which is not a correct one, so i have to manually change it back to hmdi 1, have no idea how to turn that feature off, and if some source didn't have signal at the time you change it to , the info about it pops out into your screen and makes you turn it off again, and again.

Reviews.Title: UN60F7100 240Hz, 3D
Reviews.Author: FirePolice1
Reviews.Content: The 60 inch  UN60F7100AF, 240 Hz, 3D was delivered 2 weeks ago. So far we are very happy with this TV. Beautiful  picture. Smart features and 3D working well. The set up was easy. I would recommend this TV anytime.... and the prize was right as well, didn't see it cheaper anywhere else. Will update if any problems arise.

Reviews.Title: Did we really need a new TV?
Reviews.Author: KZ "humus5"
Reviews.Content: We purchased a new TV on an impulse to replace a 40 inch 2 year old Samsung.  The size and thin profile, picture quality and Smart TV features are an amazing upgrade.  I cannot comment on 3D features.  The only disappointment is my inability to program the remote to control the other components.  Definitely a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with Samsung's top end items!!!
Reviews.Author: Speedster6185
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  Easy installation right out of the box.  The first time you turn it on, it goes through a very thorough setup process that is very user friendly.  I was impressed that by going through this initial setup process (only) the TV & remote automatically controls my home theater system and satellite tv set top box. In the old days you used to have to go through complicated manuals to look up each specific manufacturer's code to program into the new device to run everything.  The picture on this TV is INCREDIBLE... it replaced a 6 year old 42" 720 HD LCD and what a difference.I like all the aps, the full web browser right on the TV, the ability to stream Amazon music & movies right from your Amazon account / cloud.  Great features.  Very pleased with this purchase.  Highly recommend this tv.The only thing I don't like about this TV and maybe its just because I'm not used to it yet (hence why I didn't take a star away) is the menu's are a bit difficult.  Everything is grouped together to try and make it easier to use for EVERYONE, however for those that know what exact specific setting we wish to change this makes it complicated.  Also, the little "mouse pad" on the remote control is a pain in the ass.  I'll be ordering the Samsung blue tooth keyboard that is listed as an accessory for this tv... it operates just like a mouse pad / keyboard of a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great buy-shipping took longer than expected
Reviews.Author: Connie Lynne Picard "CP"
Reviews.Content: This tv was well worth the wait. I had to wait longer than expected due to the shipping company's availability. Other than that, I am very pleased with the tv. The quality, sound, picture is excellent!

Reviews.Title: Hardware Gets an 'A'.  Software Gets an 'F'
Reviews.Author: bernerman
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  Hands down it is the finest piece of audiovisual hardware I've ever owned.  The images are fantastic and fairly leap off the screen at you.  It integrated seamlessly with my Verizon FiOS TV and the universal remote did not need so much as a single command programmed although I confess that some of the commands are not exactly intuitive.  I'm sure they will become so over time.  This product would get five stars if it wasn't for the software.I am reasonably techno-literate but by the end of the weekend I spent trying to set up the absolutely AWFUL Samsung allshare software I was ready to give up.  I have a simple network with a NAS box which stores most of my digital content.  I connected the TV to the network without a hitch and it recognized everything on the network without a problem (it even correctly identified the other STBs in the house and my Sonos system) but when I attempted to navigate to the content all I got was a "no content available on this device" message.  No "you must install allshare software to be able to view content on your TV" or any other helpful message.  There was no CD in the box and no instructions anywhere in the documents supplied with the TV (yes I checked and yes I am sure)  -it was only when I went online and looked at the 500+ page manual did I figure out that I needed to install the allshare software to be able to stream content.Fair enough I suppose but wouldn't you THEN think that the software would be available for download from Samsung's site?  Nope.  I navigated to the model-specific webpage and chose 'downloads'  -nothing.  I searched the site.  Nothing.  I found a few helpful posts from others in my situation but the links they posted to the download sites were dead.  I finally managed to download a copy of the current version of allshare from a third party mirror site and that's where the fun began.The allshare product SIMPLY DOES NOT WORK.  It doesn't work.  Ca ne marche pas.  No trabajar.  First off it doesn't completely install;  the installshield wizard hangs and if you terminate the process it will start up normally.  Second the UI looks as if it was written by prisoners of war and is utterly unintuitive;  there are no real 'help' screens to speak of and everything is written in insider buzzwords so figuring out how to configure the software is a challenge.  But all that aside, the product simply fails to recognize content and stream it to your TV.  I spent a very frustrating evening trying to get it to work and ultimately had to give up and download a copy of Serviio which worked right away in the first install.I know Samsung fancy themselves as giving Apple a real run for its money.  Maybe that's true on the hardware side but the software is dreadful.  By all means buy this TV but DO NOT EVEN WASTE YOUR TIME WITH THE ALLSHARE 'SOFTWARE PRODUCT'!

Reviews.Title: Great picture but one warning...
Reviews.Author: D. Valentine
Reviews.Content: This TV looks gorgeous mounted on the wall. The picture is super sharp and crisp and the profile is very thin. One WARNING: TVs with high refresh rates of 120hz and 240hz will be default make movies look like horrible i my opinion. You can search the internet and this is a known issue. What happens is that the high rates all but eliminate motion blur: great for sports, but enough to make even a blue-ray copy of the Avengers look like they are wearing cheap costumes form the 60s and make all the CGI effects look very fake as you can see the outline of the green screens. Other on the web have described this as the "soap opera" look.  Now LUCKILY, Samsung lets you turn the 240hz rate off deep in the TV menu. I did this and left it as default and turn it on during sporting events only. Before I found that function i was contemplating returning the set because what is the point of paying all this money to have your movies look like fake soap operas? :)

Reviews.Title: The Samsung UN65F7100 is everything and more than expected
Reviews.Author: mark shirey
Reviews.Content: The new browser is the best I have seen so far. The TV picture is excellant and has plenty of "Pop".  Next step ius to get it calibrated once it has been used for a month. I also like the remote but you have to use it before you can get aquanted enough to get the intent of the designer.  Yes the TV is expensive but I plant on having this tv for 10 years. I could have purchased the flagship (8000 series) for the same price but 5 inches smaller but glad I didn't. The 65 inch is perfect for 12ft away and the 8000 series only has the camera other than a quad CPU and this CPU is plenty fast!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!
Reviews.Author: Jeff O
Reviews.Content: I purchased a large and expensive Samsung LED TV from Amazon. Amazon was great. Fast and easy delivery. Unfortunately after 10 months, the TV stopped functioning at all. It made a clicking sound when you pressed the power button, but no image or sound. Fortunately, it was still under warranty. I contacted Samsung. They sent out a local repairman who fixed the TV. He mentioned it would have cost $1000 for the repair (replacing 2 circuit boards) if I was paying for it. It took him <3 minutes to switch the boards. The TV worked again. Now 2 years later - same problem. I called Samsung. They very politely told me that I was screwed. They would not fix the TV, provide parts or even a provide discount on the repair or parts despite the fact that it was the same problem the TV experienced 2 years earlier. Beware - if you do not want a very expensive paperweight after 3 years’ time, look at another manufacturer for your next TV.

Reviews.Title: the video quality is great but that's the only positive thing I can say about it
Reviews.Author: Joel Fisher
Reviews.Content: I have owned this tv for about a month or so now and I while I am often very pleased with Samsung products, I have to admit that I am have not been fully pleased with this tv.Immediately out of the box I noticed that it did not come with the 3d glasses that were advertised. And then the real problems started. After getting it all set up with screws that were not properly sized I noticed that the TV responds incredibly slowly when trying to access the smart features. After I press the central button to begin accessing the smart features I haven't seen the program open in less than 2 full minutes yet.The other major problems I've been having are that the keyboard doesn't work at all, and when calling Samsung they told me I was given the wrong model keyboard, but did nothing about it. And finally the biggest problem I have is that I have to re-enter my wifi network and password every single time I turn the TV on.I sent a message to the seller who then offered to replace the keyboard, but when I tried to accept that offer I never heard from them again. And I called Samsung support who told me all of my problems were thanks to my wireless router.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, not perfect.
Reviews.Author: DP21
Reviews.Content: Pros-1- Movies and shows look stunning on normal and 3D television.2- Slim and modern look.3- Has access to a lot of apps.4- It recognizes just about any type of picture and video files through a USB.Cons-1- The 3D glasses often disconnect.2- The Wi-Fi disconnects from time to time.3- The user interface should be more customizable.4- The control remote takes some getting used to.I purchased the Samsung F7100 TV on a Black Friday sale last year. Ever since the delivery arrived it has monopolized my viewing time. I barely use my other “dumb” TVs anymore. Between the amazing and pleasurable viewing experience and the convenience of a vast array of apps directly available from the TV I see no need for my other TVs. My experience with the TV has been very positive but it has come with a few minor stumbles along the way. I intend to go a little deeper into both the pros and cons and hope this review helps you decide whether this model is right for you.Pros (continuation)1- When I went looking for a new TV for my living room I was looking for a high end TV that would not break the bank. I was looking for something close to theater experience when it came to 3D movies. I am a huge fan of 3D movies and all I can say is that this TV does not disappoint. The movies look pretty amazing. I dare to say they look just as good as the theater. With that said, most of the television I do watch is normal regular TV. I watch a lot of Netflix and YouTube on the TV and for the most part all of the videos look fantastic. Some of the videos on YouTube look grainy but that is because of the native resolution of the video itself, it has nothing to do with the TV. I am not an expert and I don’t pretend to be. All I know is that the picture quality is very, very good and the TV looks noticeable better than the other LCD TVs I have in my house.2- One of the things that make this TV so appealing is its slim profile. The TV is a real looker. Everyone that has been to my house instantly notices it. It is honestly hard not to. You have a TV that is 55” big and is about an inch thick. The bezels are extremely small too. When you are watching it you are pretty much looking all screen. My other TV by comparison has a 52” inch screen and is 7” inches longer due to the wide bezels. It honestly looks like a dinosaur in comparison. There is not much more to say here, Samsung nailed it in the aesthetic department. If you are still not convinced go to your local electronic store and take a look at it for yourself. You will be blown away.3- Another aspect of the TV that I really like is having access to all of my favorite apps without having to hook up a computer or a set up box. I like having access to all of it in a single controller. No more having to deal with a keyboard or mouse to have access to Netflix or YouTube directly from your TV. All of the big apps are available for free on the play store and most of them work without any problems. I have seen Netflix, YouTube, Pandora, Hulu, Amazon, Spotify and many other ones. The only one I wish was available was the Google Music App. I believe that one is only available on LG TVs. It is pretty simple to navigate the apps with the remote controller. The only exception is when I am trying to locate a specific video on YouTube. It is annoying and time consuming to search letter by letter on the remote control. Fortunately, you can use your smartphone or tablet that has the YouTube app to “cast” the video on the TV. It works just like with the Google Chromecast. It is very easy to use and my phone connects flawlessly with the TV.4- I have a lot of old DVDs that I have ripped and have digital copies of them on my computer hard drive. I have saved many of them on a USB and have tested them on the TV. It has recognized every single type of file I have thrown at it. I love being able to see all my pictures and videos any time without the need of a DVD player. It is a very convenient feature and one I was unaware of when I purchased the TV.Cons (continuation)1- The biggest issue I had by far with this TV has been the 3D glasses. The TV come with a set of 4 glasses. The model number of the glasses is SSG-5100GB. They are total garbage. They sometimes take a good minute to detect that the TV is playing a 3D movies. But that would not be that much of an issue if they would stay connected. You start watching a movie and if you move your head too often the glasses disconnect themselves. EXTREMELY irritating when you are trying to watch a fast pace movie and you get a blurred screen in the middle of it because you decided to look down for a second. Most of the time that they disconnect you have to go ahead turn them back on and pray that they reconnect quickly. My friend bought the 65” inch model of this exact same TV and he got a different model of 3D glasses that are much, much better. They connect themselves instantly and they stay connected at all times. I have considered buying a different model to replace the factory ones. I don’t know if maybe Samsung has replaced the factory models. Just do your research on what model of 3D glasses the TV comes with. If it is this one then be prepare to deal with this headache.2- In a few occasions while watching Netflix I have had the TV suddenly lose internet connection. When it has happened I have quickly resolved the issue by unplugging and reconnecting my router. It does not happen often but it has happened on more than one occasion and I have not been able to find another solution. I have over 10 devices connected to the same router and the only one that has this problem is this TV. Maybe it is some sort of compatibility problem but it is not bad enough for me to consider buying another router. It is just a mild annoyance that happens about once a month or so. Not that big of a deal but something you need to keep in mind.3- Before purchasing this TV in particular I did some research regarding its “smart” features. I saw a lot of complaints about the user interface. Unfortunately, a lot of those complaints are correct. The user interface could really use some improvements. What I specifically dislike is that it feels inflexible. There is no area to group the different applications or even to rearrange the order. The layout has five home screens similar to what you find on your phone or tablet. But you cannot rearrange the order of the home screens or even the default home screens. I do not understand why TV manufacturers have decided to remain so inflexible in these aspects. It would have been nice if they would have at least included some way to at least bookmark your preferred apps. It is really a shame. Maybe in a couple more generations they will improve this.4- My final issue with the TV is its remote control. The remote is not terrible by any means but it does take a bit to get used to it. The only thing I don’t like is that it does not have physical buttons to change the channels. Instead you have to press the “more” button on the remote that will give you a virtual remote on the screen that will let you change to a specific channel. I had another Samsung remote control that I use it to change the channels when I decided to do so.In conclusion, would I recommend this TV to someone? I would. The main function of a TV is to obviously watch television and in this respect the TV is simply outstanding. The screen is beautiful and so is the aesthetic design of the TV. Just keep in mind that just like every other product in the market it has its flaws. In my case the 3D glasses have been a pain in the behind at times but not enough to question my decision to buy the TV. After all, I only watch 3D maybe 5% of my total time. The minor issues I had with the Wi-Fi have been few and far in between and it is probably going to vary depending on your internet connection and the equipment you have installed. If you took this long to read this review then I would like to thank you for doing so and I hope it has helped you on your search for a new TV. Also if you have any specific question please don’t hesitate to ask it on the comment section and I will try to answer it to the best of my abilities. Good luck on your search.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF WARRANTY DENIAL ISSUES
Reviews.Author: Ozzie Alvarez "Ozmeister"
Reviews.Content: Pray that you don't have any problems with it. Samsung is not an honorable company when it comes to standing by their warranty.  Sure, the picture is great until the vertical colored lines show up.  Then they will really try to screw you and nopt service or replace the TV. F&*!@#$

Reviews.Title: Awesome pciture!
Reviews.Author: Stevie G
Reviews.Content: I shopped around for a 60 to 70" TV comparing features and picture quality of different brands and this TV definitely has the edge in terms of picture quality as compared to comparable brands.  I also relied heavily on other customer reviews of different brands.  This TV is fairly new on the market as compared to others and the price point is on the high side, but you definitely get what you pay for.  The picture quality is unbelievable.  The 240Hz makes a big difference.  I have some recently purchased HD TV's in my house, all with 1080i picture quality and 120Hz.  When I first got them I thought the quality was great, but now after getting the Samsung 7100 there is no comparison.  The picture quality on this TV blows them away.  This TV is marketed as a "Smart" TV, loaded with streaming features and tons of Apps.  It reminds me of my smartphone, where individual apps periodically have updates that need to be downloaded and installed.  The only reason why I gave it 4 out of 5 stars is because some of the apps have some minor bugs in them.  I'm aware that this is probably the responsibility of the vendor that is creating the app, but it does impact the experience of owning the TV.  I believe some of the issues I initially experienced have been resolved by app updates and hope over time all will be perfect...

Reviews.Title: I am so pleased
Reviews.Author: Kathleen R. McKee
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture is outstanding.  The styling is sleek and does not distract. The set was delivered as promised, set up and the big box removed from my living room.  I would recommend this set to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy Samsung - they don't last
Reviews.Author: JAM
Reviews.Content: In summary - don't buy Samsung led TVs unless you want to pay hundreds of dollars in repairs.At first my TV picture would go blank intermittently and this was right after I bought my TV. Samsung support (which btw is horrible) said that this was normal and maybe fixed in the future.  Ok  I said I'd live with it but asked them to put this in my record in case I have problems in the future.  Well you betcha I have problems. All HDMI ports don't work. Worst when I called support again to record the issue they give me a repair ticket number and a phone number to call. The repair firm had no record of the ticket and when I called back Samsung to find out what's up, there was no record of the repair ticket number.  The rep didn't enter the info!I think Samsung deliberately creates a circular maze of support incompetence to make you give up.So buy Sony instead - mine is 7 years old and works great.

Reviews.Title: The is a smart TV. 5 star for the TV part. 1 start for "smart" part.  bottom-line is this smart TV just like a Not-Smart-TV
Reviews.Author: Qun
Reviews.Content: Initially, I was very excited about this TV.  It has all the common apps including a web browser for the internet.  it can also do wireless connection to a sound bar and wireless display your tablet (also call mirror cast).  But when I start to use all these functions, I was disappointed.Things I like:1) wireless connection to a sound bar.  I have a Samsung HW-FM45C 280W Soundbar.  The blue tooth connection is excellent. every time when i turn on the TV, the sound bar is turned on automatically.  Sound quality is good too. It enable me to get ride of a bulky amplifier.Things I DO NOT like;1) The web browser experience.  Able to browser the internet on big screen TV without a computer is one of the reasons to buy this TV.  Unfortunately, The TV load the internet webpage very slowly.  I have 50 mbps wi-fi but only get 10 mbps with severe latency.  I have checked my router, cable etc. with several PCsand laptops.  All have near 50 mbps speed when no TV is involved.  After talk to Samsung support.  I finally realized that it is the TV problem.  The TV has low computing power (like computer with cheap CPU).  In other words, the slow internet can NOT be fixed.2). Wireless display tablet on big TV screen (mirror cast).  According to the comments on the web, old version of Samsung tablet can do this kind of mirror cast, but the new version (for example Samsung Tab 3) can't.  They removed this option from their new tablet.  I try to connect to 3 Non-Samsung tablets but all failed to connect to TV.My solution:In the end, I got an apple TV and using apple TV for the Mirror cast (Airplay).  When using Apple TV, the webpage loading is fast and no noticeable  latency.  The is also prove that the Samsung TV has a very slow chip.  Since I have to get an Apple TV, why i need a Smart TV?  The differences between Samsung smart TV and regular LED TV is $600.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: Cathy Kirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: We love this tv. The picture was set perfectly right out of the box. It is smarter than we are so we are learning all the features of the remote. Not too fond of the silver stand or frame, would prefre black.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Nam Sungmee
Reviews.Content: I am so satisfied with this product. If I needed, I would like to buy moreEspecailly during the black friday

Reviews.Title: Amazing tv, especially for video games!
Reviews.Author: John Rellick
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture. Excellent for gaming. I have a Samsung surround sound hooked up to it making movies and video games amazing. The 240hz refresh rate is great if you like that "real life" look. All the smart features are very nice as well, including the 3D. Overall very pleased with my purchase. My previous tv was a samsung so this TV was an obvious choice for me.  5/5.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: heatmiser
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my arcade.  I have always been a Pioneer Elite Kuro guy, but since they are unavailable now because too many people bought crappy tvs and drove Pioneer out.  This thing has a great picture on it, and definately has ZERO lag, trails, whatever you want to call it.  Its super thing and is very light, as I hung it up by myself.  The picture quality is excellent too, and now its $100 less than when I bought it.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: AGGIE HUH
Reviews.Content: Great buy but I didn't expect the touch-pad type remote control.Easy to follow the manual provided for setting up.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous tv
Reviews.Author: SSM
Reviews.Content: Love everything about this tv!! Picture is crystal clear even from side angles. Love the smart features. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Kyle Newcomer
Reviews.Content: If I gave 5 star reviews - this would be one that received a 5.  I don't but this is a great TV.  Was going to be a replacement for a Sony Bravia, but ended up putting in the basement to be the "center piece" of the family room.3D up scaling is decent - have not had a 3D tv previously and have not watch 3D on other home tv's so I can not accurately compare this feature.Thin, light, great picture (some tweaking required) Sound - not so great but most would use a sound system of some kind to give a complete audio experience.Great shipping - the delivery men were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: Nice so far, but the defaults are an issue.
Reviews.Author: JH "Bubba"
Reviews.Content: (edit) ADDING THIS TO THE TOP - I'm sure this is in other reviews, but I found that to turn offSoap Opera effect, set Auto Motion Plus off. It's located a menu/Picture/..scroll down and click on Picture Optionsand it's in that sub-menu. Yet another poorly chosen default. Love the tv though.My wife and I moved the 50 inch flat screen to the mbr and my wife was huffing and puffing afterward.So naturally she was getting prepared for the extra weight of the 65" Samsung when she and Iwere pleasantly surprised at how much lighter it is than our 50" which is only several years old.  Instructions for connecting the base were misleading. It told me to lay the tv face down andafter assembling the foot, attach it to the tv, but it doesn't show that you have to lift the one sideof the tv up about 10 inches to attach it. I know that everybody will figure that out, but it's irritating thatthe tech writer just ignores that part of the instruction. And about that four pronged foot. I really preferthe look of the typical solid base because we have a giant nice wood home theatre enclosure that the stainlesslook sort of clashes with. This unit looks like it should rest on a clear glass or stainless steel mount of some kind.  The setup was very easy, connecting to dish and my local internet no problem. I did not like theSmart picture thingy. If that is used to view the tv while browsing channels, then the default setting of tiny tvand giant channel icons doesn't do any good. Seems there's plenty of room on the screen to makethe picture larger and still have channel surfing. I also didn't like that it defaults to the Smart tv thingy.I didn't know how to get out of the damn thing and how to get to the regular channel display. Hitting enterworked several times, but once it didn't. I kept hitting the Enter key and the picture remained small.I went into picture setup and turned off that "feature". In my opinion, it should be off to start with. At thefactory, one could argue that if you make it the default, then folks will know about it and just fall in love with it. But, I prefer the lineof thought that you want the tv to work first time as seamlessly as possible to make a good impression and be easy to get up.If people want that feature, they'll search it out and figure it out. So, instead of being impressed by it, I was thoroughly annoyed by it to start with.  Second annoying thing is what I see folks are calling the soap opera effect. I did not know how to getrid of that for the first movie we watched except to set to "movie" mode instead of standard. But even that didn'tdo much to get rid of it. I'm going to try settings that other folks have listed in these reviews and hope they know whatthey're doing. So, our first 3d movie was essentially in soap opera mode which was the second bad first time impression.Seems to me that Samsung would have learned this a long time ago to have some simple settings that work forwhat most people like. Read these reviews and you see that they have failed miserably; not with the product but withthe marketing of it due to defaults and simple settings. Out of the box first impressions get a 2 or 3 star from me.  A small annoying thing that I still don't know if there's a fix for is that "dink" noise that the volume control makes. The louder you make the sound, the louder that dink noises becomes. It is extremely annoying at high "movie volume". I hope there's a way to disable that but I have not found it under the sound section of the tv setup. I also hope there's a way to make the volume increments less granular. Seems there was on one of my two 50 inch TV's.  About 3D. The instructions were not very clear how to set it up. The instructions didn't say to remove the plastic protectivepieces from the glasses. Ok, that's a no brainer, but it would be nice if Samsung were thorough. I found the glasses rather difficultto assemble. The sides that had to be "clicked" onto the front did not go in very easily. In fact, it took a great deal of force on my part to get that to happen on two of them. The glasses didn't work after registered successfully with the tv the first time. It said it had registered on the screen, but 3D didn't work. I registered again both sets of glasses, then it worked. I also didn't know of the difference between passive and active 3D. While viewing, I expected something to jump out at us like Disney or Epcot. But that never happened. Come to find out from reading these reviews, the "jumping out at you" effect is more a feature of passive 3D and this tv has Active 3D. Having said all this, we really enjoyed the 3D movie and the effects of it. To me, the movie had great 3D depth but the images seemed to start at the tv and go behind the tv rather than coming forward like maybe passive 3D would do. It was very, very impressive even in that darned soap opera mode. The glasses were comfortable for me, but my wife like some other reviewers found them to be very uncomfortable to wear. I'm curious how long the batteries will last and wish these were rechargeable. I hope I can find batteries that fit that are rechargeable. I was pleased that this tv came with 4 pairs and that those were not optional.  We bought the Samsung 3D blue ray player to go with this unit and since we own the Samsung 2D blue ray, I'd like to say that both interfaces for that unit are equally confusing. To this day I don't know what the logic is behind the interface that gets in my way of the DVD interface. You know; the globe icon and other stuff. I realize they want to act like a roku player, but having all that stuffbe the default like the Smart TV thingy just serves to annoy and confuse me. It is as though an engineer has worked his way into a high level product management position. He or they need to go back to the engineering department where they belong. OR, and I've seen this a number of times in my life; the ceo dictated the defaults. Well, you can't very well do anything about that. But, as a consumer, I think some of the product management/marketing decisions for this product are all wrong.  So far, the setup was relatively easy but clumsy as stated above. The picture looks good, but I suspect it will look much better after adjusting it like other folks have had to do. Just like my latent, undiscovered benevolent dictator skills; if I were running Samsung, these stupid setup problems wouldn't be a problem. You can't please everybody, but if I ran the show, most of the negative comments I see here would not be found in these reviews. I'll add to this review once I really get to know the tv.So far I like it.

Reviews.Title: Good product - horrid support
Reviews.Author: Louis Eagle Warrior "eaglewarrior"
Reviews.Content: I have a few Samsung products including this TV. Others are a Galaxy tablet and an all in one computer.I gave two stars based only the product itself.One would think or hope, that Samsung's so-called support personnel were trained in their products. THEY ARE NOT!!It is extremely rare, and I mean extremely rare, that I call them about any problems with issues or questions that the respondent knows what they are talking about. They place you on interminable hold while they go searching for answers and even then when they come back the replies are vague and unhelpful. They have to go and read about it or ask others,.What they are good at doing, and this is the only thing, is wasting a lot of time verifying personal information like address, e-mail, etc.They are poorly trained or not trained at all. Once in a while I've been promised a call back from an advanced tech who will troubleshoot an issue directly on my tablet, for example. The callback never happens.It is frustrating to call a company this size and reach people who know nothing about the products they are supposed to support. I have never experienced support from any other company lat such a pathetic level.Bottom line, their customer service and product support is horrific and that's being kind.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: arcadiajim
Reviews.Content: I have the 65" version of this TV and, once it's properly dialed in, the picture is just fantastic.  Nearly 180 degrees of viewing angle with no degradation of picture quality as is common with most LED/LCD TVs.  Some flash-lighting and clouding is evident on very dark scenes (such as when the movie credits are rolling) but not to the point of being distracting. Even my wife, who can't tell HD from SD programming, has commented on how much better the picture on this TV looks compared to the Sony it replaced.The only negative I have is not about the TV, but the remote. It just doesn't have enough buttons to perform minor tasks without a lot of swiping or extra clicking.  (I believe Samsung has a newer version that address this problem).  Since I mostly use a Harmony remote to control my A/V equipment, this hasn't been an issue for me, but it may be for some people.

Reviews.Title: Value, options, sold !
Reviews.Author: Joshua Stone
Reviews.Content: This Tv is a Great value. I can't see why anyone would need/want any more performance or options from a set.

Reviews.Title: beautiful picture
Reviews.Author: dieter
Reviews.Content: just what we hoped for--clear picture, sleek styling .  TV shows look so much better now. We enjoy all shows more .

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: FreelanceViper
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a few months ago to replace my old 36" that was in my living room. This TV is incredible. The color and 3D is jaw dropping. My only complaints with it are the lack of buttons on the TV itself requiring you to always use the remote, (a problem if you can't find the remote) the remote itself, (touch pad can be aggravating, and $100 to replace) and the fact that certain modes are buried (game mode) or disabled in the menu.Other than those few things I am super happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Angle viewing is distorts the color
Reviews.Author: Jack of Trade
Reviews.Content: This TV is great looking in its physical appearance, and the remote is really neat. The 4 pairs of 3D glasses are great if you are into 3D viewing, but you will need to get packs of extra batteries for the 3d glasses because they will be used fast. The TV physical size is great and thin, but the viewing angle on this TV is bad. If you sit in front of it, the color, brightness, and contrast is great. But if you sit about 45 degrees, the color setting is out of wack. Brightness is better and washed when viewing at an angle.Other than the viewing angle, the TV is a good buy at $2K.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Bad Customer Support
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Peace
Reviews.Content: I seldom leave reviews but a new television is an expensive purchase. The TV shipped quickly and arrived in perfect condition from Amazon. Overall it's a great TV, but if you have a dark media room the backlighting needs to be reduced to 3 or 4, otherwise you will see what appears to be little spotlights in the corners. The 3D is not as good as a Panasonic plasma, but if you play games or use it with a PC it is not subject to plasma burn-in. This is the compromise you make when choosing LCD/LED over plasma. I knew this when I purchased the TV and have no complaints. The picture quality is excellent.One pair of the 3D glasses included with the TV are defective. They have trouble syncing and cannot be turned off except by removing the battery. I called Samsung to exchange them. They took down my information and requested that I send them proof of purchase, etc. A few days later another representative called to get the model and serial number of the glasses. They told me I would receive a postal label in my email to return the glasses for exchange.  A few days went by but no email arrived. I called Samsung back and was told that the email would arrive only after the exchange was approved by executive level customer service. A few more days go by and I receive a  voicemail from another representative requesting that I call them back. I finally get another call back and am told that the email with the mailing label will be sent today. I've been told this before so I won't be holding my breath in anticipation.This is very poor customer service. My first call should have resulted in an exchange process for the glasses. It has now taken over a week, and I'm still playing phone tag with Samsung. This begs the question of what would happen if the TV failed? How long would I be without a TV while playing phone tag with Samsung?Be warned that Samsung does not have good customer service, and that getting warranty work may be problematic. Yes, their representatives will be very nice to you, but the process moves forward at a snail's pace.Will I ever get replacement glasses? Who knows?

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: TV is better than expected.  Very clear, great pictures and awesome features.  Nothing negative to say about this TV. Samsung has some great TVs.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Living Room
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jmocchi"
Reviews.Content: Perfect size, great picture and a smart TV too. Can watch all my favorite movies with Netflix and show all our pictures on the big screen. Do not like the remote that came with TV so bought another one with actual buttons from Amazon. Also bought a wireless keyboard to use with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Defective screen
Reviews.Author: N. Sarode
Reviews.Content: It was easy to set up the TV took about 30 minutes. Had to wait for few hours as it was delivered in cold temperature to bring it into room temperature. After a day, noticed fluorescent green lines at the edge of face or bright objects and more noticeable at the left half of the screen. Non-HD channels are not worth to watch @ 16:9 ratio.

Reviews.Title: Love the Big Screen!
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: Love the Samsung Smart TV, it has all the latest tech features. Great for fast moving sports.Certainly a winner by Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Thomas Hathaway
Reviews.Content: Love the tv. it's everything I wanted and expected. I got this tv from amazon and it was a year newer and had 3d, compared to the one I was going to buy at a store in town.

Reviews.Title: Does built-in Wi-Fi mean Wi-Fi ready??? Great pic but tough to configure settings & some features difficult to figure out
Reviews.Author: mel93657
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung 46" 7100 w/ built in wireless (a must have for my purchase), set it up & was very pleased - wireless feature working and all. Set up was easy....the stand, connecting to cable, turning the TV on, etc. Settings were not fun but I don't know if that is due to my lack of tech ability or the TV is difficult (or both). I am able to muddle my way through to a fairly awesome picture, which I would give 4-5 stars for. I recently moved & the TV will not even recognize my home network let alone get to a screen to enter the network password.  All other devices....notebooks, tablets, cell phones, printer recognize the home network right away. I called Samsung support today and the rep informed me that my TV is only Wi-Fi ready/I need to purchase a LAN adapter. He explained that my TV must have recognized the internet at my last home but not at my new home. Is this for real???? And if so, why on earth don't the ads, manual, sales people tell us these things. Geeeesh, I think it's easier to shop for a new vehicle than a TV these days! Other than this Wi-Fi issue & the same issues with settings, codes, etc. being frustrating as mentioned by other reviewers I love the picture this TV provides. It has super clarity, motion is great whether watching football or a classic western in b&w.; This is my first Samsung TV, I've always purchased Sony Bravia but, when shopping this time the Samsung seemed to offer the same features for less $$. I am giving only 3 stars due to the difficulty with the settings. Trying to work with all of the wonderful features this TV offers has been a complete drag. I can usually play around w/ most devices & figure things out pretty quickly...and will read the manual if I need to, lol. The Samsung has proven to be a challenge for me regardless. I am still on the fence as to which I prefer but so far I'm leaning toward my first love, the Sony Bravia. I have yet to set up the 55" Sony Bravia I have but hoping built-in Wi-Fi doesn't mean 'oh yah, but with adapter' for that TV as well!

Reviews.Title: Worried about Samsung Customer Service - Buy from Local Retailer
Reviews.Author: Fightin' 34th
Reviews.Content: Picture on this and other models owned by my family I'd rate as 5.  Service, I'd rate as 2 or 3 stars out of 5.  I purchased this TV (the 7050 model) from a local retailer.  It was by far the best picture available short of the 4K model (for which there is little if any programming).  The first set I took home had 6 - 8 gray bard radiating up vertically from top to bottom whenever the screen was black or letter-boxed -- VERY disturbing.  Whenever the screen was completely full of color, the picture was fine.  But when vertical bars radiate from  the bottom on a Macbook, it means the LED screen or bar at the bottom of the screen is going bad.  I called Samsung and talked with someone who appeared to be little more knowledgable than a minimum wage worker.  She instructed me to run the self diagnostics (which I'd already done).  Since the screen on the self diagnostic  picture is completely full of color, the problem did not appear.  So she said she would have someone from tech support (or some such department) call me.  When I asked how long it would take, she said 24 hours.  I told her there was no way I was going to wait 24 hours for help, OR to have a brand new set that had been plugged in for 2 days repaired.  I said if someone could call me within an hour and perhaps tell me how to change the settings or otherwise correct this problem, I'd be willing to wait.  She said it would still be 24 hours.  So I took it back to the local retailer who without any fuss exchanged it for another new (in box) set.  The new set has been working well (knock on wood) for 2 days and the picture is fantastic.  I have a smaller Samsung (last year's model) as does my son.  Both sets have performed well.  But, I am a concerned that Samsung's service is lacking.  I hope that if and when I need it, it's better than "someone will call you in 24 hours."

Reviews.Title: A really excellent TV
Reviews.Author: James Dykstra
Reviews.Content: Compared to the rear projection set this replaced, it has more than enough brightness to work well in our bright room,  when compared to other brands, it seems perceptibly  brighter and crisper.The picture quality is excellent at the "movie" setting for almost all content, including sports broadcasts.  The "standard" picture setting occasionally seems garishly colored (especially in football games) and did some strange things in processing a few very dark scenes.The built in speakers are remarkably distortion free even at the volume needed to fill or our large room.  However, that was a quick test as we normally use an external amplifier and speakers.Overall, it hard to believe that this is one or two models below the top of the line.  A great value.

Reviews.Title: WoW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Will L
Reviews.Content: Best TV for the money!!!! 2D blows every other LED out the box. I was a little skeptical about the active 3D glasses but they work great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Pat Johnson
Reviews.Content: We love the size - 60". The picture is wonderful. Hooked up headphones so it doesn't have to be real loud for everyone. Still figuring out a few things like voice and 3D. But the picture quality is great. The TV is very light weight too which is great. So far after about 6 weeks, we are completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Ivan Baker
Reviews.Content: I already had a Smart TV however I purchased it a couple of years ago. Smart Tv's have evolved over the last couple of years and this is much better than my other TV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Picture
Reviews.Author: J. White
Reviews.Content: I love this TV.  The picture is excellent.  I prefer the "natural" setting for picture.  On initial turn on the TV picture was very dim.  The default setting is a joke.  I then cycled through the various settings and things changed for the better.Sound quality, while not great, was still much better than expected.  Some may prefer an add on soundbar though.My only real complaint about this set is the strange method of installing the remote control batteries.  Very poor design for accessing the compartment.  Much harder than it should be to get the back off and get access to the batteries.All in all this is an excellent TV and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted
Reviews.Author: Garet Takiguchi
Reviews.Content: The television is as it says. Very clear and works well. The viewing area is very large and looks like it almost runs off onto the wall.

Reviews.Title: Great but LED wash out from side
Reviews.Author: Sleeve
Reviews.Content: UN60F7100Great Tv. But I always had Plasma's and decided to get this Samsung LED becausemy Plasma's always had an issue after 2 plus years.In my opinion Plasma's are still the best picture and although this looks greatdirectly in front, once you start to move left or right, you can see the colorin their faces get lighter. I watch from my kitchen a lot because I am preparingmeals for kids and my kitchen is at a 30 degree angle left and it is noticeable.I know LED's at 180 degree angle are not as good as Plasma's but if I move onestep left or right you can see the brightness change.IF ANYONE knows of a setting that might help, please advise, I have a DisneyWOW calibration DVD that I have yet to use.Over all a great picture but if you are used to Plasma's then there is anadjustment period. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Flawless
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel Chereque
Reviews.Content: Perfect quality, ultra thin, easy to use.This is a great TV. The price is worth it, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Francisco Guijarro
Reviews.Content: I'm still playing with this TV but I can tell you that so far I'm in love with it. Resolution looks amazing, especially while playing video games and watching HD (I wouldn't buy this TV if I didn't have these two). I will continue playing with this amazing TV and write some more information in the near future.

Reviews.Title: wand
Reviews.Author: Talbot Flyer
Reviews.Content: terrible wand, difficult to use, I do like the TV picture but navigation around the screen and trying to find content is a real problem.

Reviews.Title: Last Samsung purchase
Reviews.Author: Loren Brichter
Reviews.Content: The colors are putrid by default (and still not great after a few hours of calibration), backlight is splotchy, and soap-opera mode spontaneously turns itself on every few weeks (AutoMotion plus OFF on all inputs) and the only way to fix it is to physically unplug the TV. Next time going with a Sony or LG.

Reviews.Title: Great 3D experience
Reviews.Author: Warren
Reviews.Content: I am a 3D junkie, but I use the TV mostly in 2D - as will most everyone who gets one. I love everything about the TV EXCEPT the following:My biggest complaint is with batteries in the 3D glasses. I hate that. Since I do not use the 3D feature often, I do not keep the batteries in the glasses, but rather install them before use. And then I have to get the glasses turned on before I can use them. I really wish I had purchased a TV with passive glasses. Also - and this is huge - the glasses need to "turn on" when viewing 3D content and there is a delay of a couple seconds - and this is disconcerting - especially when switching between 2D and 3D content. Really - for me this is a reason I would have purchased a different model TV.Second biggest complaint is that the menu system is overly complicated - too many features most of which will not be used. OK for me ( I have a masters in EE), but my wife will never be able to operate the thing. I want to be able to turn it on, pick a source (cable / DVD / AmazonTV / USB / etc.) and go. But they are trying so hard to sell content that it offers a TON of options and these make is so complicated that many will never be able to use it. I purchased the Samsung DVD player to go with the TV and I love that it switched to DVD automatically as soon as I insert a DVD into the DVD slot. Not sure how the TV knows, but maybe my wife will have a chance with this.But then there is the problem that the menus for the TV and the DVD player are the same and I sometimes don't know which I am looking at on the TV screen. I am sitting there clicking the TV remote, but looking at the DVD remote. Actually, I think that both remotes are supposed to work with both units, but I have not taken the time to figure this all out.When I try to access Netflix using the TV (which is cool, i admit), there is a significant wait (15-30 seconds?) for the Netflix application to load, I could also run Netflix from the Samsung DVD player which also makes me wait. So I purchased an Amazon Fire TV unit which does NOT make we wait - at least not after the first time. Also, Roku does not make we wait. Anyway, here are 4 ways for me to watch Netflix on my system - and my wife is supposed to understand this ? ? ? I think I will have to make up  laminated operating instructions for her. And she is a VERY smart woman - senior business executive, but not patient with tech.I have a Fuji 3D camera. The TV knows how to handle the 3D photos from this camera and this is great, but I see a noticeable flicker when viewing them, but I can live with this, but why can't it be as beautiful as when viewing a Blue-Ray 3D DVD?? Also, it will not display the 3D videos taken by the camera without first converting them to a different format.So mostly I am very happy with the TV - except that I wish I had purchased a TV that uses passive glasses rather than active glasses.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Crappy remote
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  Great picture, it's super thin.  It also has Arc, so all you need is one HDMI to the TV/receiver.  The voice feature doesn't work all that well. The remote pretty much sucks.  It has a touch pad that is horrible to use.  I'd rather have buttons.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture, attractive looks but horrible WiFi.
Reviews.Author: Kermit
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to repeat what a lot of the reviews have already said about the picture.  It's excellent, especially after it's calibrated.If you use the WiFi to stream, you might want to look at other TVs.  I get a network error watching Netflix and Hulu, but I use the Plex app most of all.  It's streaming media from my desktop computer, so a bad internet connection isn't the cause.  I've also made sure I'm on a channel with little-to-no interference.  After a little research, it turns out that the wireless system they use is just not good.  Sometimes it works fine and other times I have to turn my tv off and on every 5 minutes.  There are work arounds to improve connectivity but at the cost of lowering my security settings on my router.[...]

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, poor sound
Reviews.Author: Adyol Soto
Reviews.Content: The TV picture quality is amazing, however the sound quality is really poor.  I've tried all audio settings and it doesn't get any better

Reviews.Title: Great brights but the darks are not all that :o(
Reviews.Author: Henry Perez "Mets Fan"
Reviews.Content: I love this TV BUT my only problem is with dark scenes.  You can barely see anything :o**(  my older model which was another Samsung 46 inch died on me after 5 years of use and although it was an LCD it was was better on dark scenes than this one.  For sporting events and movies that have very bright scenes it is perfect but if you are watching movies like Rise of the Guardians you will feel cheated :o( and movies like Thor the Dark World :o( same thing you are at a huge loss.

Reviews.Title: Great TV after Adjustment/Tuning
Reviews.Author: BAMBAM
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box I was worried that I might have made a mistake. It seemed blurry and juddery.  After reviewing online and using other peoples settings the picture looked a lot better but not amazing.  I also turned off the noise reduction settings and used movie mode prior to using the Disney WOW calibration DVD.  It  helps you fine tunes the hue with the blue filter provided in the kit and works great.  I think I need to tweek the picture on it a little more but it looks great.  It really depends on the source if its 720P or better it looks great anything less you can tell.  Blu Rays look amazing!I still have not used the 3D yet but I did not buy it for that.Internet works but is a little slow - its not a computer!  Cool to look at stuff with your friends / family though.The 60" does have a thicker bezel than the others but that does not bother me.  I have an articulating wall mount and have to move the TV to view it from the Kitchen.  I have trouble not touching the screen with the 1/2'' Bezel.The only issues that I have with the TV are:1) Glare - I can still view it during the day but the screen is shiny and reflects a good bit.2) I have a little bit of flash lighting? (if that is the correct term) on completely black screens.  It seems to be getting better and its not bad enough for me to return it.  I just would have thought a tv this expensive would be almost perfect.  i guess its more of an issue with the edge lit technology than anything.

Reviews.Title: Great product, user friendly setup.
Reviews.Author: scotch
Reviews.Content: Wow, affect picture !, intuitive and user friendly setup. pedestal mount is solid , connections are well laid out .Wall mount application may have issue with some connections i.e. RG45 connection or LAN is not vertical input.

Reviews.Title: Great picture - quality assurance lacking though
Reviews.Author: Betty Schmidt "care giver"
Reviews.Content: We received the TV on the promised ship date. However we were not able to get past the 1st step to using the TV. First step is to attach the stand to the TV using supplied screws. The screws supplied would not work with the base. After 5 phone calls to Samsung, a rep decided we had the wrong screws and said he would send the correct ones that day. Two and a half weeks later we still didn't have the screws. After numerous calls to Samsung and local Samsung repair shops, we could not get the specs on the screws required to acquire them from a hardware store. After 3 weeks we received another base (exactly like the 1st one) with 2 packets of screws. One packet was the same as originally sent and the other was the CORRECT screws!We quickly got the base attached and set up the TV. It worked like a champ. Our only complaint is that provided remote control is very difficult to use and is feature poor. We still have to use our DirecTV remote for most functions. The most annoying thing is trying to tune to a particular station without having to scroll down the entire list of stations. Also we have a security camera programmed to be on channel 17, and there is no way to get to 17 with the Samsung remote.Samsung gets zero stars for the base & wrong screws fiasco. The TV would have gotten 4 stars if the remote was usable. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV purchased.
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Lucas
Reviews.Content: Even I set up the TV, and I definitely am not savvy with technology.  The remote takes getting use to, but I am learning.

Reviews.Title: very very good~!!
Reviews.Author: kim young hwan
Reviews.Content: Um.. This product very good. But color is a litte strong. So It's a bit worried about my children watching new TV. Anyway, It is very very good product. That's all

Reviews.Title: This television is incredible
Reviews.Author: kyung hwan lee
Reviews.Content: This television is incredible. The picture is clear and because of the 120Hz all of the fast moving screens (sports/racing) are smooth and without the jerky anomalies that you would otherwise experience. I connected this to my internet router and so am also able to stream any of the HUGE Amazon Prime movies that are available. I have already tried this feature and it works without any problems.I am still learning the functionality of the Samsung but I have to say that they have truly made the whole process pretty darned easy for the consumer.

Reviews.Title: Insane Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Ryan MacClellan
Reviews.Content: Incredible picture and Smart TV technology is like nothing I've ever experienced. Best Television I've ever has by a landslide!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: BL
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this tv. The picture is great and it was easy to setup. The remote was a little odd at first but I've gotten used to it. My only complaint is about the apps. The YouTube app is much slower than my laptop and they are both using the same wireless network.

Reviews.Title: Picture is dark
Reviews.Author: Brett Gittleson
Reviews.Content: But tv works well overall.  The remote control is a little funky and takes time getting used to.  There aren't any buttons!

Reviews.Title: Awesome large beautiful 75" 3D LED TV
Reviews.Author: Joe Alarcon "Joe Alarcon"
Reviews.Content: These my 7th Samsung flat screen and it is awesome picture period, I've had it for about a week.It's a great buy and fun.That's it

Reviews.Title: very high priced but good product
Reviews.Author: Jack Teubner
Reviews.Content: very costly, and Samsung had a price freeze on this product and I do not like that type of sales tactact.  However product is what I would expect for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: Incredible picture
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from my 40" samsung which is 4 years old, and the difference is amazing. It's an incredibly thin tv and light and the picture is excellent. The only thing I would recommend is to  disable the smart blurring altogether. The soap opera affect just isn't for me.
