FWIW a story rhyming with rosco has a $300 instant rebate until 9/7, free shipping, 2 year warranty and wireless keyboard.

Reviews.Title: 3D TV
Reviews.Author: Larry Sibala
Reviews.Content: Only problem is the size of the 3D glasses, they don't fit over my glasses. Like the LGs that I ried at the stores. Picture is great beats out the Mitsu DLP that I have and the Sony too.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Alex Radeski
Reviews.Content: This is the largest TV I have owned, and the build and TV quality are excellent. Totally happy. Got it on sale so even better!

Reviews.Title: Nice buy
Reviews.Author: Wendy Cheung
Reviews.Content: This tv can turn anything into 3d feature and my daughter loves it. 3 d glasses are battery operates but we couldn't make out how to then it off without taking away the batteries. Overall, we love it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: William S. Spielberger
Reviews.Content: The picture is perfect. No lag when changing channels. Great for watching sports can't believe the clarity. Plus the smart tv with all the apps this tv has it all...

Reviews.Title: The Best TV I've Owned, Ever!
Reviews.Author: Ahmad
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this TV. Great minimalistic, modern design, small form factor. The picture quality is amazing as well. When it comes to TV, Samsung is a no brainer. The smart section of TV is everything you need, from Netflix to Facebook, and etc.Over all, I couldn't be happier with this purchase. I bit expensive but worth every penny.The remote is awesome as well because it controls my FIOS TV box as well and it has a touch pad as well.

Reviews.Title: good but software needs improvements
Reviews.Author: Oana
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent and has plenty of features (more that I need)Now the cons : You can not set up favorites on a HDMI connection and the full tv guide is always opened at channel 1. If you switch the source to antenna the favorites are available but the sound and image quality is considerably poorer. Sometimes it takes longer to load the guide and then the tv restarts by itself.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Smart 3D HDTV but Structurally Fragile
Reviews.Author: REAL DEAL "ANDY"
Reviews.Content: I recent bought this TV to replace my 5 years old Sony LCD TV. I must say that Samsung has done a great job with this TV. The default setting for color, to my personal preference, is not what I prefer so additional tweak and it looks great now. The build of the TV is some what fragile not as sturdy as what I used to see 4-5 years back. You can turn to the left or right for better viewing angle but this needs to be carefully done; otherwise, you can really break the plastic that holds the TV to the stand! I guess, you get what you pay for. Smart TV options is fairly good except the remote is somewhat annoying to use but I will get use to it somehow. Web browser is OK, not that fast since this TV has dual core processor not the quad one but enough for my usage which not that much. The price is reasonable especially TV Low Price Guarantee by Amazon which helps me get the lowest price within 14 days of shipping! What a great "deal"!I give 3 stars on the build and remote but 5 stars for the picture quality and other options so average that out is 4 stars. Had I known all this, I would buy this TV any how.More: I finally managed to set up the IR so I can use only one remote to control the cable box. Though Samsung remote can do the minimum required activities so you can jump around from one channel to the other. One nice thing is that it keeps the history so you do not have to enter the channel number in, just select from the history list. Pretty convenience.More on picture quality: The picture is crisp, clear, sharp, etc... it is so good that now I can see all the details enough to realize that whether they shot the movie on location or in the studio. I did not really notice this with my old HDTV!

Reviews.Title: I'm not a Audio/Visual aficionado, here's the truth.
Reviews.Author: Manny
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of Samsung TV. By far the best picture quality of any TV we've owned. We have a 55" Samsung UN55C7100 in our living room. I’ve had it for over 5 years. No problems. The picture still looks perfect.We bought a new house with a basement and decide to make the basement space an entertainment room/theater room/play room. It's dark down there. Because of the size we decided to we were looking for a 75 - 80 inch TV. We looked at all our option and really came down to the Sharp 3-D 240hz 80". the 2013 757U model. The picture was ok. I could live with it because of the price at the time $4k. This TV was also edge lit but did not offer local dimming (or micro dimming as Samsung calls it). Once we got into watching DARK movies in a DARK room, we quickly realized that "CLOUDING" and "FLASH LIGHTING" was going to be an issue. Sharp admitted to us that it was normal for their panels, and there was nothing they can do or any changes to the setting that will correct this. So the TV went back. H.H. Gregg was kind enough to let us exchange the TV for the UN75F7100, which was slightly smaller, but was also 240 Hz, 3-D, edge lit, BUT it included micro/local dimming. So we bought the Samsung for $4k.After having the for a couple months, watching all types of movies, and changing many of the settings, I realized that clouding was also prevalent on this TV.Samsung manufacturers some of their panels, and they have other companies, like Sharp, manufacturers some for them as well. There are a few version of the 75" panel that Samsung uses for this TV. TH01, which is supposedly made by Samsung in Mexico, is the most common. UH01 is another, supposedly made by Sharp. There's talk of TH02 and UH02's out there, which may be the updated version of the problem panel's we're about to discuss.So I spent a month playing the panel lottery (exchanging TV's until you get a good panel). Keep in mind I have the TV in the basement, which dark and normally only watch the TV down there at night, so I have it in the perfect parameters for clouding to be exposed.Before I proceed, know that the 7100 models and above have micro dimming which should adjust the dimming and contrast uniformly across the panel. BUT...big BUT, micro dimming only works on the Dynamic, Standard, and Natural setting. Although MOVIE mode give you the most accurately calibrated colors that makes you say "WOW…what an amazing TV", it does not turn the micro dimming on. In my opinion, this was a horrible mistake by Samsung.My first panel was TH01, the clouding and flash lighting out of the corners was horrible. Even turning the back light down to zero would not eliminate the clouding. Dynamic, Natural and Standard did not fix it. Samsung had agreed to replace the entire panel, but with the TV being 2 weeks old, and still under the store exchange warranty, I decided to replace it with a new model before letting a technician rip the TV apart.I replaced it with a second set, also a TH01. This panel was remarkably better. Although it had clouding at the factory settings, turning the back light down to a 10 made it barely visible. On Dynamic, Standard or Natural, the backlight is almost nonexistent with the exception of minor amount at the bottom left corner and even less on the top right corner. But this panel up close shows what appears to be black pressure point patches on the top left, top center, and top right corner. You have to be standing within a foot of the panel while it’s on and tuned to a black screen. But seriously, who watches TV like that. My couch is 10 feet back, and when will I ever stare at a black screen for more than a second.Regardless, I called H.H. Gregg and had them send another TV. This one was a UH01 panel. This time, I had them set up the TV on the floor and look at both screens side by side. This UH01 had more clouding at factory setting then my second set. So they left my second TH01 set and took back the third UH01 set.Then I decided to visit the two local H.H. Greggs in my area and look at the floor models. The one from the store I bought it at was much worse. Keep in mind that the showroom is lit up and nowhere near as dark as my basement, and the floor model was bad. Even in a lit room.Went to the next H.H. Gregg and looked at their floor model. This one looked perfect (in a lit room). This was also a TH01. The floor manager agreed to let me buy the floor model, take it home and compare it to my current one, so I did.This one in the dark had clouding as well, pretty much on the entire left side, top to bottom. The bottom right corner had a white streak of light like the corner of the panel was pinched by a screw or something. On all 4 settings, the clouding performed like my current (the 2nd) set. I would say just little more clouding, but not much. The picture quality was much better though. It seemed to a bit clearer and a lot more calibrated. But because the clouding was slightly worse, and I hadn't calibrated mine (the second set) yet, I returned the 4th set back to the store.I have come to the conclusion that every single set at 75 inches is going to have some clouding; the question is which one has the least. The black pressure points suck, but I can’t see them when I'm watching TV. And if I’m watching a dark movie, I flip to Natural Mode to turn micro dimming on and the clouding goes away. I personally haven't seen a UH02 panel, but I'm extremely interested in viewing one. I hear it's the premier panel. That is probably what Samsung reserves for the UN75F8000 series, which is probably what the extra $2,000 buys you, a uniformed panel.I can't decide what I want to do next. Call Samsung and have them replace the panel or live with it. I’m truly exhausted and can't image having to dismount the TV again and again since it is wall mounted.So I'm giving it 5 stars for the picture quality being the most amazing of any other brand. But I'm taking 1 star away for clouding/flash lighting, and taking 3 stars away because I'm so frustrated that I spent $4,000 on a TV and it doesn't look like a $4,000 TV. But the MSRP is like $6,000, and it sell for like $5,000, seriously Samsung?I would not recommend this TV to anyone AT this time. If I had to do over, I wait another year or two and see what new technologies and TV's are released in the 75 - 80 inch range. 4k resolution TV are hitting the market so fast featuring local/micro dimming and major advancement in lighting technology.Since it has been over 90 days since I bought the original TV, I can't return this one, but the store will let me exchange it. But how many times do I have to keep doing this.I'm kind of lost at this point, and sadly, the customer service reps at Samsung don't speak English very well and don’t really understand the technology side of it. They just run the picture test mode and verify that there’s a uniformed picture. But the test picture they use a bight shot of kids playing at the beach. Nothing that will ever show the darkness flaws on the screen.Bottom Line: If you watch TV in a lit room, and don't watch dark movies like "The Dark Knight", "The Purge", "Star Trek into Darkness", or any movie with a prolonged dark scene, then get it.If you want see an perfectly amazing dark picture from a TV that retails for $5,000. DON'T do it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Seong-Yeon Kim
Reviews.Content: Item as described.Panel is very thin!!Nice view / Many smart features / High performance, reasonable price....Strongly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Holy Cow..........what a Picture
Reviews.Author: Lee "07 Dyna Low Rider"
Reviews.Content: Got the 55" in this 7100 series to work with my Directv genie whole home satellite system  It's absolutely the most beautiful picture you can imagine. It will blow you away. I used the tweaks posted by another owner who has the 46".  Used 98% of his setting and am glad I did. He really took the work out of setting it up for the rest of us.......bless his heart.  I also set this TV up with the SAMSUNG HT F5500 1000W 3D BD HTIB Home theater system 5.1 surround sound that included a 3D BluRay player. It even has FM capabilities and  It has the wireless rear speakers. Sweet system. I had the Geek Squad set it up and was glad I paid the money to do everything. Along with the above, I got theSAMSUNG VG-KBD2000/ZA keyboard to use with my internet, and I also purchased a Logitech Harmony ONE. Again, they came and set up everything ( for a fee) made sure it all worked properly, got my network set up and running, tested a NETFLIX movie....... and also set up the picture colors, contrast, sharpness etc. They programmed the Logitech where I only need 1 remote to work the Directv receiver, the Samsung TV, the Samsung BluRay /audio receiver. They also set it up to where I can have the TV sound only or switch to the 5.1 Surround Sound with one touch. I got rid of 3 remotes.But getting back to the TV.......  IMHO,I couldn't be more pleased and felt it's well worth the money.Aug 8, 2013 update..........TV still outstanding. No problems at all.  I just wanted to let people know that if you have Directv, it's remote will work with this Samsung model. The code I entered to pair the TV with the remote was "10812". Instructions on how to do it step by step is at directv.com/DTVAPP/global/contentPageIF.jsp?assetId=P6420119#h:620.426  Just copy and paste.  Only thing the Satellite remote won't do is get you to the TV's SMART HUB. So, for those who HATE the "smart remote" that comes with this TV....and don't want to spend $$$ for the Logitech Harmony, you can set up your Directv remote and use it like you always have.October 17, 2013Still in awe of the TV.  I have experimented with the settings quite a bit and made sure I downloaded the latest software... version 1113.  Even though I have AUTO UPDATE selected to ON.........I FIND I HAVE TO MANUALLY DO IT.  It does take time and once you decide to do the update, you're done watching TV until it loads. Depending on your speeds, this could take SEVERAL HOURS ( my WiFi speed is less than 1MB). I do the updates when I go to bed.  After the update is completed, the TV shuts off and turns back on all by itself.I found keeping my PICTURE MODE set to "MOVIE"  seemed to put a haze or dullness over most of the TV shows I watch......so I've changed it to "STANDARD" OR "NATURAL"..... and depending on the network broadcasts, sometimes "DYNAMIC".  The "Standard" setting really took away that dullness look and made the reds and other colors pop.  Under Advanced settings, I have my Dynamic contrast set to Medium, Black Tone set to Dark.  Under Picture Options I have the Color Tone set to Standard, Auto Motion Plus  set to Clear and Cinema Black to Off.  Film mode is set to Auto 2, Digital Clean View and MPEG Noise Filter are both set to AUTO.I must comment that every network and commercials that come on seems to use their own colors and sometimes the flesh colors are way off, but then the commercial ends and it goes back to normal.  Naturally, each person has their own preferences in their picture, so experiment. Just remember what numbers and setting you had before you start tweaking.  Happy Watching...............

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: ScrappyT
Reviews.Content: Great TV, slim and makes my living room feel more modern.  quick delivery. My first big Amazon purchase and it was a success!

Reviews.Title: As a tv great- everything else is crap
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: As strictly a tv, this tv is great. However, I did not spend extra money to get "smart" features and then not even be able to use them.The YouTube app (90% of what people use smart tvs for) is completely UNUSABLE. It is so slow and freezes constantly. With a Samsung phone synced to this, screen share has to stop and buffer CONSTANTLY. How is it that my iphone can play videos with better quality than my Smart tv?Also- the remote that comes with this tv is a compete piece of crap. Not only does it no longer come with a keyboard so you have to use arrows to find every individual letter (older models had a keyboard on the back of the remote), but it also has a really stupid touch screen track pad that you will accidentally touch about 50x a day which will drain the battery at an excessive rate. I have already changed the batteries 3 times to this tv in 6 months.If it weren't a "smart" tv, this would be the best tv I have ever owned. Definitely 5 stars. But honestly at this point I would return it if I could because I get so aggravated every time I want to show someone a YouTube video and have to play it on my iphone when there is a 60" "smart" tv in front of me.

Reviews.Title: 3 out of 3 screens had a dead pixel.
Reviews.Author: bhauser
Reviews.Content: When my ancient Samsung DLP finally started fail, I thought I would replace it with a decent LCD display.  I did my research and decided that the un60F7100 was the right TV for me.  I purchased one from Best Buy in early October 2013.  I have since had to refuse delivery on 3 of these because of dead pixels.  Each screen had exactly one dead pixel.  This leads me to suspect that Samsung sorts the screens by the number of dead pixels and assigns them to a model.  I would suspect that the 8000 series gets the best screens and screen quality goes down from there.Maybe I'm being picky, but I think that $2000 TV's should should come from the factory with exactly zero dead pixels.  Don't get me wrong, I still think that Samsung produces great LCD screens.  The picture looks fantastic on these screens.  I just can't see myself spending the next 4-5 years staring at this TV, playing spot the dead pixel.  I'd even try to have another set delivered if I thought I would get one without any dead pixels.  With that in mind, I think I will replace the DLP chip in my current TV.  This will buy me some time so I can try again when the 2014's come out.

Reviews.Title: What Samsung doesn't tell you about the UN60F7100 TV
Reviews.Author: GreenGuy
Reviews.Content: is how frustrating their overly complex interface and clumsy user experience can be. One reason for choosing the Samsung UN60F7100 TV was access to both Netflix and Amazon Instant Video, both of which have dedicated buttons on the remote. Amazon requires a 5-digit code from the TV. That proved difficult to obtain. Contact with tech support revealed that to use either Netflix or Amazon Instant Video, one absolutely must create a Samsung account and set up the Smart Hub. The two documents one must agree to appear to be very intrusive. One must read them line by line - not page by page and there's no scanning or skipping portions of no concern. One must agree that all information, including credit card #, name, address, phone, etc. (not sure about Wi-Fi password) can be transmitted internationally and used by anyone Samsung deals with. There was no indication how long the docs were or what percentage I'd read.  I lost patience after a few screens and perhaps a hundred button pushes. I couldn't find them on Samsung's website or with a quick web search.Next, tech support. Tech support was very slow and uncertain, repeating to me questions I'd already answered, with long pauses to research how to set up Amazon. "Try unplugging the set and waiting 30 seconds."I found online documentation to be lengthy and difficult to read and search. There is help on the TV, but the crappy remote is required to navigate it. Speaking of which, the touchy little touch pad on the remote is required to navigate menus for common and frequent actions such as changing the picture size or activating closed captioning.The web browser is slow to render and scroll, difficult to navigate and basically useless. Unless the remote is on a solid table, pressing the center of the touch pad to select something causes the cursor to jump off target so that you select something else and have to back up and try again. Then there's the difficulty of typing with it on the TV's virtual keyboard. An old wired keyboard helped, but the touch pad was the last straw for web browsing.The TV *is* lightweight, attractive and loaded with features. I have no complaints about the picture, but admittedly I'm not very picky about picture quality. I found recommended settings on the web, augmented by the THX setup from a Blu-Ray disc. Here too, the remote is irritating. One swipe on the touch pad changes only a few points on a hundred point scale, so setting things like contrast and sharpness takes longer than necessary. The screen is quite mirror-like but ok in our room. A bit of dark tape over the shiny X-stand reduced reflections from it. I see some flat black paint in its future.So why keep the TV? I had resigned myself to re-boxing it and returning it, but my spouse counseled otherwise. Our second choice Sony KDL-55W900A is five inches smaller and more expensive, plus this was the second UN60F7100 we'd unboxed and set up. The first unit arrived DOA and had to be exchanged. Neither of us looked forward to a third installation. Samsung 1, users 0.Ultimately, we ignored all of Samsung's smart features, browser, etc. It's now just a nice display with an irritating remote. Hopefully "there's an app for that." We accessed Amazon Instant Video on the PlayStation 3 instead, where setup was easy. Even including a system update, PlayStation account setup and Amazon app download, the PS3 was far easier and faster to use than the Samsung. Netflix appears to be similar. The PS3/Amazon interface is zippy and intuitive. I wish I'd chosen that path initially. Roku would have been third choice. If you value your time (they're not making more of that), as I do, perhaps it's worth looking beyond this Samsung UN60F7100 TV. Hope that's useful.It turned out that the PS3 remote handles all the basic TV functions except 3D and does so more easily and quickly than the touch pad remote.Three months later, I like the TV less - too much nannying. The TV won't let me step past an input whose source has recently powered off until I respond to a prompt - this while trying to select a different input whose source is on. Troubleshooting a loose connection with hands buried in a maze of wires is similarly irritating. Also, the TV shuts itself off inexplicably, typically while the DVR is paused for a few moments. Nothing in the setup seems to prevent this.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Jimmie Dunigan
Reviews.Content: Word cannot say what a great picture this TV has. 3D is unbelievable and we are enjoying it very much.

Reviews.Title: Love the features and picture however,...GET AN EXTENDED WARRANTY!!!
Reviews.Author: S. Campbell
Reviews.Content: Other people have given great reviews for this product's picture and features, and I do agree that this TV is pretty outstanding. My review however, is to offer advice about getting an extended warranty using my case(s) as an example.I've owned a previous Samsung Plasma TV and had it for under 2 years when it developed magenta banding across the screen. (I even wrote a review about it under Samsung PN58C500.) Since it was out of warranty by only a few months mind you, I was out of luck and had to pay for repairs out of pocket. The repairman said it would cost $$$ to get the panel fixed so basically $1800 went down the drain. We vowed NEVER to get another Samsung again. We went shopping for a new TV to replace it and saw this baby. Even though my husband and I swore off Samsung because of the issues with our plasma TV, we fell in love with it because the picture looked awesome compared to the other TVs in the store. We thought long and hard about it, and in the end decided to give Samsung another try.We purchased the UN65F7100 TV on 8/19/13. About 8 days later, my son was watching it when it suddenly turned off, made a loud buzzing sound, started smelling like burnt something, and now will no longer turn on. This TV is 8 days old!!! It's still under the manufacturer's warranty obviously, but given our past 2 circumstances with Samsung, I would advise anyone: DO NOT PURCHASE A SAMSUNG TV WITHOUT AN EXTENDED WARRANTY. I cannot emphasize this enough. The reliability of these expensive TV's are terrible, and doing a simple Google search will show you that an extended warranty is well worth the investment. We've decided to get a 4 year warranty on top of the existing one year manufacturer's warranty because we have little faith in the longevity of any Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV's have serious problems.
Reviews.Author: Kris "Mountain Wizard"
Reviews.Content: I am having issues with a 14 month old Samsung that cost $3000.It is a 65" LCD LED 3 D Samsung.I am in the Costco extended warranty. I made the mistake of not starting with Samsung when the problems first stared a year ago.Random turning itself off. Random on & off.Random rebooting of Smart Hub Firmware.Finally Costco sent someone out for the first time when it was rebooting the Smart Hub every day.They replaced the main board 3+weeks and it was a used board with someone else's idenity logged in, That took over an hour for Samsung customer service to reset remotely. That used board was good for 72 hours then it stared all of the aforementioned problems plus some new ones. It is now over a week and they have yet to "decide" wether they will fix it or not. I have escalated 3 days ago with promise to hear from them by tonight. Which did not happen so Monday, when it be 3 days after they promised to get back to me I will contact them again.Looking a lot like a new TV in my Future. Not much experience with Samsung Support, so they may be OK.The company Costco Concierge service is friendly yet there advise is why I still have a bad TV after 12 months of problems.They told me that the updates, random on / off cycling was normal. Later I discovered this to be incorrect. So waited for it to quite updating so very often. It got worse from 1 or 2x a month to daily failures. Now the first board replacement is obviously used and defective and it is now over 1 week and I am waiting to hear that they will fix it. I have escalated the situation.If this TV creates many more problems I will buy a new one from Costco and exchange them every 89 days until they fix this one or give me a refund.Current reviews seem to be 15-20% of the TV's are having serious problems.Less money and no headaches? The Samsung picture is impressive yet the problems are significant.I think I will go back to buying Vizio. My first 2 Vizio TV's are still working fine and one is over 5 years old.

Reviews.Title: Very Good TV
Reviews.Author: Hyowon
Reviews.Content: Good Price ($1439.99 after price matching!!!!), and Good Performance.(Smart Features, and 3D)Strongly recommend this TV. Go for it!!:)

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN60F7100 60-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Ultra Slim Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: daeil park
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN60F7100 60-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Ultra Slim Smart LED HDTVSamsung UN60F7100 60-Inch 1080p 240Hz 3D Ultra Slim Smart LED HDTVvery Good :)

Reviews.Title: t v is gr8 ,getting it sucked!
Reviews.Author: jeff mitchell
Reviews.Content: ordering the tv was ez,but getting it was not at all what i was expecting,first it took 2 1/2 weeks to finally recieve it,a contact number that was never asked for held up the shipping,then when i finally recieved it ,the power cord was not in the box.had to pay for one seperately or wait another two weeks will definately go to a brick & mortor store next time!

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is poor, and viewing angle is narrow
Reviews.Author: Larson Juhl
Reviews.Content: I was the proud owner of this $1300 set for less than 24 hours. My wife and I thought that the 4 default picture settings (Standard, etc.) were all unacceptable. The colors were wrong, and there was too much back light. Also everything looked slightly fuzzy, and the viewing angle was severely limited. We spent several hours tinkering with all of the settings and finally made a considerable improvement. But when we compared the resulting picture with the one on a nearby 5-year-old Panasonic HD TV which was set up to receive the same signals from DISH network, the Panasonic TV's picture was much better, with warmer, more natural colors and a sharper picture.Therefore today I took the Samsung back to Best Buy and bought a 47-inch Sony KDL47W802A for $1100. The Sony's picture is wonderful, right out of the box, with no tweaking whatsoever. It's at least as good as that of the old Panasonic.  The viewing angle is considerably wider than the Samsung's.It seems that Samsung, in spite of all their innovations and all of the cool features they include with their TV's, still has a long way to go in getting the basic look right.

Reviews.Title: Tv 5 stars samsung service 1 star
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: As long as the tv works great but if you need service from samsung forget it worst people I have ever had to deal with

Reviews.Title: Best TV I ever had
Reviews.Author: Michael Geynisman "MGG"
Reviews.Content: I research the subject of  smart TV for a long time. One can by a decent 55 inch for as low as $799, but I eventually decided to settle on Samsung smart TV. The big issue for me was to decide between 6300 and 7100. Eventually, I bought UN555F7100 at HHGREGG for $1299 on Cyber Monday. I was drawn to double-core processor, native 240Hz and touch remote. I proved to be the right choice. Here are my impressions:1. You need to have a good wired/wireless connection, and eventually I upgraded my home wireless router to provide stable 15 Mbps connection.2. I have home theater system, cable box and DVD and BRay. I connected them with HDMI cables, while hooking sound system with optical cable directly to TV. The setup and performance is super easy and great. The TV audio is ok, but certainly not as good as my Sony system.3. The picture is brilliant in all modes.4. The smart features and remote are absolutely amazing and allows so many features that it takes a lifetime to explain.5. But the real hit for  me was the connectivity to all of my 4 computers via SamsungLink. That allows me now to seamlessly share my audio, video and photo files and play them on the TV screen. How the TV handles playing all variety of video files from my PCs I have no idea, but it does it brilliantly.

Reviews.Title: Very nice smart tv
Reviews.Author: Inaka
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this 46" to replace my 2009 samsung E6000 model unit into my bedroom. Big difference is the display quality is nice and bright but my Samsung plasma PN64E7000 that i use on my living room is excellent in terms of quality of the picture especially to movies.I bought the tv because it is smart so i dont have to use much of my roku, but the apps are a little sluggish. I really thought the dual core would be good enough to run the apps smoothly but it didnt. Which makes me wonder why my plasma tv apps run smoothly and it has a dual core processor also. Playing a movies on your USB thumb drive is also excellent as it picks up "sub" extension file, if your're watching foreign movies and the it can play 1080p downloaded movies, which failed on my old TV.The remote control is cool and slim and has a touchpad. I use a samsung keyboard w/ touchpad on my PN64E7000 unit but this one seems to do the work fairly good enough.I have not use the 3D since my 3d bluray player is connected in my living room so i cant comment on that one yet.The TV interface is much cooler than the 2012 style it is easier to scroll from tv to hdmi to samsung apps.

Reviews.Title: Its good for the price
Reviews.Author: shane
Reviews.Content: I chose this rating based on the processing performance of the tv. The picture is beautiful but  i am not impressed at all with the general processing of simple tasks such as logging into, opening apps such as Netflix and Facebook or just switching between them in SmartHub. I am also disappointed that i was unable to access or use Amazon instant streaming. I haven't used the 3D or watched enough 3d blu-rays to give a review on that aspect just yet. The physical design of the tv though does deserve a nod of approval it is truly ultra slim and the finish is very stylish. I would recommend this tv based on my experience thus far but only if the quad core versions are out of your price range. That is, hoping the quad core processor makes a difference in overall performance.

Reviews.Title: Samsung got the tech
Reviews.Author: marwan
Reviews.Content: Very good only one thing when u whatch back 90s or begining 20s movies look very fake movie lol i mean this tv has lot of tech those movie seems to be very stedio filmApp look ok but skype never come up

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: David Gordon
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research, was going to get 80inch sharp but decided to go a little smaller with much better picture.

Reviews.Title: Best price and super TV
Reviews.Author: Terry R. Williams
Reviews.Content: I had a Samsung DLP that I had repaired myself a couple of times.  It was a 62 inch that I loved when I got it.  After 10 years the power supply was going out on it and I did not want to sink anymore money in parts and time since the TV's have come a long way.. As a gauge I used the customers remarks as a guide to which one I should get.  Some of the early models with all the toys had problems but not this on.  It is a 65 inch but still fit in my cabinet just right.  This picture is so great it almost looks like 3d with out turning on that feature on for a 2d broadcast.  The menu system is easy to work and talking to the remote seems to work pretty good once you learn what it understands.  The internet access works very well.  Unlike some smart TV's it has a browser that you can go anywhere on the internet that you can like a smart phone.  It has more then one tab on the browser so if you get a pop up it is easy to just close the new tab that jumped up at you.  Wired is best using the RJ45 provided but I am close enough to my router that I skipped running the wire to get to it.  Works great on just WIFI.  The price dropped another $300 after I got it and was just outside of the the ability to get a refund on the cheaper price but was still happy at the price I did buy it for.  They did as they said and gave me back 2% on the cost which is what they are doing for everyone.  You can use that money to get a deal on your first 3d Blue ray movie.  I have a 7.1 surround sound system and Samsung Blue ray 3d player.  To goto a movie theater at this point would really be a waste when this system run rings around anything else.As a side note there is 3d content that you can access on Youtube and watch and Verizon in the Tampa bay area has one station on 3d for sports.  The function of using the 2d to 3d does work up to a point but but as good as one that was produced in 3d to begin with.  There is cheaper models and more expensive but I saw not need to spend more and not really see the difference.  After going to a show room and looking at the new 4K tv's they have now I am still happy and think my picture is just as good.  I would stick with the 240 lines of resolution because below that you will see the difference if they are side my side.

Reviews.Title: Great super slim tv!
Reviews.Author: JoJo Dancer
Reviews.Content: This Smart TV is the perfect size for our new studio room.  I've only watched cable tv so far (via the cable box and HDMI), but I've seen the Samsung GUI and it looks amazing, so I'll be trying that as soon as the tv is connected to the internet.  Love the picture quality, the virtually borderless display and the super slim, lightweight design.  This TV has 3D, but that was not a driver for my purchase - I wanted the faster refresh rate that this model offers.This is my second Samsung tv, and I'm very happy with the brand.  Plus, the Amazon service was A+, as usual.

Reviews.Title: Fast, Well Packaged Delivery - Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Don
Reviews.Content: We could have purchased this locally through the Big Box store, but Amazon was a better deal. It came VERY QUICKLY and was well packaged/protected. (OEM box inside larger box with additional packing). We ordered from a/the Big Box Store one time and it only came in OEM box.The TV has features that exceeded our expectations which was to get a unit to replace a fairly new Samsung but with built in Wi-Fi.  This was to allow for a wall installation and cut back on external units (cable box, DVD) showing in the room. We did not expect the TV to integrate the set top cablebox with the menus and remote through the HDMI cable. This was/is a real bonus !We find the new remote very one of the most simple and easy to use of all the remotes we have recently received with other electronics (TV's) , including previous Samsungs. It also has Voice Control which we are still getting used to. It is VERY intuitive.While we did not buy the TV for the 3D features, it does come with four sets of glasses and a 3D mode for a TV mode you can turn off and on.It was easy to set up.Well worth buying on Amazon (as always with many of our purchases)

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Pop-up ads Can't be Disabled
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang Klinker
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture, once set up.So this is a great tv.  It's fast, excellent for sports.  It has low lag, great for gaming.  The picture takes a bit of mucking about deep in the menu, an hour tops, but it is well worth it.  I set up each hdmi port specifically for their purpose, TV, Bluray, and 360.  Minor, but different settings make a big difference in picture quality.The gimmicks are annoying, but easy enough to move beyond.  Netflix, Amazon, and Youtube work as expected.  3d is a joke.  Remote is underwhelming.My big issue is the pop up ads.  I've searched the forums, contacted tech support...there is no way to turn them off.  All smart settings are off and yet I get a persistent Verizon pop up every time I watch football, ugh.  To get rid of the pop ups, I need to get into my router and block a couple of sites...annoying on a $1300 tv to say the least.

Reviews.Title: Same quality, different year.
Reviews.Author: Cameron
Reviews.Content: I am coming from a SamsungUN46D7000 in 2011. This tv is as identical as it gets as the 2011 model. The only differences are the different smart hub, and the remotes. I compared them side by side, and the speed was virtually identical, even favoring the 2011 model. I know that in 2011, the d7000 was the best, but now that it is 2 years later, the f7100 should exceed it.. It is a really great tv, but the quality is virtually the same when seeing both side by side. Overall, for people who do not own the 2011, or 2012 models, this tv is a GREAT buy.

Reviews.Title: The excellent reviews
Reviews.Author: Penny P.
Reviews.Content: The excellent reviews were right on target.  My family and I are very well pleased.  This microwave is all that you would want.  I am so happy I read all of the reviews of previous owners.  That made all the difference in my purchase.  It's one thing to read  an ad from the manufacturer, the real weight comes from those who actually own the product.  Thank you for all who take the time to write a review.

Reviews.Title: good ^^
Reviews.Author: kimdaegyu
Reviews.Content: very goodGood productThere is also good use of the product qualityThe design is good and the price is also very good

Reviews.Title: gomez
Reviews.Content: nice tv it is wat i was loking for nice picture working on wifi  is one of the best tv on the market

Reviews.Title: Great tv but
Reviews.Author: J. Marlow
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture but there is clouding present. Hopefully it will get better over time. Bluray looks outstanding on this set!

Reviews.Title: BUYING A SAMSUNG IS A WASTE OF MONEY
Reviews.Author: don hickey
Reviews.Content: BUYING A SAMSUNG IS A WASTE OF MONEY. Here's why. I paid 2300.00 for my 7100 series Samsung LCD TV thinking I was buying quality. It lasted 5 yrs now at the trash dump. 2000.00 to repair. Have you noticed how many TV repair guys aren't around anymore ? TV's are throwaways like a laptop that you get about 5 years out of them.Advice from repair guy. Buy a set for a 1000.00 range at Costco. For 58.00 more you now have a 5 year warranty. If it lasts longer than 5 years you win. If it becomes toast like my Samsung you still win.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 65 in. Led
Reviews.Author: Jo
Reviews.Content: The picture is not as stunning as I expected it to be, I don't like the stand at all and the remote is to to small.I am used to the larger ones throughout the years, I would rather the tv to come on with the picture instead of having to click on the app to enlarge it.When I try to use the light on the remote it does something weird to the picture and it starts jumping until I pressing the light button again. For the price I expected to be blown away.

Reviews.Title: Great picture/dead in 3 months
Reviews.Author: Mark D. Nobriga
Reviews.Content: Best picture I have ever seen on a tv, but the main board and display board died in about 3 months.  Not worth the 1300 it cost.  Samsung quality leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: The best I've seen (not quite)
Reviews.Author: E. Meiners "pawnslinger"
Reviews.Content: I admit that this is only my 2nd LCD TV, but it is the best picture I've seen.  The internet apps (Netflix and Hulu) work great.  Hard to find any problem to write about.  The only downside is the remote... it is horrible, but as soon as I can get my Harmony re-programmed (this weekend my son is coming to do that) I will be a happy camper.  The remote isn't all bad, but every time I touch it (just slightly) it mutes the TV.  Frustrating.  I guess it is static discharge.  It is the first metal remote I've seen.  All my other remotes have been plastic, like the Harmony.EDITEDOkay, subtract 1 star because the Netflix app just stopped working.  It said I should re-install the app.  I haven't a clue how to do that.  I had to use the Netflix app on my bluray player instead... bummer... and a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: I have never disliked a TV until NOW
Reviews.Author: thegoddess
Reviews.Content: I have owned Sony's and Panasonic's, both Plasma's, LED's and LCD's and never before have I disliked a TV until now. I currently use a Sony Bravia in my living room and bought this Samsung TV for my bedroom. I bought this TV to watch post surgery knowing I would be in bed for several weeks. While I had 30 days to return the TV, I was unfortunately on crutches for 2 months after surgery and just couldn't manage it.While TV shows look great on this Samsung, the first problem I noticed was that films did not look like films. I played several movies from Netflix and while the movies were incredibly sharp, movies (films) looked like video footage, specifically like a daytime soap, that is the movies were too bright and action scenes seemed unnatural due to the built in Clear Motion Rate (CMR) technology. Additionally, black tones were not black. I spent hours going through the settings trying to make color/picture adjustments and did eventually get the grey black tones much darker but there are no settings I could find to get around the CMR. Recently, while comparing a Samsung to a Sony in Best Buy, side by side, it was apparent that the Samsung's colors were washed out and diluted and not nearly as rich as on the Sony so my point is even with picture color adjustments I personally do not believe the color is as good as Sony's due to a lack of depth and or intensity.My second complaint is the interface of the apps. Personally I watch Netflix, Amazon Prime Instant Video, Hula, Vudu, Blockbuster, YouTube, etc and FYI it is not Netflix that makes the final decision on how an app and its interface will function/appear, as each TV manufacturer redesigns these apps; and it seems Samsung took quite a bit of liberty herein. To sum it up I hate the Netflix-Samsung interface on this TV and the YouTube interface is even worst, but that would require a whole other in-depth review just to discuss, suffice to say the alpha numeric keypad, interface, in YouTube is designed very poorly so that the alphabet is in one horizontal row from A-Z meaning you must use your thumb/finger on the trackpad of the remote to navigate back and forth along one long row rather than have rows and columns of letters, a cube, as is the interface on YouTube-Apple TV and Netflix-Apple TV and on my Sony Blu-ray; plus there are a plethora of other Netflix-Samsung interface issues to do with "search" and "categories", but as to what Netflix designed and to what Samsung designed I don't know, I just know that the Samsung interface for Netflix is totally different to my Sony Blu-ray and Apple TV.I also hate the remote control itself. It is the dumbest remote ever. Samsung placed the "mute" button on the left side of the remote so each time you pick it up, your hand accidentally mutes the TV. I have other remotes for other systems and other designers have cleverly placed the "light" button on the left side, to back-light the buttons/keypad so that when you pick up the remote in the dark you FIRSTLY can easily find/feel the light button...in order to see the keypad, but this Samsung remote is so dumb you can't even get to the light button in the dark without accidentally hitting some other another button. Then again if you do manage to find the light button in the dark there is not even enough back-light to see/read what the keys are and whats more is that the back-light only stays on about 5 seconds, so it is useless. I also accidentally hit the trackpad when just attempting to pick up the remote and often times it will either stop my movie or exit me from the movie when all I wanted to do is adjust the volume or add CC. The voice recognition feature would be great if it worked but it takes me more time to use it than to type out my searches even with the exhausting repetitive thumb/finger swiping motion which literally strains my fingers.I also tried to sync a bluetooth keyboard to the TV but my keyboard would not sync so I guess wireless Apple Keyboards are not compatible; so the point is that Samsung sells a keyboard for $99, I guess that's about the only one thats compatible. Also, in the last 6 months this TV as twice wiped out all "my apps" and "pairing" to Netflix and Amazon Prime. Lately I have had so much trouble with the TV that I reset it with Samsung's remote management which is a brilliant service and was helpful after finally getting to someone who could give tech support, unfortunately towards the end, the call dropped and that support call was never finalized, so I can't say I was totally satisfied with it since the support person had my number and could have called me back to complete the session.Lastly I am not a fan of Active 3D and pretty mad at myself for buying a TV with active rather than passive 3D. Active 3D glasses require a battery and are heavier and as I already were prescription eyeglasses I cannot comfortably wear the Active 3D glasses and my eyeglasses, suffice to say the 3D glasses are very uncomfortable! A friend of mine purchased some Sony passive 3D glasses and they were extremely lightweight and extremely comfortable even with my prescription glasses.In the end I don't know of anyone who goes to a store to shop for a TV and say's ok I need to focus on how the remote looks and works and how the 3D glasses fit, no one even looks at those; you worry about the technical specs, the refresh rate, the resolution, the look of the TV, the price, the warranty, etc, but from now on I will be wanting to see every part and accessory before buying a TV and I will want to see its interface to apps. So to sum it up I am very unhappy with the product itself and would not recommend a Samsung TV to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Very Good~~~
Reviews.Author: Jin SeungJun
Reviews.Content: I want big tv. So I research tv. un7500F is very good. It's very Good. If you want Big tv. You will get it

Reviews.Title: poor streaming capability and screen glare
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: The TV is a decent value for the features and price but would caution anyone looking for a high quality product.  The TV seems to have more glare than my previous Sony HDTV of the same size.  The picture is nice , but again not as crisp as my older sony.  I would not recommend this Samsung nor would I buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Not So Great Delivery Service
Reviews.Author: M. Sherman
Reviews.Content: Note: I updated this review to reflect Amazon Customer Service's quick response to a delivery issue.Amazon promised me:"We offer FREE Enhanced Delivery through one of our specialty shippers when you purchase most HDTVs 48 inches or larger from Amazon.com. A representative of a common carrier will deliver your TV to any room suitable for testing, unpack it, ensure that it is working properly to guarantee no damage occurred during transportation, and dispose of all packaging material. "What happened is that I scheduled the delivery time (online) with CEVA, their shipping company, for Aug 28th between 3 and 6pm and arranged to get home early from work.  Unfortunately, the TV was delivered sometime in the morning (before 12noon of the same date).when I was not home.  The delivery men got the doorman to sign for the TV and then high-tailed it out of the building.  I did call Amazon (got an actual phone number through Google) and reached a live person who said that I needed to speak to the customer service team for large appliances.  She offered to transfer me and promptly lost the call.Rather then get even more frustrated, I dragged the 60" TV into my unit (I am on the 1st floor so could have been worse), and got it set up, which was a pain because of the bulk and took me about 90 minutes.I then contacted Amazon customer service by e-mail, and to Amazon's credit, they sent a peronalized (not canned) response indicating that they would deal with the carrier directly and also that they would credit back a  small amount to my charge card to make up for the inconvenience.  So I do commend them on the service recovery.As to the TV, outstanding picture and features - and my wife loves the design.  The TV does have voice response - which is a tad confusing, but very happy with the purchase.The TV is great - based upon 30 min of use - but the service was disappointing.  Recommend the TV but that people buy elsewhere if they care about delivery.

Reviews.Title: Missing 3d glasses inside tv, touch remote is horrible
Reviews.Author: Kevin Chan
Reviews.Content: While my tv arrived in 1 piece. Inside I found out was missing 4 3d tv glasses. 2 months later, I'm still dealing with samsung trying to get my missing 4 3d glasses. I recieved 1 3d glasses so far and 3 package of other crap i wasn't missing because they keep shipping the wrong items. So I'm still waiting on my 3 3d glasses. As for the Tv itself, it works fine. Response time on Tv seem slow. The touch remote is horrible. The pad is too small and not sensitive at all. It feels like using a mouse pad on an old compaq laptop. Needless to say it suck. But the tv picture looks great. If you can look past the missing 3d glasses, the horrible remote and the slow tv response time. Than is a great TV. Unfortunately, hard to look past all that for me.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE SERVICE!!
Reviews.Author: michael fagundes
Reviews.Content: so far I have had so much trouble with the company that is making the arrangements for delivery. 1. They call and left a voicemail one day earlier to tell me that the TV is not at the warehouse (mind you it's been 10 days since my purchase). 2. I called back after being on hold for 15 mins, the employee stated that it's going to be delivered as scheduled. 3. I called the day of to just double check since I thought something wasn't right, well after being on hold for a long time again, a different employee stated that the TV is not even in the warehouse and that I need to wait for a call when it arrives in the warehouse. By then I can set up a delivery date that works for me. This is horrible service! I will revise this review once I get the TV. Has anyone else experienced horrible service from the 3rd party delivery company?

Reviews.Title: Not Happy
Reviews.Author: Steve D.
Reviews.Content: I went through 2 of these TV's.  After 3 weeks the LCD started power cycling.  I got a replacement and that unit had the same issue on the same day!  It also had this bouncing white square go across the top of the screen.  After researching this issue on AVS forums ([...] I found that many where having this problem along with other issues.  I decided to go to a Sharp Elite 60" and not a Samsung.  Disappointing as I have had 3 Sammys previously.

Reviews.Title: Distorted 6 inch image from the top :(
Reviews.Author: Nayana
Reviews.Content: A friend bought this TV for me which arrived today but the top 6 inch of the image is distorted!  The screen is clearly defective.Sucks.  I hope the return process is painless.  Keeping fingers crossed

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for 3 days, Delivery was not the best
Reviews.Author: J. Powers
Reviews.Content: So the TV has been impeccable so far. Amazing on many levels. But if you're buying a TV at this level, you wouldn't expect anything less. I was advised by Amazon that it would be a "white glove" delivery where the agent would unbox, check the operation and offer to remove the packing material.Well, Pilot unboxed the unit and checked the power, but beyond that they were worthless and even destructive. There were two guys in the truck, but only one came in the home to help. I ended up helping the delivery guy unbox the unit. The only extra that I asked him was to help me move the 55" LCD TV 5 feet from it's previous location. No other assistance was offered or provided.I tipped the guy $20, and on his way out the door, he broke my security door auto closer by forcing it closed. You have to push it outward first to release the mechanism. There went another $20 on Amazon. The guy could have cared less and based on his demeanor, I just wanted him out of my house. Pilot sucks and Amazon should reconsider their relationship with them.Disregard all of the aforementioned things about the TV being awesome. It failed catastrophically tonight. It would appear the power source failed. I could smell it after it died. I had the TV hooked up to excellent surge protection so this was obviously a manufacturer defect. The worst part is that I had just finished the wall mount, Harmony config, etc last night. Not cool.

Reviews.Title: Delivery suspect.
Reviews.Author: Melissa Cruise
Reviews.Content: I have no idea about the quality of the TV, but I do know that the delivery is shady. A company called CEVA was to deliver my tv today. The window for scheduled delivery has lapsed and there is no one answering the phone. Google CEVA and Amazon and read all the negative comments before you decide to purchase via Amazon. I wish I had!

Reviews.Title: NO SKYPE CAMERA INCLUDED AS EXPECTED
Reviews.Author: GBJAQUES
Reviews.Content: Was only disappointed at the lack of a camera for Skype use.  Noted the Skype logoincluded in the ads for the TV to find that only the software and not the necessary camerawas included.  Sorta felt like a bait and switch to find the add on camera onlyavailable from Samsung was another $100!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: M. Giles "gadget nut"
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately there isn't enough information to have a clear understanding of the product--especially the controls.  I'm still moving from one channel to another--one at a time--and have no control over size of the picture, etc.  I guess it can show blu-ray and vhs, movies too.  Not yet.  Thanks for nothing.

Reviews.Title: TV good, delivery dissapointing..
Reviews.Author: Interested
Reviews.Content: I like the TV.  There were a few suggestions on how to tweak the settings here in the reviews, but I ultimately found the factory settings, with just a few changes (increasing sharpness among them) to result in the best picture.  I could never get used to the "soap opera effect" caused by turning on the 240Hz feature, so I wished I had purchased the less expensive model which didn't have this specification.  Taking work off to wait for the delivery wasn't easy, and to be called at the exact time the TV was scheduled to be delivered (by Ceva/Eagle) and told that "the truck never came in this morning," was even harder.  I had scheduled the delivery about 10 days out and so was confused to why it couldn't be delivered when promised, and why I couldn't have gotten some advanced notice about the cancellation.  I then had to schedule it for a different day, which meant I lost another few hundred dollars as I don't get paid when I don't come to work.  When I contacted Amazon about the issue, they compensated me, but only a fraction of the income and inconvenience it cost.  Therefore, only three stars.

Reviews.Title: ITEM DEFECTIVE
Reviews.Author: Nancy Arenal
Reviews.Content: This expensive tv is defective as it turns off every after 5minutes of watching. I do not want this repaired. This is a brand new $2,000.++ TV. I want my money back.I do not see the point of you not accepting a return without the box when AMAZON and SAMSUNG doesn't have any problems with the same item at all. YOU SOLD A DEFECTIVE ITEM YET YOU DO NOT WANT TO HONOR YOUR DUTY AS A REPUTABLE SELLER BY NOT ACCEPTING A RETURN. YOU, MR RYAN LANE, DOESNT KNOW HOW TO HANDLE CUSTOMER SERVICE PROBLEMS...AT ALL!I PERSONALLY DO NOT RECOMMEND ANY ITEMS BOUGHT FROM OneCall. THEY HAVE A VERY POOR CUSTOMER RELATION COMMUNICATION AND DEFECTIVE ITEMS YOU SELL ARE CANNOT BE RETURNED WITHOUT THE BOX!FYI! This is the e-mail i received from Amazon with NO PROBLEMS WHATSOEVER!Because the TV was defective, we'll pay for the return shipping costs. Please do your best to disassemble the item and package it for return transit. It doesn't necessarily need to be returned in the same package it was delivered in. Feel free to use multiple boxes if needed. Once the shipment is picked up, it can take up to 2 weeks for us to receive and process your return.When we receive your return, we'll issue a refund and send you an e-mail confirming the refund amount.I hope this helps. We look forward to seeing you again soon.Best regards,Cris C.

Reviews.Title: WEB Speed is super Slow.
Reviews.Author: Luisagos
Reviews.Content: I brought this TV, UN65F7100.After spending many hours, and talking with Samsung.All Samsung Smart TV WEB browsers are super slow.YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO STEAM ANYTHING FROM THE WEB PART OF THE TV.They told me to use a laptop and use the HDMI port, are you kidding me?Its a limitation from them, nothing to do about your Network Speed.I return my TV, and going to find a different band.Hope this helps all of you.

Reviews.Title: Universal remote doesn't sync with Bose Cinemate Series II home theater
Reviews.Author: N. C. Glenos
Reviews.Content: My biggest complaint is that the "smart" universal remote doesn't sync with my Bose Cinemate Series II.  So I'm still stuck using multiple remotes.  Customer service was no help.  Not too smart.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED Products Suffer huge Clouding/Flashlighting Problems
Reviews.Author: Charles A. Robinson
Reviews.Content: Samsung LED Products Suffer huge Clouding/Flashlighting Problems.  They will not replace them under warranty and say they are normal.  Buyer beware -- be sure to Google Samsung LED clouding and Samsung LED Flashlighting before purchase!Check out this Google images link for examples:[...]

Reviews.Title: Leaves much to be desired
Reviews.Author: Donbie "donbie"
Reviews.Content: 30 day update.  Downgraded from 2 stars to 1.  The screen has incredible glare and can easily be used as a full length mirror.  If your room has any light source, shop around as this is distracting.  The 'smart' is anything but.  The set continually failed to recognize my home theater system, in part, because it redirected the HDMI input automatically to the wrong input with no ability to change.  Finally, I connected the DirecTV receiver directly to the TV and bypassed the Home Theater System as the only to get the TV to continually recognize the DirecTV receiver.  This then required a separate sound connection since I don't use the TV as a source for the sound.  I can't possibly understand the positive reviews.  Perhaps many of these buyers never had a quality TV before.  As I said earlier, technical support were very undertrained.  One did not understand the basics of connecting components and the other took control of my set for over an hour without success.  Do yourself a favor and check out Sharp, Sony, and others.Upgraded from a 50 inch Sharp that was about 5 years old.  Picture not as clear, much more glare...overall nice picture but nothing you can't get elsewhere.  My setup was very complicated.  It recognized all my components but continually set my home theater to the wrong input...very difficult to correct.  Customer support was incompetent.  Untrained and unknowlagable staffing.  One person didn't understand basic component setup and said there was no one more capable at Samsung and refused to transfer me.  Called back to get another rep and this one controlled my set for an hour and could not get the configuration corrected.  Finally figured it our myself by trial and error.  Touch remote a bad design.  Touch screen is a poor excuse for 4 directional buttons and a select button but much more cumbersome.  This was definitely not designed by Apple.

Reviews.Title: wireless is not work
Reviews.Author: kuritashun
Reviews.Content: this TV wireless connection is very bad.  i couldn't use the Wi-fi to watch the internet TV. very slow and

Reviews.Title: Stay away from Samsung TV's.
Reviews.Author: Just Sayin'
Reviews.Content: *****W A R N I N G*****Do not buy SAMSUNG Televisions!!!  After the one year warranty period SAMSUNG Television screens tend to show burn-in and ghosting with horizontal lines, along with very heavy distortion of picture on right side side of screen.  This problem is systemic in all their LCD's and LED's.  Consumer's have complained all over the internet.  There are even numerous Youtube postings with the exact same problems in my DEFECTIVE SAMSUNG model, as well as other models.  This defect occurs on start-up and lasts for the first 15 minutes of trying to view a program. Then the picture progressively declines.I tried SAMSUNG's Executive Customer Relations Dept. and was told:  "We will do nothing but refer you to a local Authorized Repair Shop."  They were downright blunt and rude to boot!  I feel robbed of $2,900.00The repair will consist of a diagnosis visit, and then another visit to install a replacement "Panel"......all told, another $1,000.00SAMSUNG customer service also told me that their Televisions depreciate at 20% per year.

Reviews.Title: TV was DOA at 15 months
Reviews.Author: Germinator
Reviews.Content: Do not buy Samsung!! After 15 months I had a vertical purple color line appear on my TV, 3 months AFTER the warranty expired. Samsung would not fix the TV but offered to pay for "labor".  Well the parts costs $1000 so basically my $1500 TV was DOA after 15 months.Stay away!! Search the internet for reviews or make sure you buy an extended warranty!!

Reviews.Title: Love the tv HATED the delivery service in my area
Reviews.Author: DC
Reviews.Content: I love the tv and no need to leave my personal review, HOWEVER, the delivery service was TERRIBLE!  I live in northern NJ and was notified by Amazon/Modia via email with a link to track the tv.  The delivery service NEVER reached out to me to set up a delivery time or to verify my phone #.  I noticed that the tv was at the delivery station so i called them to see what the status was and the girl there said, "what day would you like the tv delivered?"  she then read out an old phone # of mine that they found on the internet and i updated her with my new number that i have had for over 5 years.  the day of delivery the driver would call ahead to confirm with me.  it was scheduled for 10am-2pm.  i called around 11 am noticing that on their website that they attempted delivery.  i called the girl back and she repeated my number back that was absolutely wrong.  After a half hour she called back and said to call the driver.  i drove a half our out of my way to pick up the tv because i could not take 2 days in row off from work.  it turned out the driver never had my updated phone #.  I WILL NEVER ORDER A BIG ITEM ON AMAZON AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre picture, terrible software and controls
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: This is a very bad television.Pros:Nice industrial design, really like the stand and have received compliments on it.Picture quality is adequate at times, however blacks are atrocious and there is severe back-light bleed.  Also, natural light really washes out the picture and makes it essentially unwatchable during the daytime.Cons:Terrible software:When it first arrived none of the Apps were loaded nor could I manually load them.  I had to call their help desk to get this straightened out, I don't remember what the remedy but it involved lots of time and aggravation.Apps simply do not launch, specifically Amazon VOD. It will just go to a never ending black screen with no error message or any indication of what's wrong. Sometimes the App does launch and there is much rejoicing (but performs abysmally).  This is on a 50gb internet connection by the way.Comically bad remote:One couldn't design a worse remote of they tried.  It's very slow and difficult simply navigating across a grid let alone using it as a keyboard.  This if forgivable as you DO NOT WANT TO USE THEIR SMART TV anyway if you can.  I wish I could be reimbursed aka 'Opt Out' of Samsung's Smart TV and the associated R&D; cost.  Anyway, this remote is obviously a sales gimmick and a huge slap in the face to their paying customers.  Overall it is a remarkable combination of unresponsive, imprecise, and extremely slow.Input lag:Measured in the 100s of milliseconds.  You can forget about playing video games.Conclusions:I will never by a Samsung product again let alone their televisions.  Samsung seems to be good at ordering LED panels and processing said panels at their facilities.  Please stick to just this Samsung, don't write software or try to do anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS TV!!!
Reviews.Author: PhishinUA
Reviews.Content: At first this TV has an amazing picture and some great features. Then, 18 months down the road, you will lose color and it will be an expensive waste of money. Samsung will not care because it's past the one year mark.Honestly, DO NOT BUY THIS TV or you will be in my same situation a little while down the road.P.S. The customer service is a joke as well.

Reviews.Title: The Ro.....
Reviews.Author: Cadesia
Reviews.Content: The Road Not TakenBY ROBERT FROSTTwo roads diverged in a yellow wood,And sorry I could not travel bothAnd be one traveler, long I stoodAnd looked down one as far as I couldTo where it bent in the undergrowth;Then took the other, as just as fair,And having perhaps the better claim,Because it was grassy and wanted wear;Though as for that the passing thereHad worn them really about the same,And both that morning equally layIn leaves no step had trodden black.Oh, I kept the first for another day!Yet knowing how way leads on to way,I doubted if I should ever come back.I shall be telling this with a sighSomewhere ages and ages hence:Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by,And that has made all the difference.

Reviews.Title: Such a disapointment
Reviews.Author: Dariush Davani
Reviews.Content: I bought this a Christmas gift and had it shipped to Canada, since amazon wouldn't ship to Toronto.  I thought it would be a good price for the value, turns out, it is sold for the same price from a local Bestbuy for the same price in a better package. The latter package contains wireless keyboard which replaces the useless remote control. Amazon is advertizing free membership on prime with the purchase of this TV without excluding any geographical location. I tried to instal the amazon instant, however it did not connect. Overall, I am disappointed with amazon and Samsung and I wouldn't recommend either of them.Regards,DD

Reviews.Title: Defective out of the box
Reviews.Author: Steven Miller
Reviews.Content: Television never worked from day one. Samsung customer service is the worst customer service that I have ever experienced. They denied any responsibility for their product. I am stuck with a television that does not work

Reviews.Title: The Information might be deceiving
Reviews.Author: KHALDOUN ABOUASSI
Reviews.Content: A Samsung salesperson sold us on this TV claiming that it will substituting for operating the cable box as long as it is connected to the cable box. The salesperson even asked the retail store agent to verify the information online, which said the same.After paying the high price for this TV, it turns out that you can only change the channels using the TV remote control. However, you cannot record any programs; you need to use the cable box and its remote control for that and to access the recorded shows.Getting away without using the cablebox is basically the main reason we wanted to buy this TV. Now we realize that we were deceived.

Reviews.Title: REMOTE PROBLEMS NOT CLEAR ON BATTER REPLACEMET !
Reviews.Author: LEVI   RALPH   KOHR
Reviews.Content: ANOTHER CASE OF A CO. THAT HAS NOT HEARD OF  "KISS" THE REMOTE IS SO THIN AND YOU CAN NOT PRESS THE FORWARD OR UP DOWN BUTTENS !  IT IS LETS ADD THIS OR THAT!

Reviews.Title: Discriminates against older people....  DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Scornful Rose
Reviews.Content: TV was purchased for an 85 year old. TV does not come with a standard remote, it comes with the smaller slippery remote that has no numbers on it.Called samsung for an exchange for the regular remote. The customer rep stated that there would be an extra charge. Huh? We just spent over $1200 for the TV and they can't exchange the smart remote for the regular remote so an 85 year old person can use it??? This is discrimination against older people!The TV was sent back and we bought a different brand. I'm not going to buy a product from a company that so blatantly discriminates against older people.
